search help getting started the inline xbrl viewer allows user to quickly easily review detail of the tagged information in inline document automatically placing top and bottom highlight border around tagged numeric fact and left and right border each block tagged fact hovering over tagged fact will highlight shade all content related to the tagged fact and clicking on tagged fact will reveal tagging detail in the fact review window navigation search and filter option also provided to easily refine and identify specific type of tagged information fact review window the fact review window show the tagging detail for the currently selected fact is highlighted solid blue border are four category of fact detail which can be viewed an value indicates there is available information for the item within the given category attribute all primary information applicable describing the tagged fact including period sign decimal dimensional detail ax and member scale measure and data type label detailed documentation definition for the tag used and label reference authoritative reference information applicable for the selected tag calculation balance and calculation hierarchy detail numeric non dimensioned item only searching there are two way to search the document fact and section to search information enter keyword in search box and select the magnifying glass icon to return matching result search operator and via and and or via or or are available to refine search fact the search fact box can be used to find tagged fact matching entered keywords by default tag name tag label and tagged content are included in search tagged fact matching the search criterion are shown with yellow colored default shading on the page and appear in the fact list select the button to the left of the magnifying glass icon to clear the search the content included in search can be increased to included tag definition dimension and authoritative reference by selecting the cog wheel icon to the left of the search box see setting for more information section the search section box can be used to filter the tagged section of the financial statement filter filter change the number of highlighted fact and item in the fact list by providing several way to review and pinpoint certain tagged information multiple filter can be used data filter these filter option allow the user to refine the highlighted tagged fact by data type all display all tagged data default amount only numeric fact only text only textual fact only calculation only numeric fact participating in calculation only negative only negative numeric amount only additional item only tagged fact without corresponding html presentation hidden fact only tag filter these filter allow the user to refine the highlighted fact by tag type all display all tagged data default standard only fact with standard tag common taxonomy us_gaap ifrs dei custom only fact with extension custom tag unique to the entity document more filter additional filter allow user to further refine the highlighted fact period list of all used context year and reporting period measure list of all used unit of measure dollar applicable axis list of all used axis dimension applicable dimension applicable scale list of all used scaled option thousand million applicable balance debit credit applicable multiple filter work in conjunction with each other for example selecting the amount only data filter and custom only tag filter will highlight only numeric tagged fact using custom tag and list in the fact list active filter are displayed in the filter toolbar are selected active filter can be removed individually by unchecking or selecting all option for each filter or all at once via the reset all filter option fact list result on the toolbar select the count to the right of the word fact fact to reveal the fact list result navigable listing of all currently highlighted tagged fact the count represents the current number of fact by default all tagged fact are displayed in the fact list result the list content and count reflects the currently highlighted fact filter and search criterion refine the list to match the highlighted tagged fact navigation control are available to move the list well move the current view to the corresponding highlighted fact location automatically fact in the fact result list is selected will reveal the fact review window certain letter may appear to the right of an item in the fact result list to indicate certain property the letter appears for fact it indicates the fact is additional data hidden with potentially no corresponding html presentation if the letter appears the fact is tagged with custom tag if the letter appears the fact is tagged with dimensional information section the section toolbar item provides listing of the tagged section of the inline document section are divided three group document entity information financial statement note to the financial statement by expanding group and selecting section item in the listing inline xbrl viewer will navigate to that section when the tagged section feature is open the search section box will additionally filter the list of section to only section that match the entered criterion menu information the information menu item provides additional detail the current inline document and customizable viewer setting company and document basic company and document information tag fact and tag standard and custom information file file used additional item additional hidden data that tagged potentially corresponding location in the html save xbrl instance the save xbrl instance menu item allows an xbrl instance document xml that is extracted from the inline document to be saved locally for use by software supporting the xbrl format save xbrl zip the save xbrl zip menu item allows zip file zip that contains the provided xbrl instance document and related custom taxonomy file to be saved locally setting the setting menu item provides the ability to customize viewer feature tagged fact hover on display the hover fact review window for any tagged fact hide the hover fact review window for any tagged fact default may impact performance with certain web browser auto scrolling position this setting will have no effect on ie or safari top selecting fact from the section menu or the fact menu will automatically scroll that element to the top of the inline xbrl viewer window default center selecting fact from the section menu or the fact menu will automatically scroll that element to the middle of the inline xbrl viewer window highlight color use the save and reset button to save the selected setting or reset to default tagged data change the highlight color of the tagged fact border search result change the background color of tagged item matching the search result selected fact change the color of highlight border used to identify the currently selected fact tag shading hover change the color of the shading applied to tagged data on hover search option match case match the specific case of the entered search keyword include label extends search to include tag label include definition extends search to include tag definition include dimension extends search to include dimensional detail include reference extends search to include authoritative reference information optionally specify the reference part to include in the search topic subtopic section help this content version indicates the current build of the inline xbrl viewer application fact above and risk factor each respective business result of operation and managing global risk including managing global risk other risk country risk russia below citi consent order complianceciti ha embarked on multiyear transformation with the target outcome to change citi business and operating model such that they simultaneously strengthen risk and control and improve citi value to customer client and shareholder this includes effort to effectively implement the october federal reserve board frb and office of the comptroller of the currency occ consent order issued to citigroup and citibank respectively in the second quarter of citi made an initial submission to the occ and submitted it plan to address the consent order to both regulator during the third quarter of citi continues to work constructively with the regulator and provides to both regulator on an ongoing basis additional information regarding it plan and progress citi will continue to reflect their feedback in it project plan and execution effort discussed above citi effort include continued investment in it transformation including the remediation of it consent order citi ceo ha made the strengthening of citi risk and control environment strategic priority and ha established chief administrative officer organization to centralize program management in addition the citigroup and citibank board of director each formed transformation oversight committee an ad hoc committee of each board to provide oversight of management remediation effort under the consent order the citi board of director ha determined that citi plan are responsive to the company objective and that progress continues to be made on execution of the plan for additional information about the consent order see client group institutional client group icg includes service market and banking for additional information on these business see citigroup operating segment above icg provides corporate institutional and public sector client around the world with full range of wholesale banking product and service including fixed income and equity sale and trading foreign exchange prime brokerage derivative service equity and fixed income research corporate lending investment banking and advisory service cash management trade finance and security service icg transacts with client in both cash instrument and derivative including fixed income foreign currency equity and commodity product icg revenue is generated primarily from fee and spread associated with these activity icg earns fee income for assisting client with transactional service and clearing and providing brokerage and investment banking service and other such activity such fee are recognized at the point in time when citigroup performance under the term of contractual arrangement is completed which is typically at the trade execution date or closing of transaction revenue generated from these activity is recorded in commission and fee and investment banking fee revenue is also generated from asset under custody and administration which is recognized when the associated promised service is satisfied which normally occurs at the point in time the service is requested by the customer and provided by citi revenue generated from these activity is primarily recorded in administration and other fiduciary fee for additional information on these various type of revenue see note in addition market maker icg facilitates transaction including holding product inventory to meet client demand and earns the differential the price at which it buy and sell the product these price differential and the unrealized gain and loss on the inventory are recorded in principal transaction mark to market gain and loss on certain credit derivative used to economically hedge the corporate loan portfolio are also recorded in principal transaction for additional information on principal transaction revenue see note other primarily includes realized gain and loss on available for sale afs debt security gain and loss on equity security not held in trading account and other non recurring gain and loss interest income earned on asset held le interest paid on long and short term debt secured funding transaction and customer deposit is recorded net interest income the amount and type of market revenue are impacted by variety of interrelated factor including market liquidity change in market variable such interest rate foreign exchange rate equity price commodity price and credit spread well their implied volatility investor confidence and other macroeconomic condition assuming all other market condition not change increase in client activity level or bid offer spread generally result in increase in revenue however change in market condition can significantly impact client activity level bid offer spread and the fair value of product inventory for example decrease in market liquidity may increase bid offer spread decrease client activity level and widen credit spread on product inventory position icg management of the market business involves daily monitoring and evaluation of the above factor at the trading desk well the country level in the market business client revenue are those revenue directly attributable to client transaction at the time of inception including commission interest or fee earned client revenue do not include the result of client facilitation activity holding product inventory in anticipation of client demand or the result of certain economic hedging activity icg international presence is supported by trading floor in approximately country and proprietary network in country and jurisdiction previously disclosed citi intends to end nearly all of the institutional banking service it offer in russia by the end of the first quarter of going forward citi only operation in russia will be those necessary to fulfill it remaining legal and regulatory obligation at this time the estimated cost to be incurred in relation to this action is approximately million excluding the impact from any portfolio sale primarily through for additional information about citi continued effort to reduce it operation and exposure in russia see legacy franchise and managing global risk other risk country risk russia below at december icg had trillion in future result see executive summary above and risk factor below resourcesoverviewcapital is used principally to support asset in citi business and to absorb potential loss including credit market and operational loss citi primarily generates capital through earnings from it operating business citi may augment it capital through issuance of common stock and noncumulative perpetual preferred stock among other issuance further citi capital level may also be affected by change in accounting and regulatory standard well the impact of future event on citi business result such the signing or closing of cta loss see executive summary above and risk factor strategic risk and operational risk below capital managementciti capital management framework is designed to ensure that citigroup and it principal subsidiary maintain sufficient capital consistent with each entity respective risk profile management target and all applicable regulatory standard and guideline citi ass it capital adequacy against series of internal quantitative capital goal designed to evaluate it capital level in expected and stressed economic environment underlying these internal quantitative capital goal are strategic capital consideration centered on preserving and building financial strength the citigroup capital committee with oversight from the risk management committee of citigroup board of director ha responsibility for citi aggregate capital structure including the capital assessment and planning process which is integrated into citi capital plan balance sheet management including oversight of capital adequacy for citigroup and it subsidiary is governed by each entity asset and liability committee where applicable for additional information regarding citi capital planning and stress testing exercise see stress testing component of capital planning below current regulatory capital standardsciti is subject to regulatory capital rule issued by the federal reserve board frb in coordination with the occ and fdic including the implementation of the basel iii rule for information on potential change to the basel iii rule see basel iii revision below these rule establish an integrated capital adequacy framework encompassing both risk based capital ratio and leverage ratio risk based capital ratiosthe basel iii rule set forth the composition of regulatory capital including the application of regulatory capital adjustment and deduction well two comprehensive methodology standardized approach and advanced approach for measuring total risk weighted asset total risk weighted asset under the standardized approach include credit and market risk weighted asset which are generally prescribed supervisory risk weight total risk weighted asset under the advanced approach which are primarily model based include credit market and operational risk weighted asset result credit risk weighted asset calculated under the advanced approach are more risk sensitive than those calculated under the standardized approach market risk weighted asset are currently calculated on generally consistent basis under both the standardized and advanced approach the standardized approach doe not include operational risk weighted asset under the basel iii rule citigroup is required to maintain several regulatory capital buffer above the stated minimum capital requirement to avoid certain limitation on capital distribution and discretionary bonus payment to executive officer accordingly for the fourth quarter of citigroup required regulatory capital ratio wa under the standardized approach incorporating it stress capital buffer of and gsib global systemically important bank surcharge of and under the advanced approach inclusive of the fixed capital conservation buffer and gsib surcharge of in addition commencing january citi gsib surcharge increased from to which is applicable to both the standardized and advanced approach resulting in required capital ratio of under the standardized approach and under the advanced approach both of such date for additional information see gsib surcharge below similarly citigroup primary subsidiary citibank citibank is required to maintain minimum regulatory capital ratio plus applicable regulatory buffer well hold sufficient capital to be considered well capitalized under the prompt corrective action framework in effect citibank required capital ratio wa under both the standardized and advanced approach which is the sum of the minimum requirement and fixed capital conservation buffer for additional information see regulatory capital buffer and prompt corrective action framework below further the basel iii rule implement the capital floor provision of the dodd frank act the called collins amendment which requires banking organization to calculate generally applicable capital requirement result citi must calculate each of the three risk based capital ratio capital tier capital and total capital under both the standardized approach and the advanced approach and comply with the more binding of each of the resulting risk based capital ratio leverage ratiounder the basel iii rule citigroup is also required to maintain minimum tier leverage ratio of similarly citibank is required to maintain minimum tier leverage ratio of to be considered well capitalized under the prompt corrective action framework the tier leverage ratio non risk based measure of capital adequacy is defined tier capital percentage of quarterly adjusted average total asset le amount deducted from tier capital supplementary leverage ratiociti is also required to calculate supplementary leverage ratio slr which differs from the tier leverage ratio by including certain off balance sheet exposure within the denominator of the ratio total leverage exposure the slr represents end of period tier capital to total leverage exposure total leverage exposure is defined the sum of the daily average of on balance sheet asset for the quarter and ii the average of certain off balance sheet exposure calculated of the last day of each month in the quarter le applicable tier capital deduction advanced approach banking organization are required to maintain stated minimum slr of further gsibs including citigroup are subject to leverage buffer in addition to the stated minimum slr requirement resulting in slr if gsib fails to exceed this requirement it will be subject to increasingly stringent restriction depending upon the extent of the shortfall on capital distribution and discretionary executive bonus payment similarly citibank is required to maintain minimum slr of to be considered well capitalized under the prompt corrective action framework regulatory capital treatment modified transition of the current expected credit loss methodologyin the banking agency issued final rule that modified the regulatory capital transition provision related to the current expected credit loss cecl methodology the rule doe not have any impact on gaap accounting the rule permitted bank to delay for two year the day one adverse regulatory capital effect resulting from adoption of the cecl methodology on january until january followed by three year transition to phase the regulatory capital benefit provided by the delay in addition for the ongoing impact of cecl the agency utilized scaling factor an approximation of the increased reserve build under cecl compared to the previous incurred loss model and therefore allowed bank to add back to capital an amount equal to of the change in cecl based allowance in each quarter between january and december beginning january the cumulative change in cecl based allowance between january and december started to be phased in to regulatory capital at per year on january of each year over the three year transition period and ii along with the delayed day one impact citigroup and citibank elected the modified cecl transition provision provided by the rule accordingly the day one regulatory capital effect resulting from adoption of the cecl methodology well the ongoing adjustment for of the change in cecl based allowance in each quarter between january and december started to be phased in on january and will be fully reflected in citi regulatory capital of january of december citigroup reported capital ratio of benefited from the deferral of the cecl transition provision by basis point for additional information on citigroup and citibank regulatory capital ratio excluding the impact of the cecl transition provision see capital resource full adoption of cecl below regulatory capital bufferscitigroup and citibank are required to maintain several regulatory capital buffer above the stated minimum capital requirement these capital buffer would be available to absorb loss in advance of any potential impairment of regulatory capital below the stated minimum regulatory capital ratio requirement banking organization that fall below their regulatory capital buffer are subject to limitation on capital distribution and discretionary bonus payment to executive officer based on percentage of eligible retained income eri with increasing restriction based upon the severity of the breach eri is equal to the greater of the bank net income for the four calendar quarter preceding the current calendar quarter net of any distribution and tax effect not already reflected in net income and ii the average of the bank net income for the four calendar quarter preceding the current calendar quarter of december citi regulatory capital ratio exceeded the regulatory capital requirement accordingly citi is not subject to payout limitation result of the basel iii requirement stress capital buffercitigroup is subject to the frb stress capital buffer scb rule which integrates the annual stress testing requirement with ongoing regulatory capital requirement the scb equal the peak to trough capital ratio decline under the supervisory severely adverse scenario over nine quarter period used in the comprehensive capital analysis and review ccar and dodd frank act stress testing dfast plus four quarter of planned common stock dividend subject to floor of scb based capital requirement are reviewed and updated annually by the frb part of the ccar process for additional information regarding ccar and dfast see stress testing component of capital planning below the fixed capital conservation buffer will continue to apply under the advanced approach for additional information see below in august the frb finalized and announced citi scb requirement of for the four quarter window starting from october to september accordingly of october citi is required to maintain an required regulatory capital ratio under the standardized approach incorporating this scb and it gsib surcharge of previously from october through september citi had been subject to scb and required regulatory capital ratio the standardized approach citi required regulatory capital ratio under the advanced approach using the fixed capital conservation buffer remains unchanged at the scb applies to citigroup only the regulatory capital framework applicable to citibank including the capital conservation buffer is unaffected by citigroup scb capital conservation buffer and countercyclical capital buffercitigroup is subject to fixed capital conservation buffer under the advanced approach citibank is subject to the fixed capital conservation buffer under both the advanced approach and the standardized approach in addition advanced approach banking organization such citigroup and citibank are subject to discretionary countercyclical capital buffer the countercyclical capital buffer is currently set at by the banking agency gsib surchargethe frb imposes risk based capital surcharge upon bank holding company that are identified gsibs including citi the gsib surcharge augments the scb capital conservation buffer and if invoked any countercyclical capital buffer bank holding company that is designated gsib is required on an annual basis to calculate surcharge using two method and is subject to the higher of the resulting two surcharge the first method method is based on the basel committee gsib methodology under the second method method the substitutability category under the basel committee gsib methodology is replaced with quantitative measure intended to ass gsib reliance on short term wholesale funding in addition method incorporates relative measure of systemic importance across certain global banking organization and year end spot foreign exchange rate whereas method us fixed measure of systemic importance and application of an average foreign exchange rate over three year period the gsib surcharge calculated under both method and method are based on measure of systemic importance from the year immediately preceding that in which the gsib surcharge calculation are performed the method and method gsib surcharge calculated during will be based on systemic indicator data generally citi surcharge determined under method will result in higher surcharge than it surcharge determined under method gsib systemic importance change year over year such that it becomes subject to higher gsib surcharge the higher surcharge would become effective on january of the year that is one full calendar year after the increased gsib surcharge wa calculated higher surcharge calculated in using data of december would not become effective until january however if gsib systemic importance change such that the gsib would be subject to lower surcharge the gsib would be subject to the lower surcharge on january of the year immediately following the calendar year in which the decreased gsib surcharge wa calculated lower surcharge calculated in using data of december would become effective january the following table present citi effective gsib surcharge determined under method and method during and method citi gsib surcharge effective during both and wa derived under the higher method result citi gsib surcharge effective for ha increased from to derived under the higher method result citi expects that it method gsib surcharge will continue to remain higher than it method gsib surcharge accordingly based on citi method result of december and it estimated method result of december citi gsib surcharge is expected to remain at effective january citi gsib surcharge effective for will likely be based on the lower of it method score for year end and and therefore is not expected to exceed prompt corrective action frameworkin general the prompt corrective action pca regulation direct the banking agency to enforce increasingly strict limitation on the activity of insured depository institution that fail to meet certain regulatory capital threshold the pca framework contains five category of capital adequacy measured by risk based capital and leverage ratio well capitalized ii adequately capitalized iii undercapitalized iv significantly undercapitalized and critically undercapitalized accordingly an insured depository institution such citibank must maintain minimum capital tier capital total capital and tier leverage ratio of and respectively to be considered well capitalized in addition insured depository institution subsidiary of gsibs including citibank must maintain minimum supplementary leverage ratio of to be considered well capitalized citibank wa well capitalized of december furthermore to be well capitalized under current federal bank regulatory agency definition bank holding company must have tier capital ratio of at least total capital ratio of at least and not be subject to frb directive to maintain higher capital level testing component of capital planningciti is subject to an annual assessment by the frb to whether citigroup ha effective capital planning process well sufficient regulatory capital to absorb loss during stressful economic and financial condition also meeting obligation to creditor and counterparties and continuing to serve credit intermediary this annual assessment includes two related program the comprehensive capital analysis and review ccar and dodd frank act stress testing dfast for the largest and most complex firm such citi ccar includes qualitative evaluation of firm ability to determine it capital need on forward looking basis in conducting the qualitative assessment the frb evaluates firm capital planning practice focusing on six area of capital planning governance risk management internal control capital policy incorporating stressful condition and event and estimating impact on capital position part of the ccar process the frb evaluates citi capital adequacy capital adequacy process and it planned capital distribution such dividend payment and common share repurchase the frb ass whether citi ha sufficient capital to continue operation throughout time of economic and financial market stress and whether citi ha robust forward looking capital planning process that account for it unique risk all ccar firm including citi are subject to rigorous evaluation of their capital planning process firm with weak practice may be subject to deficient supervisory rating and potentially an enforcement action for failing to meet supervisory expectation for additional information regarding ccar see risk factor strategic risk below dfast is forward looking quantitative evaluation of the impact of stressful economic and financial market condition on citi regulatory capital this program serf to inform the frb and the general public to citi regulatory capital ratio might change using hypothetical set of adverse economic condition designed by the frb in addition to the annual supervisory stress test conducted by the frb citi is required to conduct annual company run stress test under the same adverse economic condition designed by the frb both ccar and dfast include an estimate of projected revenue loss reserve pro forma regulatory capital ratio and any other additional capital measure deemed relevant by citi projection are required over nine quarter planning horizon under two supervisory scenario baseline and severely adverse condition all risk based capital ratio reflect application of the standardized approach framework under the basel iii rule in addition citibank is required to conduct the annual dodd frank act stress test the annual stress test consists of forward looking quantitative evaluation of the impact of stressful economic and financial market condition under several scenario on citibank regulatory capital this program serf to inform the office of the comptroller of the currency to how citibank regulatory capital ratio might change during hypothetical set of adverse economic condition and to ultimately evaluate the reliability of citibank capital planning process citigroup and citibank are required to disclose the result of their company run stress test capital resource the following table present citi required risk based capital ratio of economic growth rate well an increasing risk of recession in europe the and other country for example in the the the eu and other economy experienced significantly higher level of widespread inflation jurisdiction for example in the european commission adopted part of capital requirement directive crd new requirement for major banking group headquartered outside the eu which would include citi to risk and cost see the implementation and interpretation of regulatory change risk factor below and can adversely affect citi business result of operation and financial condition citi continued estimate risk factor below citi investment and other initiative may continue to evolve it business strategy the market environment and regulatory expectation change which could make the initiative more costly and more challenging to implement and limit their effectiveness climate change present various financial and non financial risk to citi and it customer and client climate change present both immediate and long term risk to citi and it customer and client with the risk expected to increase over time climate risk can arise from both physical risk those risk related to the physical effect of climate change and transition risk risk related to regulatory market technological stakeholder and legal change from transition to low carbon economy physical and transition risk can manifest differently across citi risk category in the short medium and long term physical risk from climate change include acute risk such hurricane and flood well consequence of chronic change in climate such rising sea level prolonged drought and systemic change to geography and any resulting population migration such physical risk could have adverse financial operational and other impact on citi both directly on it business and operation and indirectly result of impact to citi client customer vendor and other counterparties these impact can include destruction damage or impairment of property and other asset disruption to business operation and supply chain and reduced availability or increase in the cost of insurance physical risk can also impact citi credit risk exposure for example in it mortgage and commercial real estate lending business transition risk may arise from change in regulation or market preference toward low carbon industry or sector which in turn could have negative impact on asset value result of operation or the reputation of citi and it customer and client for example citi corporate credit exposure include oil and gas power and other industry that may experience reduced demand for carbon intensive product due to the transition to low carbon economy failure to adequately consider transition risk in developing and executing on it business strategy could lead to loss of market share lower revenue and higher credit cost additionally if citi response to climate change is perceived to be ineffective or insufficient or citi is unable to achieve it objective or commitment relating to climate change it business reputation attractiveness to certain investor and effort to recruit and retain employee may suffer for example the need to decarbonize in gradual and orderly way while promoting energy security may lead to continued exposure to carbon intensive activity that in turn may raise such reputational risk even some regulator seek to mandate additional disclosure of climate related information citi ability to comply with such requirement and conduct more robust climate related risk analysis may be hampered by lack of information and reliable data data on climate related risk is limited in availability often based on estimated or unverified figure collected and reported on lag and variable in quality modeling capability to analyze climate related risk and interconnection are improving but remain incomplete moreover and non banking regulator and others are increasingly focusing on the issue of climate risk at financial institution both directly and with respect to their client for example in december the frb requested comment on draft principle that would provide high level framework for the safe and sound management of exposure to climate related financial risk for frb supervised financial institution with more than billion in asset legislative and regulatory change and uncertainty regarding climate related risk management and disclosure are likely to result in higher regulatory compliance credit reputational and other risk and cost for citi for additional information see the ongoing regulatory and legislative uncertainty and change risk factor above in addition citi could face increased regulatory reputational and legal scrutiny result of it climate risk sustainability and other esg related commitment and disclosure citi also face potentially conflicting anti esg initiative from certain state government that may impact it ability to conduct certain business within those jurisdiction well from congress for information on citi climate and other sustainability initiative see sustainability and other esg matter below for additional information on citi management of climate risk see managing global risk strategic risk climate risk below citi ability to utilize it dtas and thus reduce the negative impact of the dtas on citi regulatory capital will be driven by it ability to generate taxable income at december citi net dtas were billion net of valuation allowance of billion of which billion wa deducted from citi capital under the iii rule primarily relating to net operating loss foreign tax credit and general business credit carry forward of the net dtas at december billion related to foreign tax credit ftc carry forward net of valuation allowance the carry forward utilization period for ftc is year and represents the most time sensitive component of citi dtas the ftc carry forward at december expire over the period of citi must utilize any ftc generated in the then current year tax return prior to utilizing any carry forward ftc the accounting treatment for realization of dtas including ftc is complex and requires significant judgment and estimate regarding future taxable earnings in the jurisdiction in which the dtas arise and available tax planning strategy forecast of future taxable earnings will depend upon various factor including among others macroeconomic condition in addition any future increase in corporate tax rate could result in an increase in citi dta which may subject more of citi existing dta to exclusion from regulatory capital while improving citi ability to utilize it ftc carry forward citi overall ability to realize it dtas will primarily be dependent upon it ability to generate taxable income in the relevant tax carry forward period although utilization of ftc in any year is generally limited to of foreign source taxable income in that year overall domestic loss odl that citi ha incurred in the past allow it to reclassify domestic source income foreign source failure to realize any portion of the net dtas would have corresponding negative impact on citi net income and financial return citi ha not been and doe not expect to be subject to the base erosion anti abuse tax beat which if applicable to citi in any given year would have significantly adverse effect on both citi net income and regulatory capital for additional information on citi dtas including ftc see significant accounting policy and significant estimate income tax below and note and citi interpretation or application of the complex tax law to which it is subject could differ from those of governmental authority which could result in litigation or examination and the payment of additional tax penalty or interest citi is subject to various income based tax law of the and it state and municipality well the numerous non jurisdiction in which it operates these tax law are inherently complex and citi must make judgment and interpretation about the application of these law to it entity operation and business for example the organization for economic cooperation and development oecd pillar initiative contemplates global minimum tax with respect to earnings in each separate country eu member state are required to adopt the oecd pillar rule in and other non country are expected to follow suit under these rule citi will be required to pay top up tax to the extent that citi effective tax rate in any given country is below the is not expected to pas pillar legislation in the near term but the top up tax can be collected by other country while many aspect of the application of the rule remain uncertain citi doe not expect material effect to it earnings in addition citi is subject to litigation or examination with and non tax authority regarding non income based tax matter while citi ha appropriately reserved for such matter where there is probable loss and ha disclosed reasonably possible matter that are more likely than not the outcome from the matter may be different than citi expectation citi interpretation or application of the tax law including with respect to withholding stamp service and other non income tax could differ from that of the relevant governmental taxing authority which could result in the requirement to pay additional tax penalty or interest which could be material see note for frb and the fdic for the orderly resolution of citigroup the bank holding company and it significant legal entity under the bankruptcy code in the event of future material financial distress or failure on november the frb and fdic issued feedback on the resolution plan filed on july by the eight gsibs including citi the frb and fdic identified one shortcoming but no deficiency in citi resolution plan the shortcoming related to data integrity and data quality management issue specifically weakness in citi process and practice for producing certain data that could materially impact it resolution capability if shortcoming is not satisfactorily explained or addressed before or in the submission of the next resolution plan the shortcoming may be found to be deficiency in the next resolution plan for additional information on citi resolution plan submission see managing global risk liquidity risk below under title if the frb and the fdic jointly determine that citi resolution plan is not credible which although not defined is generally believed to mean the regulator do not believe the plan is feasible or would otherwise allow citi to be resolved in way that protects systemically important function without severe systemic disruption or would not facilitate an orderly resolution of citi under the bankruptcy code and citi fails to resubmit resolution plan that remedy any identified deficiency citi could be subjected to more stringent capital leverage or liquidity requirement or restriction on it growth activity or operation if within two year from the imposition of any such requirement or restriction citi ha still not remediated any identified deficiency then citi could eventually be required to divest certain asset or operation any such restriction or action would negatively impact citi reputation market and investor perception operation and strategy citi performance and it ability to effectively execute it transformation and other strategic initiative could be negatively impacted if it is not able to compete for retain and motivate highly qualified colleague recent employment condition and inflationary pressure have made the competition to hire and retain qualified employee significantly more challenging and costly citi performance and the performance of it individual business largely depend on the talent and effort of it diverse and highly qualified colleague specifically citi continued ability to compete in each of it line of business to manage it business effectively and to execute it transformation and other strategic initiative including for example hiring front office colleague to grow business or hiring colleague to support transformation of it risk control data and finance infrastructure and compliance depends on it ability to attract new colleague and to retain and motivate it existing colleague if citi is unable to continue to attract retain and motivate the most highly qualified colleague citi performance including it competitive position the execution of it transformation and other strategic initiative and it result of operation could be negatively impacted citi ability to attract retain and motivate colleague depends on numerous factor some of which are outside of it control for example the competition for talent recently ha been particularly intense and attrition rate have risen due to factor such low unemployment strong job market with large number of open position and change in worker expectation concern and preference in part due to the pandemic including an increased demand for remote work option and other job flexibility also the banking industry generally is subject to more comprehensive regulation of employee compensation than other industry including deferral and clawback requirement for incentive compensation which can make it unusually challenging for citi to compete in labor market against business including for example technology company that are not subject to such regulation other factor that could impact it ability to attract retain and motivate colleague include among other thing citi presence in particular market or region the professional and development opportunity and employee benefit it offer it reputation and it diversity for information on citi colleague and workforce management see human capital resource and management below citi face increased competitive challenge including from financial service and other company and emerging technology citi operates in an increasingly evolving and competitive business environment which includes both financial and non financial service firm such traditional bank online bank financial technology company and others these company compete on the basis of among other factor size reach quality and type of product and service offered price technology and reputation certain competitor may be subject to different and in some case le stringent legal and regulatory requirement whether due to size jurisdiction entity type or other factor placing citi at competitive disadvantage for example citi competes with other financial service company in the and globally that continue to develop and introduce new product and service in recent year non traditional financial service firm such financial technology company have begun to offer service traditionally provided by financial institution such citi and have sought bank charter to provide these service these firm attempt to use technology and mobile platform to enhance the ability of company and individual to borrow save and invest money emerging technology have the potential to intensify competition and accelerate disruption in the financial service industry for example despite recent turmoil in the digital asset market there is sustained interest from client and investor in digital asset financial service firm and other market participant have begun to offer service related to those asset however citi may not be able to provide the same or similar service for legal or regulatory reason and due to increased compliance and other risk in change in the payment space instant and payment are accelerating and result certain of citi product and service could become le competitive increased competition and emerging technology have required and could require citi to change or adapt it product and service to attract and retain customer or client or to compete more effectively with competitor including new market entrant simultaneously citi develops new product and service leveraging emerging technology new risk may emerge that if not designed and governed adequately may result in control gap and in citi operating outside of it risk appetite for example instant and payment product could be accompanied by challenge to forecasting and managing liquidity well increased operational and compliance risk moreover citi relies on third party to support certain of it process or system could negatively impact it reputation customer client business or result of operation and financial condition citi global operation rely heavily on it technology including the accurate timely and secure processing management storage and transmission of confidential transaction data and other information well the monitoring of substantial amount of data and complex transaction in real time citi obtains and store an extensive amount of personal and client specific information for it consumer and institutional customer and client and must accurately record and reflect their extensive account transaction citi operation must also comply with complex and evolving law and regulation in the country in which it operates with the evolving proliferation of new technology and the increasing use of the internet mobile device and cloud technology to conduct financial transaction and customer and client increasing use of online banking and trading system and other platform large global financial institution such citi have been and will continue to be subject to an ever increasing risk of operational loss failure or disruption including result of cyber or information security incident for additional information see the cybersecurity risk factor below although citi ha continued to upgrade it technology including system to automate process and enhance efficiency operational incident are unpredictable and can arise from numerous source not all of which are fully within citi control these include among others human error such manual transaction processing error which can be exacerbated by staffing challenge and processing backlog fraud or malice on the part of employee or third party operational or execution failure or deficiency by third party insufficient or limited straight through processing between legacy system and any failure to design and effectively operate control that mitigate operational risk associated with those legacy system leading to potential risk of error and operating loss accidental system or technological failure electrical or telecommunication outage failure of or cyber incident involving computer server or infrastructure or other similar loss or damage to citi property or asset see also the climate change risk factor above for example citi ha experienced and could experience further loss associated with manual transaction processing error including erroneous payment to lender or manual error by citi trader that cause system and market disruption and loss for citi and it client irrespective of the sophistication of the technology utilized by citi there will always be some room for human error in view of the large transaction in which citi engages such error could result in significant loss while citi ha change management process in place to appropriately upgrade it operational process and system to ensure that any change introduced do not adversely impact security and operational continuity such change management can fail or be ineffective operational incident can also arise result of failure by third party with which citi doe business such failure by internet mobile technology and cloud service provider or other vendor to adequately follow procedure or process safeguard their system or prevent system disruption or cyberattacks incident that impact information security and or technology operation may cause disruption and or malfunction within citi business the temporary loss of availability of citi online banking system or mobile banking platform well the operation of it client customer or other third party in addition operational incident could involve the failure or ineffectiveness of internal process or control given citi global footprint and the high volume of transaction processed by citi certain failure error or action may be repeated or compounded before they are discovered and rectified which would further increase the consequence and cost operational incident could result in financial loss well misappropriation corruption or loss of confidential and other information or asset which could significantly negatively impact citi reputation customer client business or result of operation and financial condition cyber related and other operational incident can also result in legal and regulatory action or proceeding fine and other cost see the legal and regulatory proceeding risk factor below information on citi management of operational risk see managing global risk operational risk below citi and third party computer system and network will continue to be susceptible to an increasing risk of continually evolving sophisticated cybersecurity incident that could result in the theft loss misuse or disclosure of confidential client or customer information damage to citi reputation additional cost to citi regulatory penalty legal exposure and financial loss citi computer system software and network are subject to ongoing cyber incident such unauthorized access loss or destruction of data including confidential client information account takeover disruption of service phishing malware ransomware computer virus or other malicious code cyberattacks and other similar event these threat can arise from external party including cyber criminal cyber terrorist hacktivists individual or group using cyberattacks to promote political or social agenda and nation state actor well insider who knowingly or unknowingly engage in or enable malicious cyber activity the increasing use of mobile and other business in russia could also increase it susceptibility to cyberattacks for additional information about citi exposure related to it russia operation see the macroeconomic and geopolitical risk factor above and managing global risk other risk country risk russia below third party with which citi doe business well retailer and other third party with which citi customer do business may also be source of cybersecurity risk particularly where activity of customer are beyond citi security and control system for example citi outsources certain function such processing customer credit card transaction uploading content on customer facing website and developing software for new product and service these relationship allow for the storage and processing of customer information by third party hosting of or access to citi website which could lead to compromise or the potential to introduce vulnerable or malicious code resulting in security breach impacting citi customer furthermore because financial institution are becoming increasingly interconnected with central agent exchange and clearing house including result of derivative reform over the last few year citi ha increased exposure to cyberattacks through third party while many of citi agreement with third party include indemnification provision citi may not be able to recover sufficiently or at all under these provision to adequately offset any loss citi may incur from third party cyber incident citi and some of it third party partner have been subject to attempted and sometimes successful cyberattacks from external source over the last several year including denial of service attack which attempt to interrupt service to client and customer ii hacking and malicious software installation intended to gain unauthorized access to information system or to disrupt those system iii data breach due to unauthorized access to customer account data and iv malicious software attack on client system in attempt to gain unauthorized access to citi system or client data under the guise of normal client transaction while citi monitoring and protection service were able to detect and respond to the incident targeting it system before they became significant they still resulted in limited loss in some instance well increase in expenditure to monitor against the threat of similar future cyber incident there can be no assurance that such cyber incident will not occur again and they could occur more frequently via novel tactic and on more significant scale further although citi devotes significant resource to implement maintain monitor and regularly upgrade it system and network with measure such intrusion detection and prevention and firewall to safeguard critical business application there is no guarantee that these measure or any other measure can provide absolute security because the technique used to initiate cyberattacks change frequently or in some case are not recognized until launched or even later citi may be unable to implement effective preventive measure or otherwise proactively address these method in addition given the evolving nature of cyber threat actor and the frequency and sophistication of the cyber activity they carry out the determination of the severity and potential impact of cyber incident may not become apparent for substantial period of time following discovery of the incident also while citi engages in certain action to reduce the exposure resulting from outsourcing such performing security control assessment of third party vendor and limiting third party access to the least privileged level necessary to perform job function these action can not prevent all third party related cyberattacks or data breach cyber incident can result in the disclosure of personal confidential or proprietary customer client or employee information damage to citi reputation with it client and the market customer dissatisfaction and additional cost to citi including expense such repairing system replacing customer payment card credit monitoring or adding new personnel or protection technology cyber incident can also result in regulatory penalty loss of revenue exposure to litigation and other financial loss including loss of fund to both citi and it client and customer and disruption to citi operational system for additional information on the potential impact of operational disruption see the operational process and system risk factor above moreover the increasing risk of cyber incident ha resulted in increased legislative and regulatory scrutiny of firm cybersecurity protection service and call for additional law and regulation to further enhance protection of consumer personal data while citi maintains insurance coverage take into account reputational harm the cost of which are impossible to quantify for additional information about citi management of cybersecurity risk see managing global risk operational risk requires citi to use certain assumption judgment and estimate in preparing it financial statement including among other item the estimate of the acl reserve related to litigation regulatory and tax because they involve technique including the use of historical data in many circumstance that can not anticipate every economic and financial outcome in the market in which citi operates can they anticipate the specific and timing of such outcome for example many model used by citi include assumption about correlation or lack thereof among price of various asset class or other market indicator that may not hold in time of market stress limited liquidity or other unforeseen circumstance if citi assumption judgment or estimate underlying it financial statement are incorrect or differ from actual or subsequent event citi could experience unexpected loss or other adverse impact some of which could be significant citi could also experience decline in it stock price be subject to legal and regulatory proceeding and incur fine and other loss for additional information on the key area for which assumption and estimate are used in preparing citi financial statement see significant negative investor perception of citi creditworthiness unexpected increase in cash or collateral requirement and the consequent inability to monetize available liquidity resource citi competes with other bank and financial institution for both institutional and consumer deposit which represent citi most stable and lowest cost source of long term funding the competition for deposit ha continued to increase in recent including result of online bank and digital banking and fixed income alternative for customer fund furthermore it is expected that the market for deposit will become more risk liquidity risk below citi ability to obtain funding may be impaired and it cost of funding could also increase if other market participant are seeking to access the market at the same time or to protracted dislocation of underwriting and capital market activity in addition clearing organization central bank client and financial institution with which citi interacts may exercise the right to require additional collateral during challenging market condition which could further impair citi liquidity if citi fails to effectively manage it liquidity it business result of operation and financial condition could be negatively impacted in addition holding company citigroup inc relies on interest dividend distribution and other payment from it subsidiary to fund dividend well to or creditor reducing the amount of fund available to meet it obligation credit rating agency continuously review the credit rating of citi and certain of it subsidiary and rating downgrade could adversely impact citi funding and liquidity the credit rating agency such fitch rating moody investor service and global rating continuously evaluate citi and certain of it subsidiary their rating of citi and it rated subsidiary long term debt and short term obligation are based on several factor including the financial strength of citi and such subsidiary well factor that are not entirely within the control of citi and it subsidiary such the agency proprietary rating methodology and assumption and condition affecting the financial service industry and market generally citi and it subsidiary may not be able to maintain their current respective rating and outlook rating downgrade could negatively impact citi and it rated subsidiary ability to access the capital market and other source of fund well the cost of those fund rating downgrade could also have negative impact on citi and it rated subsidiary ability to obtain funding and liquidity due to reduced funding capacity and the impact from derivative trigger which could require citi and it rated subsidiary to meet cash obligation and collateral requirement in addition rating downgrade could have negative impact on other funding source such secured financing and other margined transaction for which there may be no explicit trigger and on contractual provision and other credit requirement of citi counterparties and client that may contain minimum rating threshold in order for citi to hold third party fund furthermore credit rating downgrade could have impact that may not be currently known to citi or are not possible to and regulatory proceeding risk factor below over the past several year citi ha been required to implement significant number of regulatory and legislative change including new regulatory or evolve for additional information see the capital return risk factor and capital resource above in addition certain regulatory agency and non authority have prioritized issue of social economic and consequence arising from such outcome at any given time citi is party to significant number of legal and regulatory proceeding and is subject to numerous governmental and regulatory examination only because of violation of law and regulation but also due to failure determined by it regulator to have adequate policy and procedure or to remedy deficiency on timely basis previously disclosed the october frb and occ consent order require citigroup and citibank to implement targeted action plan and submit quarterly progress report detailing the result and status of improvement relating principally to various aspect of enterprise wide risk management compliance data quality management and governance and internal control these improvement will result in continued significant investment by citi during and beyond an essential part of citi broader transformation effort to enhance it risk control data and finance infrastructure and compliance although there are no restriction on citi ability to serve it client the occ consent order requires citibank to obtain prior approval of any significant new acquisition including any portfolio or business acquisition excluding ordinary course transaction moreover the occ consent order provides that the occ ha the right to ass future civil money penalty or take other supervisory and or enforcement action such action by the occ could include imposing business restriction including possible limitation on the declaration or payment of dividend and change in director and or senior executive officer more generally the occ and or the frb could take additional enforcement or other action if the regulatory agency belief that citi ha not met regulatory expectation regarding compliance with the consent order for additional information regarding the consent order see citi consent order compliance above the global judicial regulatory and political environment ha generally been challenging for large financial institution and financial institution have been subject to continued regulatory scrutiny the complexity of the federal and state regulatory and enforcement regime in the coupled with the global scope of citi operation also mean that single event or issue may give rise to large number of overlapping investigation and regulatory proceeding either by multiple federal and state agency and authority in the or result in regulatory scrutiny of citi responding to regulatory inquiry and proceeding can be time consuming and costly and non regulator have been increasingly focused on the culture of financial service firm including citi well conduct risk term used to describe the risk associated with behavior by employee and agent including third party that could harm client customer employee or the integrity of the market such improperly creating selling marketing or managing product and service or improper incentive compensation program with respect thereto failure to safeguard party personal respect to russia and china see the macroeconomic and geopolitical risk factor above and managing global risk other risk country risk russia and ukraine below limitation on foreign investment sociopolitical instability including from hyperinflation fraud nationalization or loss of license restriction arising from retaliatory russian law and regulation on the conduct of it business sanction or asset freeze potential criminal charge closure of branch or subsidiary and confiscation of asset and these risk can be exacerbated in the event of deterioration in relationship between the and an emerging market country for example citi operates in several country that have or have had in the past strict capital control currency control and or sanction such argentina and russia that limit it ability to convert local currency into dollar and or transfer fund outside of those country for instance due to currency control in argentina citi face risk of devaluation on it unhedged argentine peso denominated asset which continue to increase for additional information on argentina related risk see managing global risk other risk country risk argentina below moreover if the economic situation in country in which citi operates were to deteriorate below certain level regulator through the interagency country exposure review committee icerc may impose mandatory loan loss or other reserve requirement on citi which would increase it credit cost and decrease it earnings in addition political turmoil and instability and geopolitical tension and conflict such the russia ukraine war have occurred in various region and emerging market country across the globe which have required and may continue to require management time and attention and other resource such monitoring the impact of sanction on certain emerging market economy well impacting citi business result of operation and financial condition in affected country the transition away from and discontinuance of libor or any other interest rate benchmark could have adverse consequence for citi libor and other rate or index deemed to be benchmark have been the subject of ongoing and non regulatory scrutiny and reform the libor administrator ceased publication of non usd libor and one week and two month usd libor on permanent or representative basis on december with plan for all other usd libor tenor to permanently cease or become non representative after june result citi ceased entering into new contract referencing usd libor of january other than for limited circumstance where regulator recognized that it may be appropriate for bank to enter into new usd libor contract including with respect to market making hedging or novation of usd transaction executed before january through global effort by the financial service industry and regulator alternative reference rate have been identified or developed and are being used to replace libor and other benchmark rate alternative reference rate such the secured overnight financing rate sofr are calculated using component different from those used in the calculation of libor and may fluctuate differently than and not be representative of libor in order to compensate for these difference certain of citi financial instrument and commercial agreement allow for benchmark replacement adjustment however there can be no assurance that any benchmark replacement adjustment will be sufficient to produce the economic equivalent of libor either at the benchmark replacement date or over the life of such instrument and agreement moreover the transition present challenge related to contractual mechanic of existing contract that reference usd libor and are governed by non law or reference the usd libor ice swap rate certain of these legacy instrument and contract are not covered by any legislative solution and do not provide for fallback to alternative reference rate which make it unclear what the applicable future replacement benchmark rate and associated payment might be after the current benchmark cessation citi may be unable to amend certain instrument and contract due to an inability to obtain sufficient level of consent from counterparties or security holder although this will depend on the precise contractual term of the instrument such consent requirement are often condition of security such floating rate note the financial conduct authority fca regulator ha proposed that one three and six month usd libor be published on synthetic basis which would only be available through september in addition the transition away from and discontinuance of libor and other benchmark rate have subjected financial institution including citi to heightened scrutiny from regulator failure to successfully transition away from libor and other benchmark rate could result in adverse regulatory action dispute including potential litigation involving holder of outstanding product and contract that reference libor and other benchmark rate and reputational harm to citi see managing global risk other risk libor transition risk for citi ongoing action to prepare for the transition away from libor sustainability and other workshop focused on providing foundational knowledge of climate risk and client engagement key esg initiativessustainable progress strategyciti sustainable progress strategy is summarized in it environmental and social policy framework the three pillar of the strategy each have climate related element and serve the foundation for citi climate commitment the first pillar low carbon transition focus on financing and facilitating environmental and social finance including low carbon solution and supporting citi client in their decarbonization and transition strategy the second pillar climate risk focus on citi effort to measure manage and reduce the climate risk and impact of it client portfolio area of activity include portfolio analysis and stakeholder engagement well enhancing tcfd implementation and disclosure the third pillar sustainable operation focus on citi effort to reduce the environmental footprint of it facility and strengthen it sustainability culture this includes minimizing the impact of it global operation through operational footprint goal and further integrates sustainable practice across the country in which citi operates net zero emission by is member of several initiative that enhance it understanding of climate related issue improve it access to data and promote common understanding and terminology across various climate effort these initiative include the partnership for carbon accounting financials the glasgow financial alliance for net zero and the net zero banking alliance previously disclosed citi ha committed to achieving net zero greenhouse gas ghg emission associated with it financing by and net zero ghg emission for it own operation by both are significant target given the size and breadth of citi lending portfolio business and operational footprint citi made this commitment part of it ongoing work to reduce it climate risk and impact grow it business in the clean energy transition and help address the challenge that climate change pose to the global economy and broader society citi net zero commitment demonstrates how identifying assessing and managing climate related risk and opportunity remains top business priority for citi while many financial institution including citi face increasing public pressure to divest from carbon intensive sector citi belief it ha an important role to play in advising and financing the transition to net zero and it plan to work closely with client in this effort citi recognizes that large scale rapid divestment could result in an abrupt and disorderly transition to low carbon economy creating both economic and social upheaval citi belief that an orderly responsible and equitable transition which account for the immediate economic need of community and worker continued access to energy environmental justice consideration and broader economic development concern is essential for the retention of political and social support to move to low carbon economy the net zero commitment includes the following framework delineating the key area required to achieve it target calculate emission calculate baseline financed emission for each carbon intensive sector transition pathway identify the appropriate climate scenario transition pathway target setting establish emission reduction target for and beyond implementation strategy engage with and ass client to determine transition opportunity external engagement solicit feedback from client investor and other stakeholder the work continues to evolve and the party collectively define net zero for the banking sectorciti net zero plan includes net zero metric and target setting ass target for carbon intensive sector and explore methodology for calculating financed emission beyond lending portfolio client engagement and assessment seek to understand client ghg emission and work with them to develop their transition plan and advise on capacity building risk management ass climate risk exposure across citi lending portfolio and review client carbon reduction progress with ongoing review and refining of citi risk appetite and threshold and policy related to climate risk management clean technology and transition finance support existing and where possible new technology to accelerate commercialization and provide transition advisory and finance via debt and equity underwriting portfolio management active portfolio management to align with net zero target including consideration of transition measure taken by client public policy and regulatory engagement support enabling public policy and regulation in the and other country where relevantin citi took the following step to operationalize it net zero plan in addition to the energy and power target established last year citi ha set emission reduction target for four additional loan portfolio sector automotive manufacturing commercial real estate steel and thermal coal mining citi ha begun piloting net zero review template for it energy and power client to better understand their transition plan citi worked with rmi to help develop and launch the sustainable steel principle solution for measuring and disclosing the alignment of steel lending portfolio with climate target financial inclusion and racial equity building on citi longstanding focus on advancing financial inclusion and economic opportunity for community of color in september citi and the citi foundation announced action for racial equity are set of strategic initiative to help close the racial wealth gap and increase economic mobility in owned business expand access to affordable housing and among black american and advance anti racist practice within citi and across the financial service industry consistent with it commitment to transparently report on are in december citi released the result of racial equity audit of are which it had commissioned from the law firm covington burling the audit assessed are an effort to help address various driver of the racial wealth gap by evaluating are design implementation and extent of integration into citi business the audit overall assessment wa that are wa well designed and credible effort to help address the racial wealth gap in the given the dimension of citi business more specifically it concluded that are design effectively leveraged citi expertise network of business partner and resource to address some of the key factor contributing to the racial wealth gap citi ha made progress toward many of the objective committed to under are although at the time of the audit the end of the first two year of it three year commitment it had not yet accomplished every objective or commitment there are opportunity to further institutionalize are effort into citi core business building upon the creation of dedicated business unit in both pbwm and icg there are opportunity for citi to further support consumer from underrepresented community to build and maintain healthy credit score and access credit in addition to citi ongoing work and focus on are and in line with it continued commitment to expand access to banking product and service that can help advance economic progress especially for underbanked and unbanked community citi eliminated overdraft fee returned item fee and overdraft protection fee beginning in june in addition to eliminating these fee citi will continue to offer robust suite of free overdraft protection service for it customer additional informationfor additional information on citi environmental and social policy and
