job posting which aligns with strategic objective of pay equity and transparency citi also raised it minimum wage in the second broad based increase in le than two year citi ha focused on measuring and addressing pay equity within the organization in citi wa the first major financial institution to publicly release the result of pay equity review comparing it compensation of woman to that of men well minority to non minority since citi ha continued to be transparent about pay equity including disclosing it unadjusted or raw pay gap for both woman and minority the raw gap measure the difference in median compensation the existence of citi raw pay gap reflects need to increase representation of woman and minority in senior and higher paying role citi pay equity review determined that on an adjusted basis woman globally are paid on average more than of what men are paid at citi and that there wa not statistically significant difference in adjusted compensation for minority and non minority citi raw pay gap analysis showed that the medianpay for woman globally is of the median for men upfrom in and the median pay for minority is more than of the median for non minority which is up from above in and in representation goalsciti management belief that diverse workforce is key to the company success in serving diverse client and community in citi announced that it exceeded it board on citi investor relation website global risk overviewfor citi effective risk management is of primary importance to it overall operation accordingly citi ha established an enterprise risk management erm framework to ensure that all of citi risk are managed appropriately and consistently across the company and at an aggregate enterprise wide level citi culture drive strong risk and control environment and is at the heart of the erm framework underpinning the way citi conduct business the activity that citi engages in and the risk those activity generate must be consistent with citi mission and value proposition and the key leadership principle that support it well citi risk appetite discussed above citi also continues it effort to comply with the frb and occ consent order relating principally to various aspect of risk management compliance data quality management and governance and internal control see citi consent order compliance and risk factor compliance risk above under citi mission and value proposition which wa developed by it senior leadership and distributed throughout the company citi strives to serve it client trusted partner by responsibly providing financial service that enable growth and economic progress while earning and maintaining the public trust by constantly adhering to the highest ethical standard such citi asks all colleague to ensure that their decision pas three test they are in citi client best interest create economic value and are always systemically responsible discussed in human capital resource and management above citi ha designed leadership principle that represent the quality behavior and expectation all employee must exhibit to deliver on citi mission of enabling growth and economic progress the leadership principle inform citi erm framework and will contribute to creating culture that drive client control and operational excellence citi colleague share common responsibility to uphold these leadership principle and hold themselves to the highest standard of ethic and professional behavior in dealing with citi client business colleague shareholder community and each other citi erm framework detail the principle used to support effective enterprise wide risk management across the end to end risk management lifecycle the erm framework cover the risk management role and responsibility of the citigroup board of director the board citi executive management team see risk governance executive management team below and employee across the line of defense the underlying pillar of the framework encompass culture the core principle and behavior that underpin strong culture of risk awareness in line with citi mission and value proposition and leadership principle governance the committee structure and reporting arrangement that support the appropriate oversight of risk management activity at the board and executive management team level risk management the end to end risk management cycle including the identification measurement monitoring controlling and reporting of all risk including top material growing idiosyncratic and emerging risk and aggregated to an enterprise wide level and enterprise program the key risk management program performed across the risk management lifecycle for all risk category these program also outline the specific role played by each of the line of defense in these process each of these pillar is underpinned by supporting capability which are the infrastructure people technology and data and modelling and analytical capability that are in place to enable the execution of the erm framework citi approach to risk management requires that it risk taking be consistent with it risk appetite the risk appetite is the aggregate level and type of risk citi is willing to take or tolerate in order to meet it strategic objective and business plan citi risk appetite framework is the overall firm wide approach including policy process control and system through which the risk appetite is established communicated and monitored in addition underlying risk limit and threshold are designed to control concentration and operationalize risk appetite citi risk are generally categorized and summarized follows credit risk is the risk of loss resulting from the decline in credit quality or downgrade risk or failure of borrower counterparty third party or issuer to honor it financial or contractual obligation liquidity risk is the risk that citi will not be able to efficiently meet both expected and unexpected current and future cash flow and collateral need without adversely affecting either daily operation or financial condition of citi market risk trading and non trading market risk of trading portfolio is the risk of loss arising from change in the value of citi asset and liability resulting from change in market variable such interest rate exchange rate equity and commodity price or credit spread market risk of non trading portfolio is the risk to current or projected financial condition and resilience arising from movement in interest rate resulting from repricing risk basis risk yield curve risk and option risk operational risk is the risk of loss resulting from inadequate or failed internal process people and system or from external event it includes legal risk which is the risk of loss including litigation cost settlement and regulatory fine resulting from citi failure to comply with law regulation prudent ethical standard or contractual obligation in any aspect of citi business but excludes strategic and reputation risk see below compliance risk is the risk to current or projected financial condition and resilience arising from violation of law rule or regulation or from non conformance prescribed practice internal policy and procedure or ethical standard reputation risk is the risk to current or projected financial condition and resilience from negative opinion held by stakeholder strategic risk is the risk of sustained impact not episodic impact to citi core strategic objective measured by impact on anticipated earnings market capitalization or capital arising from the external factor affecting the company operating environment well the risk associated with defining the strategy and executing the strategy which are identified measured and managed part of the strategic risk framework at the enterprise level citi us line of defense model key component of it erm framework to manage it risk discussed below the line of defense model brings together risk taking risk oversight and risk assurance under one umbrella and provides an avenue for risk accountability of first line of defense construct for effective challenge by the second line of defense independent risk management and independent compliance risk management and empowers independent risk assurance by the third line of defense internal audit in addition the line of defense model includes organizational unit tasked with supporting strong control environment enterprise support function the first second and third line of defense along with enterprise support function have distinct role and responsibility and are empowered to perform relevant risk management process and responsibility in order to manage citi risk in consistent and effective manner first line of defense front line unit and front line unit activitiesciti first line of defense owns the risk and associated control inherent in or arising from the execution of it business activity and is responsible for identifying measuring monitoring controlling and reporting those risk consistent with citi strategy mission and value proposition leadership principle and risk appetite front line unit are responsible and held accountable for managing the risk associated with their activity within the boundary set by independent risk management they are also responsible for designing and implementing effective internal control and maintaining process for managing their risk profile including through risk mitigation so that it remains consistent with citi established risk appetite front line unit activity are considered part of the first line of defense and are subject to the oversight and challenge of independent risk management the first line of defense is composed of citi business management regional management certain corporate function enterprise operation and technology chief administrative office global public affair office of the citibank chief executive officer ceo and finance well other front line unit activity front line unit may also include enterprise support unit and or conduct enterprise support activity see enterprise support function below second line of defense independent risk management independent risk management unit are independent of the first line of defense they are responsible for overseeing the risk taking activity of the first line of defense and challenging the first line of defense in the execution of it risk management responsibility they are also responsible for independently identifying measuring monitoring controlling and reporting aggregate risk and for setting standard for the management and oversight of risk independent risk management is composed of independent risk management irm and independent compliance risk management icrm which are led by the group chief risk officer cro and group chief compliance officer cco who have unrestricted access to the board and it risk management committee to facilitate the ability to execute their specific responsibility pertaining to escalation to the board independent risk managementthe irm organization set risk and control standard for the first line of defense and actively manages and oversees aggregate credit market trading and non trading liquidity strategic operational and reputation risk across citi including risk that span category such concentration risk country risk and climate risk irm is organized to align to risk category legal entity region and company wide cross risk function or process each of these unit report to member of the risk management executive council who are all direct report to the citigroup cro independent compliance risk management the icrm organization actively oversees compliance risk across citi set compliance risk and control standard for the first line of defense to manage compliance risk and promotes business conduct and activity that is consistent with citi mission and value proposition and the compliance risk appetite citi objective is to embed an enterprise wide compliance risk management framework and culture that identifies measure monitor control and escalates compliance risk across citi icrm is aligned by product line function and geography to provide compliance risk management advice and credible challenge on day to day matter and strategic decision making for key initiative icrm also ha program level enterprise compliance unit responsible for setting standard and establishing priority for program related compliance effort these compliance risk management head report directly to the cco the cco report to citi general counsel and icrm is organizationally part of the global legal affair compliance group in addition the cco ha matrix reporting into the cro and is part of the risk management executive council third line of defense internal auditinternal audit is independent of the first line second line and enterprise support function the role of internal audit is to provide independent objective reliable valued and timely assurance to the board it audit committee citi senior management and regulator over the effectiveness of governance risk management and control that mitigate and evolving risk and enhance the control culture within citi the citi chief auditor manages internal audit and report functionally to the chairman of the citi audit committee and administratively to the citi chief executive officer the citi chief auditor ha unrestricted access to the board and the board audit committee to address risk and issue identified through internal audit activity enterprise support functionsenterprise support function engage in activity that support safety and soundness across citi these function provide advisory service and or design implement maintain and oversee company wide program that support citi in maintaining an effective control environment enterprise support function are composed of human resource and legal including citi security and investigative service front line unit may also include enterprise support unit and or conduct enterprise support activity the controller group within finance enterprise support function unit and activity are subject to the relevant company wide independent oversight process specific to the risk for which they are accountable operational risk compliance risk reputation risk risk governanceciti erm framework encompasses risk management process to address risk undertaken by citi through identification measurement monitoring controlling and reporting of all risk the erm framework integrates these process with appropriate governance to complement citi commitment to maintaining strong and consistent risk management practice board oversightthe board is responsible for oversight of citi and hold the executive management team accountable for implementing the erm framework meeting strategic objective within citi risk appetite executive management teamthe board delegate authority to an executive management team for directing and overseeing day to day management of citi the executive management team is led by the citigroup ceo and provides oversight of group activity both directly and through authority delegated to committee it ha established to oversee the management of risk to ensure continued alignment with citi risk strategy board and executive management committeesthe board executes it responsibility either directly or through it committee the board ha delegated authority to the following board standing committee to help fulfill it oversight and risk management responsibility risk management committee rmc assist the board in fulfilling it responsibility with respect to oversight of citi risk management framework including the significant policy and practice used in managing credit market liquidity strategic operational compliance reputation and certain other risk including those pertaining to capital management and ii performance oversight of the global risk review credit capital and collateral review function audit committee provides oversight of citi financial reporting and internal control risk well internal audit and citi external independent accountant compensation performance management and culture committee provides oversight of compensation of citi employee and citi management sustained focus on fostering principled culture of sound ethic responsible conduct and accountability within the organization nomination governance and public affair committee provides oversight of reputational issue environmental social and governance esg and sustainability matter and legal and regulatory compliance risk they relate to corporate governance matter technology committee assist the board in fulfilling it responsibility with respect to oversight of citigroup technology strategy and operating plan and the development of citi target operating model and architecture ii technology based risk management including cyber security iii technology related resource and talent planning and iv third party management policy practice and standard in addition to the above the board ha established the following ad hoc committee transformation oversight committee provides oversight of the action of citi management to develop and execute transformation of citi risk and control environment pursuant to the recent regulatory consent order for additional information see citi consent order compliance above the executive management team ha established five standing committee that cover the primary risk to which citi group is exposed these consist of group strategic risk committee gsrc provides governance oversight of citi management action to adequately identify monitor report manage and escalate all material strategic risk facing citi citigroup asset and liability committee alco responsible for governance over management liquidity risk and market risk non trading management and for monitoring and influencing the balance sheet investment security and capital management activity of citigroup group risk management committee grmc the primary senior executive level committee responsible for overseeing the execution of citigroup erm framework ii monitoring citi risk profile at an aggregate level inclusive of individual risk category iii ensuring that citi risk profile remains consistent with it approved risk appetite and iv discussing material and emerging risk issue facing the company the committee also provides comprehensive group wide coverage of all risk category including credit risk and market risk trading group business risk and control committee gbrcc provides governance oversight of citi compliance and operational risk group reputation risk committee grrc provides governance oversight for reputation risk management across citi in addition to the executive management committee listed above management may establish ad hoc committee in response to regulatory feedback or to manage additional activity when deemed necessary the figure below illustrates the reporting line between the board and executive management committee credit riskoverviewcredit risk is the risk of loss resulting from the decline in credit quality of client customer or counterparty or downgrade risk or the failure of borrower counterparty third party or issuer to honor it financial or contractual obligation credit risk is one of the most significant risk citi face an institution for additional information see risk factor credit risk above credit risk arises in many of citigroup business activity including consumer commercial and corporate lending capital market derivative transaction structured finance and security financing transaction repurchase and reverse repurchase agreement and security loaned and borrowed credit risk also arises from clearing and settlement activity when citi transfer an asset in advance of receiving it counter value or advance fund to settle transaction on behalf of client concentration risk within credit risk is the risk associated with having credit exposure concentrated within specific client industry region or other category citi ha an established framework in place for managing credit risk across all business that includes defined risk appetite credit limit and credit policy citi credit risk management framework also includes policy and procedure to manage problem exposure to manage concentration risk citi ha in place framework consisting of industry limit single name concentration for each business and across citigroup and specialized product limit framework credit exposure are generally reported in notional term for accrual loan reflecting the value at which the loan well other off balance sheet commitment are carried on the consolidated balance sheet credit exposure arising from capital market activity is generally expressed the current mark to market net of margin reflecting the net value owed to citi by given counterparty the credit risk associated with citi credit exposure is function of the idiosyncratic creditworthiness of the obligor well the term and condition of the specific obligation citi ass the credit risk associated with it credit exposure on regular basis through it allowance for credit loss acl process see significant accounting policy and significant estimate allowance for credit loss below and note and well through regular stress testing at the company business geography and product level these stress testing process typically estimate potential incremental credit cost that would occur result of either downgrade in the credit quality or default of the obligors or counterparties see note for additional information on citi credit risk management creditconsistent with it overall strategy citi corporate client are typically corporation that value the depth and breadth of citi global network citi aim to establish relationship with these client whose need encompass multiple product including cash management and trade service foreign exchange lending capital market and advisory corporate credit portfoliothe following table detail citi corporate credit portfolio within icg and the mexico sbmm component of legacy franchise excluding certain loan managed on delinquency basis loan carried at fair value and loan held for sale and before consideration of collateral or hedge by remaining tenor for the period corporate credit portfolio is diverse across geography and counterparty the following table show the percentage of this portfolio by region based on citi internal management geography december latin the maintenance of accurate and consistent risk rating across the corporate credit portfolio facilitates the comparison of credit exposure across all line of business geographic region and product counterparty risk rating reflect an estimated probability of default for counterparty and internal risk rating are derived by leveraging validated statistical model and scorecard in combination with consideration of factor specific to the obligor or market such management experience competitive position regulatory environment and commodity price facility risk rating are assigned that reflect the probability of default of the obligor and factor that affect the loss given default of the facility such support or collateral internal obligor rating that generally correspond to bbb and above are considered investment grade while those below are considered non investment grade the following table present the corporate credit portfolio by facility risk rating percentage of the total corporate credit portfolio total exposure december aa bb ccc or note total exposure includes direct outstandings and unfunded lending commitment in addition to the obligor and facility risk rating assigned to all exposure citi may classify exposure in the corporate credit portfolio these classification are consistent with citi interpretation of the banking regulator definition of criticized exposure which may categorize exposure special mention substandard doubtful or loss risk rating and classification are reviewed regularly and adjusted appropriate the credit review process incorporates quantitative and qualitative factor including financial and non financial disclosure or metric idiosyncratic event or change to the competitive regulatory or macroeconomic environment this includes but is not limited to exposure in those sector significantly impacted by the covid including consumer retail commercial real estate and transportation citi belief the corporate credit portfolio to be appropriately rated and classified of december citigroup ha taken action to adjust internal rating and classification of exposure both the macroeconomic environment and obligor specific factor have changed particularly where additional stress ha been seen obligor risk rating are downgraded the probability of default increase downgrade of obligor risk rating tend to result in higher provision for credit loss in addition downgrade may result in the purchase of additional credit derivative or other risk mitigants to hedge the incremental credit risk or may result in citi seeking to reduce exposure to an obligor or an industry sector citi will continue to review exposure to ensure that the appropriate probability of default is incorporated into all risk assessment see note for additional information on citi corporate credit portfolio portfolio mix industryciti corporate credit portfolio is diversified by industry the following table detail the allocation of citi total asset and renegotiated loansthere is certain amount of overlap among non accrual loan and asset and renegotiated loan the following summary provides general description of each category non accrual loan and asset corporate and consumer including commercial banking non accrual status is based on the determination that payment of interest or principal is doubtful corporate loan may be classified non accrual and still be performing under the term of the loan structure non accrual loan may still be current on interest payment citi corporate non accrual loan were billion billion and billion of december september and december respectively of these approximately and were performing at december september and december respectively consumer non accrual status is generally based on aging the borrower ha fallen behind on payment consumer mortgage loan other than federal housing administration fha insured loan are classified non accrual within day of notification that the borrower ha filed for bankruptcy in addition home equity loan are classified non accrual if the related residential first mortgage loan is day or more past due north america branded card and retail service are not included because under industry standard credit card loan accrue interest until such loan are charged off which typically occurs at day of contractual delinquency renegotiated loan includes both corporate and consumer loan whose term have been modified in troubled debt restructuring tdr includes both accrual and non accrual tdrs accrual loansthe table below summarizes citigroup non accrual loan of the period indicated non accrual loan may still be current on interest payment in situation where citi reasonably expects that only portion of the principal owed will ultimately be collected all payment received are reflected reduction of principal and not interest income for all other non accrual loan cash interest receipt are generally recorded revenue december in million of non accrual loan by region north america latin asia total corporate non accrual loan banking consumer non accrual loan personal banking and global wealth asia consumer mexico legacy holding asset total total non accrual loan corporate loan are placed on non accrual status based upon review by citigroup risk officer corporate non accrual loan may still be current on interest payment with limited exception the following practice are applied for consumer loan consumer loan excluding credit card and mortgage are placed on non accrual status at day past due and are charged off at day past due residential mortgage loan are placed on non accrual status at day past due and written down to net realizable value at day past due consistent with industry convention citigroup generally accrues interest on credit card loan until such loan are charged off which typically occurs at day contractual delinquency such the non accrual loan disclosure do not include credit card loan the balance above represent non accrual loan within corporate loan and consumer loan on the consolidated balance sheet the december total corporate non accrual loan represented of total corporate loan asia consumer includes balance in certain emea country for all period presented the change in citigroup non accrual loan were follows year endedyear endeddecember million of including the effect of inflation and monetary correction in certain country risk overviewadequate and diverse source of funding and liquidity are essential to citi business funding and liquidity risk arise from several factor many of which are mostly or entirely outside citi control such disruption in the financial market change in key funding source credit spread change in citi credit rating and macroeconomic geopolitical and other condition for additional information see risk factor liquidity risk above citi funding and liquidity management objective are aimed at funding it existing asset base ii growing it core business iii maintaining sufficient liquidity structured appropriately so that citi can operate under variety of adverse circumstance including potential company specific and or market liquidity event in varying duration and severity and iv satisfying regulatory requirement including but not limited to those related to resolution planning for additional information see resolution plan and total loss absorbing capacity tlac below citigroup primary liquidity objective are established by entity and in aggregate across two major category citibank including citibank europe plc citibank singapore ltd and citibank hong kong ltd and citi non bank and other entity including the parent holding company citigroup inc citi primary intermediate holding company citicorp llc citi broker dealer subsidiary including citigroup global market inc citigroup global market limited and citigroup global market japan inc and other bank and non bank subsidiary that are consolidated into citigroup including citibanamex at an aggregate citigroup level citi goal is to maintain sufficient funding in amount and tenor to fully fund customer asset and to provide an appropriate amount of cash and high quality liquid asset discussed below even in time of stress in order to meet it payment obligation they come due the liquidity risk management framework provides that in addition to the aggregate requirement certain entity be self sufficient or net provider of liquidity including in condition established under their designated stress test citi primary funding source include corporate and consumer deposit via citi bank subsidiary including citibank citibank ii long term debt primarily senior and subordinated debt mainly issued by citigroup inc the parent and citibank and iii stockholder equity these source may be supplemented by short term borrowing primarily in the form of secured funding transaction citi funding and liquidity framework working in concert with overall asset liability management ensures that there is sufficient liquidity and tenor in the overall liability structure including funding product of the company relative to the liquidity requirement of citi asset this reduces the risk that liability will become due before asset mature or are monetized the company hold excess liquidity primarily in the form of high quality liquid asset hqla presented in the table below citi liquidity is managed centrally by corporate treasury in conjunction with regional and in country treasurer with oversight provided by independent risk management and various asset liability committee alcos at the individual entity region country and business level pursuant to this approach citi hqla are managed with emphasis on asset liability management and entity level liquidity adequacy throughout citi citi cro and cfo co chair citigroup alco which includes citi treasurer and other senior executive the alco set the strategy of the liquidity portfolio and monitor portfolio performance for additional information about the alco see risk governance board and executive management committee above significant change to portfolio asset allocation are approved by the alco citi also ha other alcos which are established at various organizational level to ensure appropriate oversight for individual entity country franchise business and region serving the primary governance committee for managing citi balance sheet and liquidity supplement to alco citi funding and liquidity risk committee flrc is focused on funding and liquidity risk matter the flrc review and discus the funding and liquidity risk profile of well risk management practice for citigroup and citibank and report it finding and recommendation to each relevant alco appropriate liquidity monitoring and measurementstress testing liquidity stress testing is performed for each of citi major entity operating subsidiary and country stress testing and scenario analysis are intended to quantify the potential impact of an adverse liquidity event on the balance sheet and liquidity position in order to have sufficient liquidity on hand to manage through such an event these scenario include assumption about significant change in key funding source market trigger such credit rating potential us of funding and macroeconomic geopolitical and other condition these condition include expected and stressed market condition well company specific event liquidity stress test are performed to ascertain potential mismatch between liquidity source and us over variety of time horizon and over different stressed condition to monitor the liquidity of an entity these stress test and potential mismatch are calculated on daily basis given the range of potential stress citi maintains contingency funding plan on consolidated basis and for individual entity these plan specify wide range of readily available action for variety of adverse market condition or idiosyncratic stress quality liquid asset hqla citibankciti non bank and other entitiestotalin billion of dollarsdec cash agency agency foreign government debt other investment total hqla avg note the amount shown coverage ratio lcr in addition to internal day liquidity stress testing performed for citi major entity operating subsidiary and country citi also monitor it liquidity by reference to the lcr the lcr is calculated by dividing hqla by estimated net outflow assuming stressed day period with the net outflow determined by standardized stress outflow and inflow rate prescribed in the lcr rule the outflow are partially offset by contractual inflow from asset maturing within day similar to outflow the inflow are calculated based on prescribed factor to various asset category such retail loan well unsecured and secured wholesale lending the minimum lcr requirement is the table below detail the component of citi lcr calculation and hqla in excess of net outflow for the period indicated in became effective beginning july while public disclosure requirement to report the ratio will occur on semiannual basis beginning june citi wa in compliance with the rule of december loansas part of it under title of the dodd frank wall street reform and consumer protection act of dodd frank act and the rule promulgated by the fdic and federal reserve board frb to periodically submit plan for citi rapid and orderly resolution under the bankruptcy code in the event of material financial distress or failure citigroup will alternate between submitting full resolution plan and targeted resolution plan on biennial cycle on november the frb and fdic issued feedback on the resolution plan filed on july by the eight global systemically important bank gsibs including citigroup the frb and fdic identified one shortcoming but no deficiency in citigroup resolution plan regarding data integrity and data quality management issue for additional information on citi resolution plan submission see risk factor strategic risk above under citi preferred single point of entry resolution plan strategy only citigroup the parent holding company would enter into bankruptcy while citigroup material legal entity defined in the public section of it resolution plan which can be found on the frb and fdic website would remain operational outside of any resolution or insolvency proceeding citigroup resolution plan ha been designed to minimize the risk of systemic impact to the and global financial system while maximizing the value of the bankruptcy estate for the benefit of citigroup creditor including it unsecured long term debt holder in addition in line with the frb final total loss absorbing capacity tlac rule citigroup belief it ha developed the resolution plan so that citigroup shareholder and unsecured creditor including it unsecured long term debt holder bear any loss resulting from citigroup bankruptcy accordingly any value realized by holder of it unsecured long term debt may not be sufficient to repay the amount owed to such debt holder in the event of bankruptcy or other resolution proceeding of citigroup the fdic ha also indicated that it wa developing single point of entry strategy to implement the orderly liquidation authority under title ii of the dodd frank act which provides the fdic with the ability to resolve firm when it is determined that bankruptcy would have serious adverse effect on financial stability in the previously disclosed in response to feedback received from the frb and fdic citigroup took the following action citicorp llc citicorp an existing wholly owned subsidiary of citigroup wa established an intermediate holding company an ihc for certain of citigroup operating material legal entity ii citigroup executed an inter affiliate agreement with citicorp citigroup operating material legal entity and certain other affiliated entity pursuant to which citicorp is required to provide liquidity and capital support to citigroup operating material legal entity in the event citigroup were to enter bankruptcy proceeding citi support agreement iii pursuant to the citi support agreement citigroup made an initial contribution of asset including certain high quality liquid asset and inter affiliate loan contributable asset to citicorp and citicorp became the business usual funding vehicle for citigroup operating material legal entity citigroup will be obligated to continue to transfer contributable asset to citicorp over time subject to certain amount retained by citigroup to among other thing meet citigroup near term cash need in the event of citigroup bankruptcy citigroup will be required to contribute most of it remaining asset to citicorp and iv the obligation of both citigroup and citicorp under the citi support agreement well the contributable asset are secured pursuant to security agreement the citi support agreement provides two mechanism besides citicorp issuing of dividend to citigroup pursuant to which citicorp will be required to transfer cash to citigroup during business usual so that citigroup can fund it debt service well other operating need one or more funding note issued by citicorp to citigroup and ii committed line of credit under which citicorp may make loan to citigroup total loss absorbing capacity tlac gsibs are required to maintain minimum level of tlac and eligible ltd each set by reference to the gsib consolidated risk weighted asset rwa and total leverage exposure the intended purpose of the requirement is to facilitate the orderly resolution of gsibs under the bankruptcy code and title ii of the dodd frank act for additional information including citi tlac and ltd amount and ratio see capital resource current regulatory capital standard above funding transaction and short term borrowing citi supplement it primary source of funding with short term financing that generally include secured funding transaction consisting of security loaned or sold under agreement to repurchase repos and ii to lesser extent short term borrowing consisting of commercial paper and borrowing from the fhlb and other market participant secured funding transactionssecured funding is primarily accessed through citi broker dealer subsidiary to fund efficiently both secured lending activity and ii portion of the security inventory held in the context of market making and customer activity citi also executes smaller portion of it secured funding transaction through it bank entity which are typically collateralized by government debt security generally daily change in the level of citi secured funding are primarily due to fluctuation in secured lending activity in the matched book described below and security inventory secured funding of billion of december increased from the prior year and wa unchanged sequentially driven by normal business activity the average balance for secured funding wa approximately billion for the quarter ended december the portion of secured funding in the broker dealer subsidiary that fund secured lending is commonly referred to matched book activity the majority of this activity is secured by high quality liquid security such treasury security agency security and foreign government debt security other secured funding is secured by le liquid security including equity security corporate bond and asset backed security the tenor of which is generally equal to or longer than the tenor of the corresponding matched book asset the remainder of the secured funding activity in the broker dealer subsidiary serf to fund security inventory held in the context of market making and customer activity to maintain reliable funding under wide range of market condition including under period of stress citi manages these activity by taking into consideration the quality of the underlying collateral and establishing minimum required funding tenor the weighted average maturity of citi secured funding of le liquid security inventory wa greater than day of december citi manages the risk in it secured funding by conducting daily stress test to account for change in capacity tenor haircut collateral profile and client action in addition citi maintains counterparty diversification by establishing concentration trigger and assessing counterparty reliability and stability under stress citi generally source secured funding from more than counterparties short term borrowingsciti short term borrowing of billion of the fourth quarter of increased year over year reflecting an increase in fhlb advance and commercial paper issuance citi continues to diversify it funding profile and decreased sequentially driven by normal business activity see note for further information on citigroup and it or citibank funding and liquidity due to reduced funding capacity including derivative trigger which could take the form of cash obligation and collateral requirement the following information is counterparties well general subjective counterparty behavior for example certain corporate customer and market counterparties could re evaluate their business relationship with citi and limit transaction in certain contract or market instrument with citi change in counterparty behavior could impact citi funding and liquidity well the result of operation of certain of it business the actual impact to citigroup or citibank is unpredictable and may differ materially from the potential funding and liquidity impact described below for additional information on the impact of credit rating change on citi and it applicable subsidiary see risk factor liquidity risk above citigroup inc and citibank potential derivative triggersas of december citi estimate that hypothetical one notch aggregate cash obligation and collateral requirement of approximately billion compared to billion of september see also note detailed under high quality liquid asset hqla above citigroup ha various liquidity resource available to it bank and non bank entity in part contingency for the potential event described above in addition broad range of mitigating action are currently included in citigroup and citibank contingency funding plan for citigroup these mitigating factor include but are not limited to accessing surplus funding capacity from existing client tailoring level of secured lending and adjusting the size of select trading book and collateralized borrowing at certain citibank subsidiary mitigating action available to citibank include but are not limited to selling or financing highly liquid government security tailoring level of secured lending adjusting the size of select trading asset reducing loan origination and renewal raising additional deposit or borrowing from the fhlb or central bank citi belief these mitigating action could substantially reduce the funding and liquidity risk if any of the potential downgrade described above additional potential impact in addition to the above derivative trigger citi belief that potential downgrade of citibank senior debt long term rating across any of the three major rating agency could also have an adverse impact on the commercial paper short term rating of citibank citibank ha provided liquidity commitment to consolidated asset backed commercial paper conduit primarily in the form of asset purchase agreement of december citibank had liquidity commitment of approximately billion to consolidated asset backed commercial paper conduit compared to billion of december see note for additional information in addition to the above referenced liquidity resource of certain citibank entity citibank could reduce the funding and liquidity risk if any of the potential downgrade described above through mitigating action including repricing or reducing certain commitment to commercial paper conduit in the event of the potential downgrade described above citi belief that certain corporate customer could re evaluate their deposit relationship with citibank this re evaluation could result in client adjusting their discretionary deposit level or changing their depository institution which could potentially reduce certain deposit level at citibank however citi could choose to adjust pricing offer alternative deposit product to it existing customer or seek to attract deposit from new customer in addition to the mitigating action referenced above riskoverviewmarket risk is the potential for loss arising from change in the value of citi asset and liability resulting from change in market variable such interest rate foreign exchange rate equity price commodity price and credit spread well their implied volatility market risk arises from both citi trading and non trading portfolio for additional information on market risk and market risk management at citi see risk factor above each business is required to establish with approval from citi market risk management market risk limit framework for identified risk factor that clearly defines approved risk profile and is within the parameter of citi overall risk appetite these limit are monitored by the risk organization including various regional legal entity and business risk management committee citi country and business asset liability committee and the citigroup risk management and asset liability committee in all case the business are ultimately responsible for the market risk taken and for remaining within their defined limit market risk of non trading portfolio market risk from non trading portfolio stem predominantly from the potential impact of change in interest rate and foreign exchange rate on citi net interest income and on citi accumulated other comprehensive income loss aoci from it investment security portfolio market risk from non trading portfolio also includes the potential impact of change in foreign exchange rate on citi capital invested in foreign currency banking book interest rate risk for interest rate risk purpose citi non trading portfolio are referred to the banking book management of interest rate risk in the banking book is governed by citi non trading market risk policy management asset liability committee alco establishes citi risk appetite and related limit for interest rate risk in the banking book which are subject to approval by citigroup board of director corporate treasury is responsible for the day to day management of citi banking book interest rate risk well periodically reviewing it with the alco citi banking book interest rate risk management is also subject to independent oversight from treasury risk management second line of defense team reporting to the treasury chief risk officer change in interest rate impact citi net income aoci and these change primarily affect citi banking book through net interest income due to variety of risk factor including difference in timing and amount of the maturity or repricing of asset liability and off balance sheet instrument change in level and or shape of interest rate curve client behavior in response to change in interest rate mortgage prepayment deposit beta and change in maturity of instrument resulting from change in interest rate environment part of their ongoing activity citi business generate interest rate sensitive position from their client facing product such loan and deposit the component of this interest rate risk that can be hedged is transferred via citi fund transfer pricing process to corporate treasury corporate treasury us various tool to manage the total interest rate risk position within the established risk appetite and target citi desired risk profile including it investment security portfolio company issued debt and interest rate derivative in addition citi us multiple metric to measure it banking book interest rate risk interest rate exposure ire is key metric that analyzes the impact of range of scenario on citi banking book net interest income and certain other interest rate sensitive income versus base case ire doe not represent forecast of citi net interest income the scenario methodology and assumption used in this analysis are periodically evaluated and enhanced in response to change in the market environment change in citi balance sheet composition enhancement in citi modeling and other factor since the third quarter of citi ha employed enhanced ire methodology and change to certain assumption the change included among other thing assumption around the projected balance sheet and revision to the treatment of certain business contribution notably accrual position in icg market business these change resulted in higher impact to citi net interest income over month period under the enhanced methodology citi utilizes the most recent quarter end balance sheet assuming no change to it composition and size over the forecasted horizon holding the balance sheet static the forecast incorporate expectation and assumption of deposit pricing loan spread and mortgage prepayment behavior implied by the interest rate curve in each scenario the base case scenario reflects the market implied forward interest rate and sensitivity scenario assume instantaneous shock to the base case the forecast do not assume citi take any risk mitigating action in response to change in the interest rate environment certain interest rate are subject to flooring assumption in downward rate scenario deposit pricing sensitivity deposit beta are informed by historical and expected behavior actual deposit pricing could differ from the assumption used in these forecast citi ire analysis primarily reflects the impact from the following banking book asset and liability loan client deposit citi deposit with other bank investment security long term debt any related interest rate hedge and the fund transfer pricing of position in total trading and credit portfolio var it excludes impact from any position that are included in total trading and credit portfolio var rate risk of investment portfolio impact on aociciti also measure the potential impact of change in interest rate on the value of it aoci which can in turn impact citi common equity and tangible common equity this will impact citi and other regulatory capital ratio citi seek to manage it exposure to change in the market level of interest rate while limiting the potential impact on it aoci and regulatory capital position aoci at risk is managed part of the company wide interest rate risk position aoci at risk considers potential change in aoci and the corresponding impact on the capital ratio relative to citi capital generation capacity the following table present the month estimated impact to citi net interest income aoci and the capital ratio each assuming an unanticipated parallel instantaneous basis point bps increase in interest rate in million of dollar except otherwise noteddec interest rate shock bpsinterest rate exposure option banking book portfolio and replaces them with the associated transfer pricing ire of december excludes certain ire methodology enhancement implemented in september most notably the banking book is asset sensitive asset reprice faster than liability resulting in higher net interest income in increasing interest rate scenario the estimated impact to citi net interest income in bps upward rate shock scenario of december decreased quarter over quarter and year over year primarily reflecting the net impact of lower expected gain due to dollar interest rate move that have already been realized and change in citi balance sheet at progressively higher interest rate level the marginal net interest income benefit is lower citi assumes it will pas on larger share of rate change to depositor higher beta further reducing citi ire sensitivity currency specific interest rate change and balance sheet factor may drive quarter to quarter volatility in citi estimated ire in bps upward rate shock book ha relatively higher interest rate exposure to the short end of the yield curve for dollar exposure to downward rate shock is larger in magnitude than to upward rate shock this is because of the lower benefit to net interest income from citi deposit base at higher rate level well the prepayment effect on mortgage loan and mortgage backed security for other currency exposure to downward rate shock is smaller in magnitude result of citi flooring assumption given low rate level for certain non dollar currency the magnitude of the impact to aoci is greater under scenario compared to scenario this is because the combination of change to citi investment portfolio partially offset by change related to citi pension liability result in net position that is more sensitive to rate at shorter and intermediate term maturity in foreign exchange rate impact on aoci and capitalas of december citi estimate that an unanticipated parallel instantaneous appreciation of the dollar against all of the other currency in which citi ha invested capital could reduce citi tangible common equity tce by approximately billion or result of change to citi cta in aoci net of hedge this impact would be primarily due to change in the value of the mexican peso euro singapore dollar and indian rupee this impact is also before any mitigating action citi may take including ongoing management of it foreign currency translation exposure specifically currency movement change the value of citi net investment in foreign currency denominated capital these movement also change the value of citi risk weighted asset denominated in those currency this coupled with citi foreign currency hedging strategy such foreign currency borrowing foreign currency forward and other currency hedging instrument lessens the impact of foreign currency movement on citi capital ratio change in these hedging strategy well hedging cost divestiture and tax impact can further affect the actual impact of change in foreign exchange rate on citi capital compared to an unanticipated parallel shock described above the effect of citi ongoing management strategy with respect to quarterly change in foreign exchange rate and the quarterly impact of these change on citi tce and capital ratio are shown in the table below see note for additional information on the change in aoci for the quarter endedin million of in the consolidated statement of income and is therefore not reflected in interest expense in the table above the average rate on interest revenue and net interest margin reflects the taxable equivalent gross up adjustment see footnote above citi nim is calculated by dividing net interest income by average interest earning asset icg market net interest income in million of interest income trading portfoliostrading portfolio include position resulting from market making activity hedge of certain available for sale afs debt security the cva relating to derivative counterparties and all associated hedge fair value option loan and hedge of the loan portfolio within capital market origination in icg the market risk of citi trading portfolio is monitored using combination of
