framework encompassing these measure and other control including trading mandate new product approval permitted product list and pre trade approval for larger more complex and le liquid transaction the following chart of total daily trading related revenue loss capture trading volatility and show the number of day in which revenue for citi trading business fell within particular range trading related revenue includes trading net interest and other revenue associated with citi trading business it excludes dva fva and cva adjustment incurred due to change in the credit quality of counterparties well any associated hedge of that cva in addition it excludes fee and other revenue associated with capital market origination activity trading related revenue are driven by both customer flow and the change in valuation of the trading inventory shown in the chart below positive trading related revenue wa achieved for of the trading day in daily trading related revenue loss month ended december million of dollar reflects the effect of asymmetrical accounting for economic hedge of certain afs debt security specifically the change in the fair value of hedging derivative is included in trading related revenue while the offsetting change in the fair value of hedged afs debt security is included in aoci and not reflected above sensitivitiesfactor sensitivity are expressed the change in the value of position for defined change in market risk factor such change in the value of treasury bond for one basis point change in interest rate citi global market risk function within the independent risk management organization work to ensure that factor sensitivity are calculated monitored and limited for all material risk taken in the trading portfolio value at risk var var estimate at confidence level the potential decline in the value of position or portfolio under normal market condition assuming one day holding period var statistic which are based on historical data can be materially different across firm due to difference in portfolio composition var methodology and model parameter result citi belief var statistic can be used more effectively indicator of trend in risk taking within firm rather than basis for inferring difference in risk taking across firm citi us single independently approved monte carlo simulation var model see var model review and validation below which ha been designed to capture material risk sensitivity such first and second order sensitivity of position to change in market price of various asset class risk type such interest rate credit spread foreign exchange equity and commodity risk citi var includes position that are measured at fair value it doe not include investment security classified afs or htm see note for information on these security citi belief it var model is conservatively calibrated to incorporate fat tail scaling and the greater of short term approximately the most recent month and long term month for commodity and three year for others market volatility the monte carlo simulation involves approximately market factor making use of approximately time series with sensitivity updated daily volatility parameter updated intra monthly and correlation parameter updated monthly the conservative feature of the var calibration contribute an approximate add on to what would be var estimated under the assumption of stable and perfectly normally distributed market presented in the table below citi average trading var increased million from to mainly due to increased market volatility citi average trading and credit portfolio var increased million from to in line with trading var year end and average trading var and trading and credit portfolio varin million of dollarsdecember averagedecember averageinterest rate credit covariance adjustment fully diversified interest rate and credit spread foreign covariance adjustment total trading var all market risk factor including general and specific risk excluding credit portfolio specific risk only component total trading var general market risk factor only excluding credit portfolio incremental impact of the credit portfolio total trading and credit portfolio var covariance adjustment also known diversification benefit equal the difference between the total var and the sum of the var tied to each risk type the benefit reflects the fact that the risk within individual and across risk type are not perfectly correlated and consequently the total var on given day will be lower than the sum of the var relating to each risk type the determination of the primary driver of change to the covariance adjustment is made by an examination of the impact of both model parameter and position change the total trading var includes mark to market and certain fair value option trading position in icg with the exception of hedge to the loan portfolio fair value option loan and all cva exposure available for sale and accrual exposure are not included the specific risk only component represents the level of equity and fixed income issuer specific risk embedded in var the credit portfolio is composed of mark to market position associated with non trading business unit the cva relating to derivative counterparties and all associated cva hedge fva and dva are not included the credit portfolio also includes hedge to the loan portfolio fair value option loan and hedge to the leveraged finance pipeline within capital market origination in icg table below provides the range of market factor var associated with citi total trading var inclusive of specific risk million of dollarslowhighlowhighinterest rate credit fully diversified interest rate and credit spread foreign total trading total trading and credit note no covariance adjustment can be inferred from the above table the high and low for each market factor will be from different close of business date the following table provides the var for icg excluding the cva relating to derivative counterparties hedge of cva fair value option loan and hedge to the loan portfolio in million of dollarsdec all market risk factor including general and specific risk average during year high during low during var model review and validationgenerally citi var review and model validation process entail reviewing the model framework major assumption and implementation of the mathematical algorithm in addition product specific back testing on portfolio is periodically completed part of the ongoing model performance monitoring process and reviewed with citi banking regulator furthermore regulatory var back testing described below is performed against buy and hold profit and loss on monthly basis for multiple sub portfolio across the organization trading desk level icg operating segment and citigroup and the result are shared with banking regulator material var model and assumption change must be independently validated within citi independent risk management organization all model change including those for the var model are validated by the model validation group within citi model risk management in the event of significant model change parallel model run are undertaken prior to implementation in addition significant model and assumption change are subject to the periodic review and approval by citi banking regulator citi us the same independently validated var model for both regulatory var and risk management var total trading and total trading and credit portfolio var and such the model review and validation process for both purpose is described above regulatory var which is calculated in accordance with basel iii differs from risk management var due to the fact that certain position included in risk management var are not eligible for market risk treatment in regulatory var the composition of risk management var is discussed under value at risk above the applicability of the var model for position eligible for market risk treatment under regulatory capital rule is periodically reviewed and approved by citi banking regulator in accordance with basel iii regulatory var includes all trading book covered position and all foreign exchange and commodity exposure pursuant to basel iii regulatory var excludes position that fail to meet the intent and ability to trade requirement and are therefore classified non trading book and category of exposure that are specifically excluded covered position regulatory var excludes cva on derivative instrument and dva on citi own fair value option liability cva hedge are excluded from regulatory var and included in credit risk weighted asset computed under the advanced approach for determining risk weighted asset regulatory var back testingin accordance with basel iii citi is required to perform back testing to evaluate the effectiveness of it regulatory var model regulatory var back testing is the process in which the daily one day var at confidence interval is compared to the buy and hold profit and loss the profit and loss impact if the portfolio is held constant at the end of the day and re priced the following day buy and hold profit and loss represents the daily mark to market profit and loss attributable to price movement in covered position from the close of the previous business day buy and hold profit and loss excludes realized trading revenue net interest fee and commission intra day trading profit and loss and change in reserve based on confidence level citi would expect two to three day in any one year where buy and hold loss exceed the regulatory var given the conservative calibration of citi var model result of taking the greater of short and long term volatility and fat tail scaling of volatility citi would expect fewer exception under normal and stable market condition period of unstable market condition could increase the number of back testing exception following graph show the daily buy and hold profit and loss associated with citi covered position compared to citi one day regulatory var during during one back testing exception wa observed at the citigroup level the difference between the of day with buy and hold gain for regulatory var back testing and the of day with trading net interest and other revenue associated with citi trading business shown in the histogram of daily trading related revenue below reflects among other thing that significant portion of citi trading related revenue is not generated from daily price movement on these position and exposure well difference in the portfolio composition of regulatory var and risk management var regulatory trading var and associated buy and hold profit and loss month ended december million of dollar total regulatory var buy and hold regulatory var buy and hold profit and loss defined by the banking regulator under basel iii represents the daily mark to market revenue movement attributable to the trading position from the close of the previous business day buy and hold profit and loss excludes realized trading revenue and net interest intra day trading profit and loss on new and terminated trade well change in reserve therefore it is not comparable to the trading related revenue presented in the chart of daily trading related revenue above testingciti performs market risk stress testing on regular basis to estimate the impact of extreme market movement it is performed on individual position and trading portfolio well in aggregate inclusive of multiple trading portfolio citi market risk management after consultation with the business develops both systemic and specific stress scenario review the output of periodic stress testing exercise and us the information to ass the ongoing appropriateness of exposure level and limit citi us two complementary approach to market risk stress testing across all major risk factor equity foreign exchange commodity interest rate and credit spread top down systemic stress and bottom up business specific stress systemic stress are designed to quantify the potential impact of extreme market movement on an institution wide basis and are constructed using both historical period of market stress and projection of adverse economic scenario business specific stress are designed to probe the risk of particular portfolio and market segment especially those risk that are not fully captured in var and systemic stress the systemic stress scenario and business specific stress scenario at citi are used in several report reviewed by senior management and also to calculate internal risk capital for trading market risk in general change in market value are defined over one year horizon for the most liquid position and market factor change in market value are defined over shorter two month horizon the limited set of position and market factor whose market value change are defined over two month horizon are those that in management judgment have historically remained very liquid during financial crisis even the trading liquidity of most other position and market factor materially declined risk overviewoperational risk is the risk of loss resulting from inadequate or failed internal process or system including human error or misjudgment or from external event this includes legal risk which is the risk of loss including litigation cost settlement and regulatory fine resulting from the failure of citi to comply with law regulation prudent ethical standard and contractual obligation in any aspect of it business but excludes strategic and reputation risk citi also recognizes the impact of operational risk on the reputation risk associated with citi business activity operational risk is inherent in citi global business activity well related support function and can result in loss citi maintains comprehensive company wide risk taxonomy to classify operational risk that it face using standardized definition across citi operational risk management framework see discussion below this taxonomy also support regulatory requirement and expectation inclusive of those related to basel iii comprehensive capital analysis and review ccar heightened standard for large financial institution and dodd frank act stress testing dfast citi manages operational risk consistent with the overall framework described in managing global risk overview above citi goal is to keep operational risk at appropriate level relative to the characteristic of it business the market in which it operates it capital and liquidity and the competitive economic and regulatory environment this includes effectively managing operational risk and maintaining or reducing operational risk exposure within citi operational risk appetite citi independent operational risk management group ha established global operational risk management framework with policy and practice for identification measurement monitoring managing and reporting operational risk and the overall operating effectiveness of the internal control environment part of this framework citi ha defined it operational risk appetite and established manager control assessment mca process for self identification of significant operational risk assessment of the performance of key control and mitigation of residual risk above acceptable level each citi operating segment must implement operational risk process consistent with the requirement of this framework this includes understanding the operational risk they are exposed to designing control to mitigate identified risk establishing key indicator monitoring and reporting whether the operational risk exposure are in or out of their operational risk appetite having process in place to bring operational risk exposure within acceptable level periodically estimating and aggregating the operational risk they are exposed to and ensuring that sufficient resource are available to actively improve the operational risk environment and mitigate emerging risk citi considers operational risk that result from the introduction of new or change to existing product or result from significant change in it organizational structure system process and personnel citi ha governance structure for the oversight of operational risk exposure through business risk and control committee brccs which include citigroup global brcc well business function regional and country brccs brccs provide escalation channel for senior management to review operational risk exposure including breach of operational risk appetite key indicator operational risk event and control issue membership includes senior business and function leadership well member of the second line of defense in addition independent risk management including the operational risk management group work proactively with citi business and function to drive strong and embedded operational risk management culture and framework across citi the operational risk management group actively challenge business and function implementation of the operational risk management framework requirement and the quality of operational risk management practice and outcome information about business key operational risk historical operational risk loss and the control environment is reported by each major business segment and functional area citi operational risk profile and related information is summarized and reported to senior management well to the audit and risk committee of citi board of director by the head of operational risk management operational risk is measured through operational risk capital and operational risk regulatory capital for the advanced approach under basel iii projected operational risk loss under stress scenario are estimated required part of the frb ccar process for additional information on citi operational risk see risk factor operational risk above cybersecurity risk overviewcybersecurity risk is the business risk associated with the threat posed by cyberattack cyber breach or the failure to protect citi most vital business information asset or operation resulting in financial or reputational loss for additional information see the operational process and system and cybersecurity risk factor in risk factor operational risk above with an evolving threat landscape ever increasing sophistication of threat actor tactic technique and procedure and use of new technology to conduct financial transaction citi and it client customer and third party are and will continue to be at risk from cyberattacks and information security incident citi recognizes the significance of these risk and therefore leverage threat focused strategy to protect against detect and respond to and recover from cyberattacks further citi actively participates in financial industry government and cross sector knowledge sharing group to enhance individual and collective cybersecurity preparedness and resilience managementciti technology and cybersecurity risk management program is built on three line of defense citi first line of defense under the office of the chief information security officer provides frontline business operational and technical control and capability to protect against cybersecurity risk and to respond to cyber incident and data breach citi manages these threat through state of the art fusion center which serve central command for monitoring and coordinating response to cyber threat the enterprise information security team is responsible for infrastructure defense and security control performing vulnerability assessment and third party information security assessment employee awareness and training program and security incident management in each case the team work in coordination with network of information security officer who are embedded within the business and function globally citi operational risk management technology and cyber orm and independent compliance risk management technology and information security icrm group serve the second line of defense and actively evaluate anticipate and challenge citi risk mitigation practice and capability citi seek to proactively identify and remediate technology and cybersecurity risk before they materialize incident that negatively affect business operation accordingly the orm team independently challenge and monitor capability in accordance with citi defined technology and cyber risk appetite statement to address evolving cybersecurity risk and corresponding regulation orm and icrm team collectively also monitor cyber legal and regulatory requirement identify and define emerging risk execute strategic cyber threat assessment perform new product and initiative review perform data management risk oversight and conduct cyber risk assurance review inclusive of third party assessment in addition orm employ tool and oversees and challenge metric that are both tailored to cybersecurity and technology and aligned with citi overall operational risk management framework to effectively track identify and manage risk internal audit serf the third line of defense and independently provides assurance on how effectively the organization whole manages cybersecurity risk citi also ha multiple senior committee such the information security risk committee isrc which governs enterprise level risk tolerance inclusive of cybersecurity risk board oversightciti board of director and or one or more board committee provides oversight of management effort to mitigate cybersecurity risk and respond to cyber incident the board and or one or more board committee receives regular report on cybersecurity and engages in discussion throughout the year with management and subject matter expert on the effectiveness of citi overall cybersecurity program the board and or one or more board committee also obtains update on citi inherent cybersecurity risk and citi road map and progress for addressing these risk moreover citi board and it committee member receive contemporaneous reporting on significant cyber event including response legal obligation and outreach and notification to regulator and customer when needed well guidance to management appropriate on an annual basis the board risk management committee approved standalone cybersecurity risk appetite statement against which citi performance is measured quarterly for additional information on the board oversight of cybersecurity risk management see citi upcoming proxy statement to be filed with the sec in march compliance riskcompliance risk is the risk to current or projected financial condition and resilience arising from violation of law rule or regulation or from non conformance with prescribed practice internal policy and procedure or ethical standard compliance risk expose citi to fine civil money penalty payment of damage and the voiding of contract compliance risk can result in diminished reputation harm to citi customer limited business opportunity and lessened expansion potential it encompasses the risk of noncompliance with all law and regulation well prudent ethical standard and some contractual obligation it could also include exposure to litigation known legal risk from all aspect of traditional and non traditional banking citi seek to operate with integrity maintain strong ethical standard and adhere to applicable policy and regulatory and legal requirement citi must maintain and execute proactive compliance risk management crm framework set forth in the crm policy that is designed to manage compliance risk effectively across citi with view to fundamentally strengthen the compliance risk management culture across the line of defense taking into account citi risk governance framework and regulatory requirement independent compliance risk management icrm primary objective are to drive and embed culture of compliance and control throughout citi maintain and oversee an integrated crm framework that facilitates enterprise wide compliance with local national or cross border law rule or regulation citi internal policy standard and procedure and relevant standard of conduct ass compliance risk and issue across product line function and geography supported by globally consistent system and compliance risk management process and provide compliance risk data aggregation and reporting capability citi carry out it objective and fulfills it responsibility through the crm framework which is composed of the following integrated key activity to holistically manage compliance risk management of citi compliance with law rule and regulation by identifying and analyzing change assessing the impact and implementing appropriate policy process and control developing and providing compliance training to ensure colleague are aware of and understand the key law rule and regulation monitoring the compliance risk appetite which is articulated through qualitative compliance risk statement describing citi appetite for certain type of risk and quantitative measure to monitor the company compliance risk exposure executing compliance risk assessment the result of which inform compliance risk monitoring and testing of compliance risk and control in assessing conformance with law rule regulation and internal policy and issue identification escalation and remediation to drive accountability including measurement and reporting of compliance risk metric against established threshold in support of the crm policy and compliance risk appetite to anticipate control and mitigate compliance risk citi ha established the crm policy to achieve standardization and centralization of methodology and process and to enable more consistent and comprehensive execution of compliance risk management citi ha commitment well an obligation to identify ass and mitigate compliance risk associated with it business and function icrm is responsible for oversight of citi crm policy while all business and global control function are responsible for managing their compliance risk and operating within the compliance risk appetite discussed above citi is working to address the frb and occ consent order which include improvement to citi crm framework and it enterprise wide application for additional information regarding the consent order see citi consent order compliance above reputation risk citi reputation is vital asset in building trust and citi is diligent in enhancing and protecting it reputation with it key stakeholder to support this citi ha developed reputation risk framework under this framework citigroup and citibank have implemented risk appetite statement and related key indicator to monitor corporate activity and operation relative to citi risk appetite the framework also requires that business segment and region escalate potential material reputation risk that require review or mitigation through reputation risk committee or equivalent the reputation risk committee which are composed of citi senior executive govern the process by which material reputation risk are identified measured monitored controlled and reported the reputation risk committee determine the appropriate action to be taken in line with risk appetite and regulatory expectation while promoting culture of risk awareness and high standard of integrity and ethical behavior across the company consistent with citi mission and value proposition the citigroup reputation risk committee may escalate reputation risk to the nomination governance and public affair committee or other appropriate committee of the citigroup board of director every citi employee is responsible for safeguarding citi reputation guided by citi code of conduct colleague are expected to exercise sound judgment and common sense in decision and action they are also expected to promptly escalate all issue that present material reputation risk in line with policy strategic riskas discussed above strategic risk is the risk of sustained impact not episodic impact to citi core strategic objective measured by impact on anticipated earnings market capitalization or capital arising from external factor affecting the company operating environment well the risk associated with defining the strategy and executing the strategy which are identified measured and managed part of the strategic risk framework at the enterprise level in this context external factor affecting citi operating environment are the economic environment geopolitical political landscape industry competitive landscape societal trend customer client behavior regulatory legislative environment and trend related to investor shareholder citi executive management team is responsible for the development and execution of citi strategy this strategy is translated into forward looking plan collectively citi strategic plan that are then cascaded across the organization citi strategic plan is presented to the board on an annual basis and is aligned with risk appetite threshold and includes risk assessment required by internal framework it is also aligned with limit requirement for capital allocation governance and oversight of strategic risk is facilitated by internal committee on group wide basis well strategic committee at the operating segment and regional level citi work to ensure that strategic risk are adequately considered and addressed across it various risk management activity and that strategic risk are assessed in the context of citi risk appetite citi conduct top down bottom up risk identification process to identify risk including strategic risk business segment undertake quarterly risk identification process to systematically identify and document all material risk faced by citi independent risk management oversees the risk identification process through regular review and coordinate identification and monitoring of top risk in addition citi performs quarterly risk assessment of the plan raop and continuously monitor risk associated with it execution of strategy independent risk management also manages strategic risk by monitoring risk appetite threshold in conjunction with various strategic risk committee which are part of the governance structure that citi ha in place to manage it strategic risk for additional information on citi strategic risk see risk factor strategic risk above climate riskclimate change present immediate and long term risk to citi and it client and customer with the risk expected to increase over time climate risk refers to the risk of loss arising from climate change and comprises both physical risk and transition risk physical risk considers how chronic and acute climate change increased storm drought fire flood can directly damage physical asset real estate or otherwise impact their value or productivity transition risk considers how change in policy technology business practice and market preference to address climate change carbon pricing policy power generation shift from fossil fuel to renewable energy can lead to change in the value of asset commodity and company climate risk is an overarching risk that can act driver of other category of risk such credit risk from obligors exposed to high climate risk strategic risk if citi fails to consider transition risk in client selection reputational risk from increased stakeholder concern about financing high carbon industry and operational risk from physical risk to citi facility and personnel citi focus on climate risk continues to increase driven by materiality of strategic reputational and financial risk consideration citi continues to make progress toward embedding these consideration into it overarching risk management approach for additional information on climate risk see risk factor strategic risk above citi review factor related to climate risk under it environmental and social risk management esrm policy which includes focus on climate risk related to financed project and client in high carbon sector considering the credit risk of stranded asset well the reputational risk associated with the coal sector due to it high carbon emission citi esrm policy includes prohibition on all project related financing of new coal fired power plant and new or expanding thermal coal mine well timetable to reduce financing of company with high exposure to coal fired power and coal mining that do not pursue low carbon transition in the coming year these sector approach set clear expectation for client and help address certain climate risk driven credit risk concern while reducing reputation risk citi continues to explore and test methodology for quantifying how climate risk could impact the individual credit profile of it client across various sector to assist in embedding climate risk assessment in it credit assessment process citi ha developed sector specific climate risk assessment such climate risk assessment are designed to supplement publicly available client disclosure and data provided from third party vendor and facilitate conversation with client on their most material climate risk and management plan for adaptation and mitigation citi assessment consider sector that have been identified higher climate risk by it risk identification process this will help citi better understand it client business and climate related risk citi net zero plan is leading to the further integration of climate risk discussion into client engagement and client selection citi continues to develop globally consistent principle and approach for managing climate risk across the company through the implementation of it climate risk management framework through this implementation climate risk is being embedded into relevant policy and process over time furthermore citi continues to participate in financial industry initiative and develop and pilot new methodology and approach for measuring and assessing the potential financial risk of climate change citi also continues to monitor regulatory development on climate risk and sustainable finance and actively engage with regulator on these topic for additional information about sustainability and other esg matter at citi see sustainability and other esg matter above other riskslibor transition riskas previously disclosed the libor administrator ceased publication of non usd libor and one week and two month usd libor on permanent or representative basis on december with plan for all other usd libor tenor to permanently cease or become non representative after june result citi ceased entering into new contract referencing usd libor of january other than for limited circumstance where regulator recognized that it may be appropriate for bank to enter into new usd libor contract including with respect to market making hedging or novation of usd transaction executed before january for information about risk to citi from transition away from and discontinuation of libor or any other benchmark rate see risk factor other risk above during citi continued it effort to manage it libor transition risk citi ha been focused on further reducing it libor exposure and remediating it remaining outstanding libor linked contract in addition citi ha continued to monitor and engage on legislative regulatory and other initiative and development related to libor transition matter of december citi had usd libor linked gross notional exposure of approximately trillion that matures after the libor cessation date of june of which approximately trillion relates to derivative this derivative exposure includes bilateral derivative with gross notional of approximately trillion of which is already remediated through inclusion of isda fallback and ii cleared derivative with gross notional of approximately trillion that will be covered by the central counterparty clearing house ccp conversion planned for the second quarter of the remaining gross notional of approximately trillion relates to cash product loan debt security preferred stock and securitizations which citi continues to address through active conversion or insertion of robust contract fallback language or is covered by legislative solution such the adjustable interest rate libor act see the discussion below due to rounding usd libor linked derivative and cash product exposure may not sum to total usd libor linked gross notional exposure in the the libor act provides for the use of statutory replacement for the overnight one month three month six month and month tenor of usd libor in all contract governed by law that lack adequate fallback provision required by the libor act each proposed replacement rate which differs depending on product type is based on the secured overnight financing rate sofr citi usd libor linked security and contract that do not have adequate fallback described in the libor act and are governed by law will fall within the application of the libor act result usd libor in these contract will be replaced with sofr plus the applicable spread adjustment citi is focused on remediating contract that reference the usd libor ice swap rate and non law contract which are not covered by the libor act of december citi had usd libor ice swap rate gross notional exposure of approximately trillion this includes approximately trillion of bilateral derivative of which ha already been remediated through inclusion of isda fallback and approximately trillion of debt security that citi is addressing through it remediation action plan the usd libor ice swap rate is separate rate from usd libor and is not included in the usd libor linked gross notional exposure on november the fca proposed the publication of one three and six month usd libor on synthetic basis through september which would provide additional time for non law governed contract and any contract that reference the usd libor ice swap rate to be remediated or mature further citi continued to engage with regulator financial accounting body and others on libor transition matter this included participating in number of working group including the alternative reference rate committee arrc convened by the frb to promote and advance development of sofr and seek to identify and address potential challenge from libor transition citi ha also continued to use alternative reference rate in certain newly issued financial instrument citi ha issued floating revocation of banking license and loss of ability to elect board of director or appoint member of senior management of december citi continued to consolidate ao citibank because none of the earnings and would evaluate it remaining net investment circumstance evolve citi paying agent for russian related clientsciti serf or served paying agent on bond issued by various entity in russia including russian corporate client citi role paying agent is administrative in this role citi act an agent of it client the bond issuer receiving interest and principal payment from the bond issuer and then making payment to international central security depository depository trust company euroclear clearstream the international central security depository icsds make payment to those participant or account holder broker that have client who are investor in the applicable bond bondholder paying agent citi generally doe not have information about the identity of the bondholder citi may be exposed to risk due to it responsibility for receiving and processing payment on behalf of it client result of sanction or other governmental requirement and prohibition to mitigate operational and sanction risk citi ha established policy procedure and control for client relationship and payment processing to help ensure compliance with eu and other jurisdiction sanction law these process may require citi to delay or withhold the processing of payment result of sanction on the bond issuer citi is also prevented from making payment to account on behalf of bondholder should the icsds disclose to citi the presence of sanctioned bondholder in both instance citi is generally required to segregate restrict or block the fund until applicable sanction are lifted or the payment is otherwise authorized under applicable law reputational risksciti ha continued it effort to enhance and protect it reputation with it colleague client customer investor regulator and the public citi response to the war in ukraine including any action or inaction may have negative impact on citi reputation with some or all of these party for example citi is exposed to reputational risk result of it current presence in russia and association with russian individual or entity whether subject to sanction or not including citi inability to support it global client in russia which could adversely affect it broader client relationship and business current involvement in transaction or supporting activity involving russian asset or interest failure to correctly interpret and apply law and regulation including those related to sanction perceived misalignment of citi action to it stated strategy in russia and the reputational impact from citi activity and engagement with ukraine or with non russian client exiting their russia business citi ha considered the potential for reputation risk and taken action to mitigate such risk citi established russia special review process with management reputation risk committee with oversight for significant russia related reputation risk and completed number of reputation risk review of matter with russian nexus while citi announced it intention to wind down it business in russia citi will continue to manage those operation during the wind down process and will be required to maintain certain limited operation to fulfill it remaining legal and regulatory obligation also sanction and sanction compliance are highly complex and may change over time and result in increased operational risk failure to fully comply with relevant sanction or the application of sanction where they should not be applied may negatively impact citi reputation in addition citi currently performs service for conduct business with or deal in non sanctioned russian owned business and russian asset this ha attracted and will likely continue to attract negative attention despite the previously disclosed plan to wind down nearly all it activity in the country cessation of new business and client origination and reduction of other exposure citi continued presence or divestiture of business in russia could also increase it susceptibility to cyberattacks that could negatively impact it relationship with client and customer harm it reputation increase it compliance cost and adversely affect it business operation and result of operation for additional information on operational and cyber risk see risk factor operational risk above board role in overseeing related risksthe citi board of director board and the board risk management committee rmc and it other committee have received and continue to receive regular report from senior management regarding the war in ukraine and it impact on citi operation in russia ukraine and elsewhere well the war broader geopolitical macroeconomic and reputational impact in addition to receiving regular briefing from management the full board ha routinely been invited to attend portion of the rmc meeting for discussion related to the war in ukraine including with respect to citi risk exposure and stress testing the report to the board and it committee from senior management who represent the impacted business and the emea region independent risk management finance independent compliance risk management including those individual responsible for sanction compliance and human resource have included detailed information regarding financial impact impact on capital cybersecurity strategic consideration sanction compliance employee assistance and the board outside of formal meeting regarding citi russia related risk including with respect to cybersecurity matter ha continued to operate in ukraine throughout the war through it icg business argentinaciti operates in argentina through it icg business of december citi net investment in it argentine operation wa approximately billion under gaap citi us the dollar the functional currency for it operation in country that are deemed highly inflationary citi us argentina official market exchange rate to remeasure it net argentine peso denominated asset into the dollar of december the official argentine peso exchange rate against the dollar wa previously disclosed the central bank of argentina ha continued to maintain certain capital and currency control that restrict citi ability to access dollar in argentina and remit earnings from it argentine operation result citi net investment in it argentine operation is likely to continue to increase citi generates net income in it argentine franchise and it earnings can not be remitted due to the currency control implemented by the central bank of argentina certain indirect foreign exchange mechanism have developed that some argentine entity may use to obtain dollar generally at rate that are significantly higher than argentina official exchange rate citibank argentina is precluded from accessing these alternative mechanism and these exchange mechanism can not be used to remeasure citi net monetary asset into the dollar under gaap however if argentina official exchange rate converges with the approximate rate implied by the indirect foreign exchange mechanism citi could incur loss on it capital in argentina citi can not predict future fluctuation in argentina official market exchange rate or to what extent citi may be able to access dollar at the official exchange rate in the future citi economically hedge the foreign currency risk in it net argentine peso denominated asset to the extent possible and prudent using non deliverable forward ndf derivative instrument that are primarily executed outside of argentina of december the international ndf market had very limited liquidity resulting in citi inability to economically hedge it argentine peso exposure accordingly and to the extent that citi doe not execute ndf contract for this unhedged exposure in the future citi would record devaluation on it net argentine peso denominated asset in earnings without any benefit from change in the fair value of derivative position used to economically hedge the exposure citi continually evaluates it economic exposure to it argentine counterparties and reserve for change in credit risk and record mark to market adjustment for relevant market risk associated with it argentine asset citi belief it ha established an appropriate acl on it argentine loan and appropriate fair value adjustment on argentine asset and liability measured at fair value for credit and sovereign risk under gaap of december however regulatory agency may require citi to record additional reserve in the future increasing icg cost of credit based on the perceived country risk associated with it argentine exposure for additional information on citi emerging market risk including those related to it argentine exposure see risk factor above ffiec cross border claim on third party and local country assetsciti cross border disclosure are presented below based on the country exposure bank regulatory reporting guideline of the federal financial institution examination council ffiec the following summarizes some of the key ffiec reporting guideline amount are based on the domicile of the ultimate obligor counterparty collateral only including qualifying liquid collateral issuer or guarantor applicable security recorded by citi entity but issued by the government is considered exposure loan recorded by citi mexico entity to customer domiciled in mexico where the underlying collateral is held in germany is considered german exposure amount do not consider the benefit of collateral received for secured financing transaction repurchase agreement reverse repurchase agreement and security loaned and borrowed and are reported based on notional amount netting of derivative receivables and payable reported at fair value is permitted but only under legally binding netting agreement with the same specific counterparty and doe not include the benefit of margin received or hedge credit default swap cd are included based on the gross notional amount sold and purchased and do not include any offsetting cd on the same underlying entity loan are reported without the benefit of hedge given the requirement noted above citi ffiec cross border exposure and total outstandings tend to fluctuate in some case significantly from period to period an example because total outstandings under ffiec guideline do not include the benefit of margin or hedge market volatility in interest rate foreign exchange rate and credit spread may cause significant fluctuation in the level of total outstandings all else being equal table below show each country whose total outstandings exceeded of total citigroup asset december border claim on third party and local country asset in billion of dollarsbanks public nbfis other corporate and household trading asset included in short term claim included
