commitment includes commitment to local resident to be funded with local currency liability originated within the country credit default swap cd are not included in total outstanding significant accounting policy and significant estimatesthis section contains summary of citi most significant accounting policy note contains summary of all of citigroup significant accounting policy these policy well estimate made by management are integral to the presentation of citi result of operation and financial condition while all of these policy require certain level of management judgment and estimate this section highlight and discus the significant accounting policy that require management to make highly difficult complex or subjective judgment and estimate at time regarding matter that are inherently uncertain and susceptible to change see also risk factor operational risk above management ha discussed each of these significant accounting policy the related estimate and it judgment with the audit committee of the citigroup board of director valuation of financial instrumentscitigroup hold debt and equity security derivative retained interest in securitizations investment in private equity and other financial instrument substantial portion of these asset and liability is reflected at fair value on citi consolidated balance sheet trading account asset available for sale security and trading account liability citi purchase security under agreement to resell reverse repos or resale agreement and sell security under agreement to repurchase repos substantial portion of which is carried at fair value in addition certain loan short term borrowing long term debt and deposit well certain security borrowed and loaned position that are collateralized with cash are carried at fair value citigroup hold it investment trading asset and liability and resale and repurchase agreement on citi consolidated balance sheet to meet customer need and to manage liquidity need interest rate risk and private equity investing when available citi generally us quoted market price to determine fair value and classifies such item within level of the fair value hierarchy established under asc fair value measurement if quoted market price are not available fair value is based on internally developed valuation model that use where possible current market based or independently sourced market parameter such interest rate currency rate and option volatility such model are often based on discounted cash flow analysis in addition item valued using such internally generated valuation technique are classified according to the lowest level input or value driver that is significant to the valuation thus an item may be classified under the fair value hierarchy level even though there may be some significant input that are readily observable citi is required to exercise subjective judgment relating to the applicability and functionality of internal valuation model the significance of input or driver to the valuation of an instrument and the degree of illiquidity and subsequent lack of observability in certain market the fair value of these instrument is reported on citi consolidated balance sheet with the change in fair value recognized in either the consolidated statement of income or in aoci loss on available for sale security whose fair value are le than the amortized cost where citi intends to sell the security or could more likely than not be required to sell the security prior to recovery are recognized in earnings where citi doe not intend to sell the security nor could more likely than not be required to sell the security any portion of the loss that is attributable to credit is recognized an allowance for credit loss with corresponding provision for credit loss and the remainder of the loss is recognized in aoci such loss are capped at the difference between the fair value and amortized cost of the security for equity security carried at cost or under the measurement alternative decrease in fair value below the carrying value are recognized impairment in the consolidated statement of income moreover for certain equity method investment decrease in fair value are only recognized in earnings in the consolidated statement of income if such decrease are judged to be an other than temporary impairment otti assessing if the fair value impairment is temporary is also inherently judgmental the fair value of financial instrument incorporates the effect of citi own credit risk and the market view of counterparty credit risk the quantification of which is also complex and judgmental for additional information on citi fair value analysis see note and allowance for credit loss acl the table below show citi allowance for credit loss on loan acll and total acl of the fourth quarter of for information on the driver of citi acl build in the fourth quarter of see below for information on refinement in the acl estimation approach to introduce multiple macroeconomic scenario to the quantitative component of the acl see note also see note for additional information on citi accounting policy on accounting for credit loss under asc topic financial instrument credit loss current expected credit loss cecl allowance for credit loss acl in million of dollarsbalance dec release fx other balance dec eop loan dec legacy franchise corporate mexico sbmm total corporate acll card retail banking and global wealth total pbwm legacy franchise total consumer acll total acll allowance for credit loss on unfunded lending commitment acluc other total acl includes reclassification to other asset related to citi agreement to sell certain of it consumer banking business see note and of december in personal banking branded card acll eop loan wa and retail service acll eop loan wa includes acl on htm security and other asset citi reserve for expected credit loss on funded loan and for unfunded lending commitment standby letter of credit and financial guarantee are reflected on the consolidated balance sheet in the allowance for credit loss on loan acll and other liability for allowance for credit loss on unfunded lending commitment acluc respectively in addition citi reserve for expected credit loss on other financial asset carried at amortized cost including held to maturity security reverse repurchase agreement security borrowed deposit with bank and other financial receivables these reserve together with the acll and acluc are referred to the acl change in the acl are reflected provision for credit loss in the consolidated statement of income for each reporting period citi ability to estimate expected credit loss over the reasonable and supportable period is based on the ability to forecast economic activity over an timeframe the forecast period for consumer and corporate loan is eight quarter the acl is composed of quantitative and qualitative management adjustment component the quantitative component us three forward looking macroeconomic forecast scenario base upside and downside the qualitative management adjustment component reflects risk and current economic condition not captured in the quantitative component both the quantitative and qualitative component are further discussed below quantitative componentciti estimate expected credit loss for it quantitative component using it comprehensive internal data on loss and default history ii internal credit risk rating iii external credit bureau and rating agency information and iv forecast of macroeconomic condition for it consumer and corporate portfolio citi expected credit loss are determined primarily by utilizing model that consider the borrower probability of default pd loss given default lgd and exposure at default ead the loss likelihood and severity model used for estimating expected credit loss are sensitive to change in macroeconomic variable including housing price unemployment and real gdp and cover wide range of geographic industry product and business segment in addition citi model determine expected credit loss based on leading credit indicator including loan delinquency change in portfolio size default frequency rating and loss recovery rate well other credit trend qualitative componentthe qualitative management adjustment component includes risk not fully captured in the quantitative component required by banking supervisory guidance for the acl including but not limited to concentration and collateral valuation risk with obligors in the global portfolio emerging macroeconomic risk due to uncertainty related to the war in ukraine potential global recession inflation interest rate commodity price and potential impact on vulnerable industry and region normalization of portfolio performance and consumer behavior from record low loss result of government stimulus and market liquidityciti qualitative component declined year over year primarily driven by the incorporation of multiple macroeconomic scenario in the quantitative component and release of covid related uncertainty reserve the portfolio continues to normalize toward pre pandemic level and these risk are captured in the quantitative component of the acl macroeconomic variablesciti considers multitude of global macroeconomic variable for the base upside and downside probability weighted macroeconomic scenario forecast it us to estimate the acl citi forecast of the unemployment rate and real gdp growth rate represent the key macroeconomic variable that most significantly affect it estimate of the acl the table below show citi forecasted quarterly average unemployment rate and year over year real gdp growth rate used in determining the base macroeconomic forecast for citi acl for each quarterly reporting period from to quarterly averageu quarter average citi forecast at citi forecast at citi forecast at citi forecast at citi forecast at represents the average unemployment rate for the rolling forward looking eight quarter in the forecast horizon year over year growth rate full yearu real forecast at citi forecast at citi forecast at citi forecast at citi forecast at the year over year growth rate is the percentage change in the real inflation adjusted gdp level under the base macroeconomic forecast of real gdp growth is expected to decline during and the unemployment rate is expected to increase modestly over the forecast horizon broadly returning to pre pandemic level scenario weightingciti acl is estimated using three probability weighted macroeconomic scenario base upside and downside the macroeconomic scenario weight are estimated using statistical model which among other factor take into consideration key macroeconomic driver of the acl severity of the scenario and other macroeconomic uncertainty and risk citi evaluates scenario weight on quarterly basis citi downside scenario incorporates more adverse macroeconomic assumption than the base scenario for example compared to the base scenario citi downside scenario reflects more severe recession including an elevated average unemployment rate of over the eight quarter period with peak difference of in the second quarter of the downside scenario also reflects year over year real gdp contraction in of with peak quarter over quarter difference of in the second quarter of citi acl is sensitive to the various macroeconomic scenario that drive the quantitative component of expected credit loss due to change in the length and severity of forecasted economic variable or event in the respective scenario to demonstrate this sensitivity citi applied weight to the downside scenario of december to reflect the most severe economic deterioration forecast in the multiple macroeconomic scenario citi downside scenario incorporates more adverse macroeconomic assumption than the weighted scenario assumption therefore applying downside scenario weight would result in hypothetical increase in the acl of approximately billion related to lending exposure except for loan individually evaluated for credit loss this analysis doe not incorporate any impact or change to the qualitative component of the acl these factor could decrease the outcome of the sensitivity analysis based on historical experience and current condition at the time of the assessment given the uncertainty inherent in macroeconomic forecasting citi continues to believe that it acl estimate based on three probability weighted macroeconomic scenario approach combined with the qualitative component remains appropriate of december change in the aclas further discussed below in the fourth quarter of citi had an acl build of billion for it consumer portfolio and release of billion for it corporate portfolio for net acl build of billion the build wa primarily driven by card loan growth in consumer portfolio and deterioration in macroeconomic assumption see macroeconomic variable above partially offset by reduction in russia exposure see managing global risk other risk russia above based on it latest macroeconomic forecast citi belief it analysis of the acl reflects the forward view of the economic environment of december see note for additional information consumer citi consumer acll is largely driven by card in personal banking discussed above citi total consumer acll build wa billion in the fourth quarter of primarily driven by card loan growth and deterioration in macroeconomic assumption which increased the acll balance to billion or of total funded consumer loan for card the level of reserve relative to total funded loan increased to of december compared to at september for the remaining consumer exposure the level of reserve relative to total funded loan wa at december unchanged from september corporate citi had corporate acll release of billion in the fourth quarter of the release wa primarily driven by the reduction of direct exposure in russia partially offset by the deterioration of macroeconomic assumption including fx other the acll reserve balance decreased million to billion or of total funded corporate loan aclucciti had an acluc build of million in the fourth quarter of which increased the acluc reserve balance included in other liability to billion the build wa primarily driven by deterioration in macroeconomic assumption acl on other financial assetsciti had an acl build on other financial asset carried at amortized cost of million in the fourth quarter of including fx other the acl reserve balance decreased million to billion included in other asset see note for additional information acll and non accrual ratiosat december the ratio of the acll to total funded loan wa for consumer loan and for corporate loan compared to at september for consumer loan and for corporate loan citi total non accrual loan were billion at december down million from september consumer non accrual loan decreased million to billion at december from billion at september while corporate non accrual loan decreased million to billion at december from billion at september in addition the ratio of non accrual loan to total loan wa and for corporate and consumer loan respectively at december for additional information on non accrual loan see additional consumer and corporate credit detail non accrual loan and asset and renegotiated loan above regulatory capital impactciti elected the modified cecl transition provision for regulatory capital purpose provided by the banking agency final rule accordingly the day one regulatory capital effect resulting from the adoption of cecl well the ongoing adjustment for of the change in cecl based allowance in each quarter between january and december started to be phased in on january and will be fully reflected in citi regulatory capital of january see note and for further description of the acl and related account goodwill citi test goodwill for impairment annually and conduct interim assessment between annual test if an event occurs or circumstance change that would more likely than not reduce the fair value of reporting unit below it carrying amount these event or circumstance include among other thing significant adverse change in the business climate decision to sell or dispose of all or significant portion of reporting unit or sustained decrease in citi stock price citi had historically performed it annual goodwill impairment test of july each year during the quarter ended september the company voluntarily changed it annual impairment assessment date from july to october based on interim impairment test performed between the previous annual test on july and the annual test to be performed on october no more than month have elapsed between goodwill impairment test of any of citi reporting unit the change in measurement date represents change in method of applying an accounting principle this change is preferable because it better aligns the company goodwill impairment testing procedure with it annual planning process and with it fiscal year end citi continues to monitor each reporting unit for triggering event for purpose of goodwill impairment testing the change in accounting principle did not result in any delay acceleration or avoidance of an impairment charge during the fourth quarter of the annual test wa performed which resulted in no goodwill impairment described in note of december citigroup activity were conducted through the institutional client group personal banking and wealth management and legacy franchise operating segment and corporate other goodwill impairment testing is performed at the level below the business segment referred to reporting unit citi utilizes allocated equity proxy for the carrying value of it reporting unit for purpose of goodwill impairment testing the allocated equity in the reporting unit is determined based on the capital the business would require it were operating standalone entity incorporating sufficient capital to be in compliance with both current and expected regulatory capital requirement including capital for specifically identified goodwill and intangible asset the capital allocated to the reporting unit is incorporated into the annual budget process which is approved by citi board of director goodwill impairment testing involves management judgment requiring an assessment of whether the carrying value of reporting unit can be supported by it fair value using widely accepted valuation technique such the market approach earnings multiple and or transaction multiple and or the income approach discounted cash flow dcf method in applying these methodology citi utilizes number of factor including actual operating result future business plan economic projection and market data where applicable bid from buyer are also utilized to determine fair value similar to citi engaged an independent valuation specialist in to assist in citi valuation of all the reporting unit primarily employing both the income and market approach to determine the fair value of the reporting unit bid from buyer were also used where available the resulting fair value were relatively consistent and appropriate weighting wa given to output from the income and market approach valuation the income approach utilized discount rate that citi belief adequately reflected the risk and uncertainty in the financial market in the internally generated cash flow projection the income approach employ capital asset pricing model in estimating the discount rate since none of the company reporting unit are publicly traded individual reporting unit fair value determination can not be directly correlated to citigroup common stock price the sum of the fair value of the reporting unit exceeded the overall market capitalization of citi of october however citi belief that it is not meaningful to reconcile the sum of the fair value of the company reporting unit to it market capitalization due to several factor the market capitalization of citigroup reflects the execution risk in transaction involving citigroup due to it size however the individual reporting unit fair value are not subject to the same level of execution risk nor business model that is international in addition the market capitalization of citigroup doe not include consideration of the individual reporting unit control premium discussed in note effective january part of it strategic refresh citi made change to it management structure which resulted in change in it operating segment and reporting unit to reflect how the ceo who is the chief operating decision maker manages the company including allocating resource and measuring performance goodwill balance were reallocated across the new reporting unit based on their relative fair value using the valuation performed of the effective date of the reorganization further the goodwill balance associated with certain asia consumer business within the legacy franchise operating segment were reclassified to hf of march see note for discussion of citi divestiture activity the reorganization of citi management structure and the announced sale of business within the legacy franchise operating segment were identified triggering event for purpose of goodwill impairment testing consistent with the requirement of asc interim goodwill impairment test were performed that resulted in an impairment of million to the asia consumer reporting unit within the legacy franchise operating segment due to the implementation of citi revised operating segment and reporting unit well the timing of mutual execution of sale agreement for certain of the asia consumer banking business this impairment wa recorded in the first quarter of an operating expense during the second quarter of citi banking reporting unit within the icg operating segment wa negatively impacted by the industry wide decline in investment banking activity and macroeconomic challenge and uncertainty these condition resulted in corresponding decline in the operating result of the banking reporting unit of june and were identified triggering event for purpose of goodwill impairment testing consistent with the requirement of asc an interim goodwill impairment test wa performed that resulted in no impairment of the banking reporting unit within the icg operating segment during the third quarter of citi banking reporting unit within the icg operating segment continued to be negatively impacted by the industry wide decline in investment banking activity amid ongoing macroeconomic challenge and uncertainty the presence of these condition wa identified triggering event for the purpose of goodwill impairment testing consistent with the requirement of asc an interim goodwill impairment test wa performed that resulted in no impairment of the banking reporting unit also during the third quarter of citi performed an interim goodwill impairment test on the mexico consumer sbmm reporting unit of july to satisfy the requirement that no more than month elapse between the test for all reporting unit the test resulted in no impairment the fair value of the mexico consumer sbmm reporting unit wa greater than it carrying value during the fourth quarter of citi performed it annual goodwill impairment test of october which resulted in no impairment the result of the impairment test showed that the fair value of citi reporting unit exceeded their carrying value for all reporting unit the fair value of two reporting unit banking and mexico consumer sbmm ranged from to of their carrying value the carrying value of the banking and mexico consumer sbmm reporting unit included approximately billion and billion of goodwill respectively the fair value of citi other reporting unit percentage of their carrying value ranged from approximately to while the inherent risk related to uncertainty is embedded in the key assumption used in the valuation of the reporting unit the economic and business environment continue to evolve citi management implement it strategic refresh if management future estimate of key economic and market assumption were to differ from it current assumption citi could potentially experience material goodwill impairment in the future see note and for additional information on goodwill including the change in the goodwill balance year over year and the segment goodwill balance of december litigation accrualssee the discussion in note for information regarding citi policy on establishing accrual for litigation and regulatory contingency income taxesoverviewciti is subject to the income tax law of the it state and local municipality and the non jurisdiction in which citi operates these tax law are complex and are subject to differing interpretation by the taxpayer and the relevant governmental taxing authority dispute over interpretation of the tax law may be subject to review and adjudication by the court system of the various tax jurisdiction or may be settled with the taxing authority upon audit in establishing provision for income tax expense citi must make judgment and interpretation about the application of these inherently complex tax law citi must also make estimate about when in the future certain item will affect taxable income in the various tax jurisdiction both domestic and foreign deferred tax are recorded for the future consequence of event that have been recognized in the financial statement or tax return based upon enacted tax law and rate deferred tax asset dtas are recognized subject to management judgment that realization is more likely than not for example if it is more likely than not that carry forward would expire unused citi would set up valuation allowance va against that dta citi ha established valuation allowance described below result of the tax cut and job act tax reform beginning in citi is taxed on income generated by it operation at federal tax rate of the effect on citi state tax rate is dependent upon how and when the individual state that have not yet addressed the federal tax law change choose to adopt the various new provision of the internal revenue code citi non branch and subsidiary are subject to tax at their local tax rate non branch also continue to be subject to taxation the impact of this on citi earnings depends on the level of branch pretax income the local branch tax rate and allocation of overall domestic loss odl and expense for tax purpose to branch earnings citi expects no residual tax on such earnings with respect to non subsidiary dividend from these subsidiary are excluded from taxation while the majority of citi non subsidiary earnings are classified global intangible low taxed income gilti citi expects no material residual tax on such earnings based on it non subsidiary local tax rate which exceed on average the gilti tax rate finally citi doe not expect the base erosion anti abuse tax beat to affect it tax provision on january final foreign tax credit ftc regulation were published in the federal register these regulation eliminate the creditability of foreign tax paid in certain situation these include country that do not align with tax principle in significant part and for service performed outside the recipient country the impact on citi effective tax rate wa not material the inflation reduction act signed into law on august had no impact on citi result the act includes new corporate alternative minimum tax amt and excise tax on stock buyback both effective january the corporate amt is minimum tax on financial statement income after adjusting for foreign tax paid corporate amt paid in one year is creditable against regular corporate tax liability in future year citi doe not expect to pay material amount of corporate amt given it profitability and tax profile the excise tax is non deductible tax on the fair market value of stock repurchased in the taxable year reduced by the fair market value of any stock issued in the same year and is accounted for in equity deferred tax asset and valuation allowance va at december citi had net dtas of billion in the fourth quarter of citi dtas increased by billion primarily result of loss in other comprehensive income on full year basis citi dtas increased by billion from billion at december of citi total net dtas of billion of december billion primarily related to tax carry forward wa deducted in calculating citi regulatory capital net dtas arising from temporary difference are deducted from regulatory capital if in excess of the limitation see capital resource above for the quarter and year ended december citi had billion of disallowed temporary difference dtas included in the billion above the remaining billion of net dtas of december wa not deducted in calculating regulatory capital pursuant to basel iii standard and wa appropriately risk weighted under those rule citi total va at december wa billion decrease of billion from billion at december the decrease wa primarily driven by release of the remaining general basket ftc va and expiration in the ftc branch basket citi va of billion is composed of billion on it ftc branch basket carry forward billion on it residual dta related to it non branch billion on local non dtas and billion on state net operating loss carry forward stated above with regard to the impact of non branch on citi earnings the level of branch pretax income the local branch tax rate and the allocation of odl and expense for tax purpose to the branch basket are the main factor in determining the branch va the allocated odl wa enhanced by significant taxable income generated in the current year citi va against ftc carry forward in it general basket wa fully reversed in from billion in primarily result of the effect of higher interest rate on the projection of future interest income see note recognized ftc comprised approximately billion of citi dtas of december compared to billion of december the decrease in ftc year over year wa primarily due to current year usage net of the va release the ftc carry forward period represents the most time sensitive component of citi dtas citi had an odl of approximately billion at december which allows it to elect percentage between and of future year domestic source income to be reclassified foreign source income see note for description of the odl the majority of citi federal net operating loss carry forward and all of it new york state and new york city net operating loss carry forward are subject to carry forward period of year this provides enough time to fully utilize the net dtas pertaining to these existing net operating loss carry forward this is due to citi forecast of sufficient taxable income and the continued taxation of citi non income by new york state and the city of new york although realization is not assured citi belief that the realization of it recognized net dtas of billion at december is more likely than not based upon management expectation of future taxable income in the jurisdiction in which the dtas arise well available tax planning strategy defined in asc topic income tax citi ha concluded that it ha the necessary positive evidence to support the realization of it net dtas after taking it va into consideration see note for additional information on citi income tax including it income tax provision tax asset and liability and tabular summary of citi net dtas balance of december including the ftc and applicable expiration date of the ftc for information on citi ability to use it dtas see risk factor strategic risk above and note accounting changessee note for discussion of change in accounting standard control and proceduresciti disclosure control and procedure are designed to ensure that information required to be disclosed under the security exchange act of amended is recorded processed summarized and reported within the time period specified in the sec rule and form including without limitation that information required to be disclosed by citi in it sec filing is accumulated and communicated to management including the chief executive officer ceo and chief financial officer cfo appropriate to allow for timely decision regarding required disclosure citi disclosure committee assist the ceo and cfo in their responsibility to design establish maintain and evaluate the effectiveness of citi disclosure control and procedure the disclosure committee is responsible for among other thing the oversight maintenance and implementation of the disclosure control and procedure subject to the supervision and oversight of the ceo and cfo citi management with the participation of it ceo and cfo ha evaluated the effectiveness of citigroup disclosure control and procedure defined in rule under the security exchange act of of december based on that evaluation the ceo and cfo have concluded that at that date citigroup disclosure control and procedure were effective annual report on internal control over financial reporting citi management is responsible for establishing and maintaining adequate internal control over financial reporting citi internal control over financial reporting is designed to provide reasonable assurance regarding the reliability of it financial reporting and the preparation of financial statement for external reporting purpose in accordance with generally accepted accounting principle citi internal control over financial reporting includes those policy and procedure that pertain to the maintenance of record that in reasonable detail accurately and fairly reflect the transaction and disposition of citi asset ii provide reasonable assurance that transaction are recorded necessary to permit preparation of financial statement in accordance with generally accepted accounting principle and that citi receipt and expenditure are made only in accordance with authorization of citi management and director and iii provide reasonable assurance regarding prevention or timely detection of unauthorized acquisition use or disposition of citi asset that could have material effect on it financial statement because of it inherent limitation internal control over financial reporting may not prevent or detect all misstatement also projection of any evaluation of effectiveness to future period are subject to the risk that control may become inadequate because of change in condition or that the degree of compliance with the policy or procedure may deteriorate citi management assessed the effectiveness of citigroup internal control over financial reporting of december based on the criterion set forth by the committee of sponsoring organization of the treadway commission coso in internal control integrated framework based on this assessment management belief that of december citi internal control over financial reporting wa effective in addition there were no change in citi internal control over financial reporting during the fiscal quarter ended december that materially affected or are reasonably likely to materially affect citi internal control over financial reporting the effectiveness of citi internal control over financial reporting of december ha been audited by kpmg llp citi independent registered public accounting firm stated in their report below which expressed an unqualified opinion on the effectiveness of citi internal control over financial reporting of december looking statementscertain statement in this report including but not limited to statement included within the management discussion and analysis of financial condition and result of operation are forward looking statement within the meaning of the private security litigation reform act of in addition citigroup also may make forward looking statement in it other document filed with or furnished to the sec and it management may make forward looking statement orally to analyst investor representative of the medium and others generally forward looking statement are not based on historical fact but instead represent citigroup and it management belief regarding future event such statement may be identified by word such believe expect anticipate intend estimate may increase may fluctuate target and illustrative and similar expression or future or conditional verb such will should may would and could such statement are based on management current expectation and are subject to risk uncertainty and change in circumstance actual result of operation and financial condition including capital and liquidity may differ materially from those included in these statement due to variety of factor including without limitation the precautionary statement included within the executive summary and each individual business discussion and analysis of it result of operation and ii the factor listed and described under risk factor above any forward looking statement made by or on behalf of citigroup speak only to the date they are made and citi doe not undertake to update forward looking statement to reflect the impact of circumstance or event that arise after the forward looking statement were made of independent registered public accounting firm to the stockholder and board of director citigroup inc opinion on the consolidated financial statement and internal control over financial reportingwe have audited the accompanying consolidated balance sheet of citigroup inc and subsidiary the company of december and the related consolidated statement of income comprehensive income change in stockholder equity and cash flow for each of the year in the three year period ended december and the related note collectively the consolidated financial statement we also have audited the company internal control over financial reporting of december based on criterion established in internal control integrated framework issued by the committee of sponsoring organization of the treadway commission in our opinion the consolidated financial statement referred to above present fairly in all material respect the financial position of the company of december and and the result of it operation and it cash flow for each of the year in the three year period ended december in conformity with generally accepted accounting principle also in our opinion the company maintained in all material respect effective internal control over financial reporting of december based on criterion established in internal control integrated framework issued by the committee of sponsoring organization of the treadway commission basis for opinionsthe company management is responsible for these consolidated financial statement for maintaining effective internal control over financial reporting and for it assessment of the effectiveness of internal control over financial reporting included in the accompanying management annual report on internal control over financial reporting our responsibility is to express an opinion on the company consolidated financial statement and an opinion on the company internal control over financial reporting based on our audit we are public accounting firm registered with the public company accounting oversight board united state pcaob and are required to be independent with respect to the company in accordance with the federal security law and the applicable rule and regulation of the security and exchange commission and the pcaob we conducted our audit in accordance with the standard of the pcaob those standard require that we plan and perform the audit to obtain reasonable assurance about whether the consolidated financial statement are free of material misstatement whether due to error or fraud and whether effective internal control over financial reporting wa maintained in all material respect our audit of the consolidated financial statement included performing procedure to ass the risk of material misstatement of the consolidated financial statement whether due to error or fraud and performing procedure that respond to those risk such procedure included examining on test basis evidence regarding the amount and disclosure in the consolidated financial statement our audit also included evaluating the accounting principle used and significant estimate made by management well evaluating the overall presentation of the consolidated financial statement our audit of internal control over financial reporting included obtaining an understanding of internal control over financial reporting assessing the risk that material weakness exists and testing and evaluating the design and operating effectiveness of internal control based on the assessed risk our audit also included performing such other procedure we considered necessary in the circumstance we believe that our audit provide reasonable basis for our opinion definition and limitation of internal control over financial reportinga company internal control over financial reporting is process designed to provide reasonable assurance regarding the reliability of financial reporting and the preparation of financial statement for external purpose in accordance with generally accepted accounting principle company internal control over financial reporting includes those policy and procedure that pertain to the maintenance of record that in reasonable detail accurately and fairly reflect the transaction and disposition of the asset of the company provide reasonable assurance that transaction are recorded necessary to permit preparation of financial statement in accordance with generally accepted accounting principle and that receipt and expenditure of the company are being made only in accordance with authorization of management and director of the company and provide reasonable assurance regarding prevention or timely detection of unauthorized acquisition use or disposition of the company asset that could have material effect on the financial statement because of it inherent limitation internal control over financial reporting may not prevent or detect misstatement also projection of any evaluation of effectiveness to future period are subject to the risk that control may become inadequate because of change in condition or that the degree of compliance with the policy or procedure may deteriorate critical audit mattersthe critical audit matter communicated below are matter arising from the current period audit of the consolidated financial statement that were communicated or required to be communicated to the audit committee and that relate to account or disclosure that are material to the consolidated financial statement and involved our especially subjective or complex judgment the communication of critical audit matter doe not alter in any way our opinion on the consolidated financial statement taken whole and we are not by communicating the critical audit matter below providing separate opinion on the critical audit matter or on the account or disclosure to which they relate assessment of the fair value of certain level asset and liability measured on recurring basisas described in note and to the consolidated financial statement the company net asset and liability recorded at fair value on recurring basis were billion and billion respectively at december the company estimated the fair value of level asset and liability measured on recurring basis billion and billion respectively at december utilizing various valuation technique with one or more significant input or significant value driver being unobservable including but not limited to complex internal valuation model alternative pricing procedure or comparables analysis and discounted cash flow we identified the assessment of the measurement of fair value for certain level asset and liability recorded at fair value on recurring basis critical audit matter high degree of effort including specialized skill and knowledge and subjective and complex auditor judgment wa involved in the assessment of the level fair value due to measurement uncertainty specifically the assessment encompassed the evaluation of the fair value methodology including method model and significant assumption and input used to estimate fair value significant assumption include proxy data forecast data the extrapolation and interpolation of proxy data forecast data and historic data well certain model assumption the assessment also included an evaluation of the conceptual soundness and performance of the valuation model the following are the primary procedure we performed to address this critical audit matter we involved valuation professional with specialized skill and knowledge who assisted in evaluating the design and testing the operating effectiveness of certain internal control related to the company level fair value measurement including control over valuation methodology including significant input and assumption independent price verification evaluating that significant model assumption and input reflected those which market participant would use to determine an exit price in the current market environment the valuation model used were mathematically accurate and appropriate to value the financial instrument and relevant information used within the company model that wa reasonably available wa considered in the fair value determination assessment of the allowance for credit loss collectively evaluated for impairmentas described in note and to the consolidated financial statement the company allowance for credit loss wa billion of december which includes the allowance related to loan and unfunded lending commitment collectively evaluated for impairment the collective acll the expected credit loss for the quantitative component of the collective acll is the product of multiplying the probability of default pd loss given default lgd and exposure at default ead for consumer and corporate loan for consumer credit card the company us the payment rate approach over the life of the loan which leverage payment rate curve to determine the payment that should be applied to liquidate the end of period balance in the estimation of ead for unconditionally cancelable account reserve are based on the expected life of the balance of the evaluation date and do not include any undrawn commitment that are unconditionally cancelable the credit loss factor applied are determined based on three macroeconomic scenario base downside and upside multiplied by their respective scenario probability weight that take into consideration both internal and external forecasted macroeconomic variable the most significant of which are unemployment and real gross domestic product gdp additionally for consumer credit card loan these model consider leading credit indicator including loan delinquency well economic factor for corporate loan these model consider the credit quality measured by risk rating and economic factor the qualitative component considers idiosyncratic event and the uncertainty of forward looking economic scenario we identified the assessment of the collective acll specifically for consumer credit card and corporate portfolio critical audit matter auditing the assessment involved significant measurement uncertainty requiring complex auditor judgment and specialized skill and knowledge well experience in the industry our assessment encompassed the evaluation of the various component of the collective acll methodology including the method and model used to estimate the pd lgd and ead and certain key assumption and input for the company quantitative and qualitative component key assumption and input for consumer loan included loan delinquency certain credit indicator reasonable and supportable forecast expected life well economic factor including unemployment rate gdp and housing price which are considered in the model for corporate loan key assumption and input included risk rating reasonable and supportable forecast credit conversion factor for unfunded lending commitment and economic factor including gdp and unemployment rate considered in the model key assumption and input for the qualitative component for consumer credit card loan include the expected normalization in portfolio performance and consumer behavior after lower loss observed result of government stimulus and market liquidity key and input for the qualitative component for corporate loan portfolio include uncertainty around the war in ukraine and global recession considering macroeconomic and market factor including inflation interest rate and commodity price and their impact on industry and sector that are considered more vulnerable the assessment also included an evaluation of the conceptual soundness and performance of the pd lgd and ead model in addition auditor judgment wa required to evaluate the sufficiency of audit evidence obtained the following are the primary procedure we performed to address this critical audit matter we evaluated the design and tested the operating effectiveness of certain internal control related to the company measurement of the collective acll estimate including control over the approval of the collective acll methodology determination of the key assumption and input used to estimate the quantitative and qualitative component of the collective acll performance monitoring of the pd lgd and ead model we evaluated the company process to develop the collective acll estimate by testing certain source of data and assumption that the company used and considered the relevance and reliability of such data and assumption in addition we involved credit risk professional with specialized skill and knowledge who assisted in reviewing the company collective acll methodology and key assumption for compliance with generally accepted accounting principle assessing the conceptual soundness and performance testing of the pd lgd and ead model by inspecting the model documentation to determine whether the model are suitable for their intended use evaluating judgment made by the company relative to the development and performance monitoring testing of the pd lgd and ead model by comparing them to relevant company specific metric assessing the conceptual soundness and performance testing of the macroeconomic scenario weight model by inspecting the model documentation to determine whether the model is suitable for it intended use assessing the economic forecast scenario through comparison to publicly available forecast evaluating the methodology used to develop certain economic forecast scenario by comparing it to relevant industry practice testing corporate loan risk rating for selection of borrower by evaluating the financial performance of the borrower source of repayment and any relevant guarantee or underlying collateral evaluating the methodology used in determining the qualitative component and the effect of that component on the collective acll compared with relevant credit risk factor and consistency with credit trend we also assessed the sufficiency of the audit evidence obtained related to the collective acll by evaluating the cumulative result of the audit procedure qualitative aspect of the company accounting practice potential bias in the accounting estimate evaluation of goodwill in the icg banking and pbwm pb reporting unitsas discussed in note and to the consolidated financial statement the goodwill balance of december wa billion of which billion related to reporting unit within the personal banking and wealth management pbwm segment billion related to reporting unit within the institutional client group icg segment and billion related to reporting unit within the legacy franchise segment the company performs goodwill impairment testing on an annual basis and whenever event or change in circumstance indicate that the carrying value of reporting unit likely exceeds it fair value this involves estimating the fair value of the reporting unit using both discounted cash flow analysis and market multiple approach we identified the evaluation of the goodwill impairment analysis for the icg banking and pbwm united state personal banking reporting unit one of the three reporting unit within the icg segment and one of the two reporting unit in the pbwm segment critical audit matter the estimated fair value of the icg banking and pbwm united state personal banking reporting unit marginally exceeded their carrying value indicating higher risk due to measurement uncertainty that the goodwill may be impaired and therefore involved high degree of subjective auditor judgment specifically the assessment encompassed the evaluation of the key assumption used in estimating the fair value of the icg banking and pbwm united state personal banking reporting unit which include the long term growth rate discount rate exit multiple assumption certain forecasted macroeconomic assumption used to inform the forecasted income by reporting unit and forecasted revenue and operating expense by reporting unit used in the discounted cash flow analysis the following are the primary procedure we performed to address this critical audit matter we evaluated the design and tested the operating effectiveness of certain internal control related to the company determination of the estimated fair value of the icg banking and pbwm united state personal banking reporting unit including control related to management process for assessing the appropriateness of certain assumption including the long term growth rate discount rate and exit multiple assumption used in the discounted cash flow certain forecasted macroeconomic assumption used to inform the forecasted income by reporting unit forecasted revenue and operating expense by reporting unit we compared the company historical forecast to actual result at consolidated level to ass the company ability to accurately forecast key metric such revenue and operating expense we also compared prior year actuals to the expected trend for revenue and operating expense at the reporting unit level to ass the company ability to achieve their forecast we compared the company fourth quarter forecast to actual fourth quarter result at the reporting unit level to ass the company ability to accurately forecast we evaluated the reasonableness of the company forecast by comparing to analyst report in addition we involved valuation professional with specialized skill and knowledge who assisted in developing an independent range of long term growth rate assumption by reviewing publicly available data and comparable industry and comparing it to the company assumption evaluating the discount rate by assessing the methodology used by management and developing an independent assumption for the discount rate developing an independent range of the exit multiple assumption using publicly available data for comparable entity and comparing it to the company assumption utilized in the discounted cash flow analysis developing an independent estimate of the fair value of icg banking and pbwm united state personal banking reporting unit using the income and market multiple approach and comparing the result to the company fair value estimate assessing the reasonableness of the market
