statement of cash flow in note citi ha revised the consolidated statement of cash flow to present purchase of investment sale of investment and proceeds from maturity of investment separately between afs debt security and htm debt security citi had no sale of htm debt security during the period presented operating and finance lease right of use asset and lease liability represent non cash investing and financing activity respectively and are not included in the non cash investing activity presented see note for more information and balance of december and respectively the note to the consolidated financial statement are an integral part of these consolidated financial statement to consolidated financial summary of significant accounting policiesthroughout these note citigroup citi and the company refer to citigroup inc and it consolidated subsidiary certain reclassification and update have been made to the prior period financial statement and note to conform to the current period presentation principle of consolidationthe consolidated financial statement include the account of citigroup and it subsidiary prepared in accordance with generally accepted accounting principle gaap the company consolidates subsidiary in which it hold directly or indirectly more than of the voting right or where it exercise control entity in which the company hold to of the voting right and or ha the ability to exercise significant influence other than investment of designated venture capital subsidiary or investment accounted for at fair value under the fair value option are accounted for under the equity method and the pro rata share of their income loss is included in other revenue income from investment in le than owned company is recognized when dividend are received discussed in more detail in note citigroup also consolidates entity deemed to be variable interest entity when citigroup is determined to be the primary beneficiary gain and loss on the disposition of branch subsidiary affiliate building and other investment are included in other revenue citibankcitibank citibank is commercial bank and indirect wholly owned subsidiary of citigroup citibank principal offering include investment banking commercial banking cash management trade finance and commerce private banking product and service consumer finance credit card and mortgage lending and retail banking product and service variable interest entity vies an entity is variable interest entity vie if it meet either of the criterion outlined in accounting standard codification asc topic consolidation which are the entity ha equity that is insufficient to permit the entity to finance it activity without additional subordinated financial support from other party or ii the entity ha equity investor that can not make significant decision about the entity operation or that do not absorb their proportionate share of the entity expected loss or expected return the company consolidates vie when it ha both the power to direct the activity that most significantly impact the vie economic performance and right to receive benefit or the obligation to absorb loss of the entity that could be potentially significant to the vie that is citi is the primary beneficiary in addition to variable interest held in consolidated vies the company ha variable interest in other vies that are not consolidated because the company is not the primary beneficiary all unconsolidated vies are monitored by the company to ass whether any event have occurred to cause it primary beneficiary status to change all entity not deemed to be vies with which the company ha involvement are evaluated for consolidation under other subtopics of asc see note for more detailed information foreign currency translationassets and liability of citi foreign operation are translated from their respective functional currency into dollar using period end spot foreign exchange rate the effect of those translation adjustment are reported in accumulated other comprehensive income loss aoci component of stockholder equity net of any related hedge and tax effect until realized upon sale or substantial liquidation of the foreign entity at which point such amount are reclassified into earnings revenue and expense of citi foreign operation are translated monthly from their respective functional currency into dollar at amount that approximate weighted average exchange rate for transaction that are denominated in currency other than the functional currency including transaction denominated in the local currency of foreign operation that use the dollar their functional currency the effect of change in exchange rate are primarily included in principal transaction along with the related effect of any economic hedge instrument used to hedge foreign currency exposure include foreign currency forward option and swap contract and in certain instance designated issue of non dollar debt foreign operation in country with highly inflationary economy designate the dollar their functional currency with the effect of change in exchange rate primarily included in other revenue investment securitiesinvestments include debt and equity security debt security include bond note and redeemable preferred stock well certain loan backed and structured security that are subject to prepayment risk equity security include common and nonredeemable preferred stock debt security debt security classified held to maturity htm are security that the company ha both the ability and the intent to hold until maturity and are carried at amortized cost interest income on such security is included in interest revenue debt security classified available for sale afs are carried at fair value with change in fair value reported in accumulated other comprehensive income loss component of stockholder equity net of applicable income tax and hedge interest income on such security is included in interest revenue investment in debt security classified htm or afs the accrual of interest income is suspended for investment that are in default or for which it is likely that future interest payment will not be made scheduled investment security not measured at fair value through earnings include debt security held in htm or afs ii equity security accounted for under the measurement alternative or equity method iii federal reserve bank and federal home loan bank stock and iv certain exchange membership these security are subject to evaluation for impairment described in note for htm security and in note for afs measurement alternative and equity method investment realized gain and loss on sale of investment are included in earnings primarily on specific identification basis the company us number of valuation technique for investment carried at fair value which are described in note equity security marketable equity security are measured at fair value with change in fair value recognized in earnings non marketable equity security are measured at fair value with change in fair value recognized in earnings unless the measurement alternative is elected or ii the investment represents federal reserve bank and federal home loan bank stock or certain exchange seat that continue to be carried at cost non marketable equity security under the measurement alternative are carried at cost le impairment if any plus or minus change resulting from observed price for orderly transaction for the identical or similar investment of the same issuer certain investment that would otherwise have been accounted for using the equity method are carried at fair value with change in fair value recognized in earnings since the company elected to apply fair value accounting trading account asset and liabilitiestrading account asset include debt and marketable equity security derivative in receivable position residual interest in securitizations and physical commodity inventory in addition described in note certain asset that citigroup ha elected to carry at fair value under the fair value option such loan and purchased guarantee are also included in trading account asset trading account liability include security sold not yet purchased short position and derivative in net payable position well certain liability that citigroup ha elected to carry at fair value described in note other than physical commodity inventory all trading account asset and liability are carried at fair value revenue generated from trading asset and trading liability are generally reported in principal transaction and include realized gain and loss well unrealized gain and loss resulting from change in the fair value of such instrument interest income on trading asset is recorded in interest revenue reduced by interest expense on trading liability physical commodity inventory is carried at the lower of cost or market with related loss reported in principal transaction except when included in hedging relationship realized gain and loss on sale of commodity inventory are included in principal transaction investment in unallocated precious metal account gold silver platinum and palladium are accounted for hybrid instrument containing debt host contract and an embedded non financial derivative instrument indexed to the price of the relevant precious metal the embedded derivative instrument and debt host contract are carried at fair value under the fair value option described in note derivative used for trading purpose include interest rate currency equity credit and commodity swap agreement option cap and floor warrant and financial and commodity future and forward contract derivative asset and liability position are presented net by counterparty on the consolidated balance sheet when valid master netting agreement exists and the other condition set out in asc topic balance sheet offsetting are met see note the company us number of technique to determine the fair value of trading asset and liability which are described in note security borrowed and security loanedsecurities borrowing and lending transaction do not constitute sale of the underlying security for accounting purpose and are treated collateralized financing transaction such transaction are recorded at the amount of proceeds advanced or received plus accrued interest described in note the company ha elected to apply fair value accounting to number of security borrowing and lending transaction fee received or paid for all security borrowing and lending transaction are recorded in interest revenue or interest expense at the contractually specified rate where the condition of asc balancesheet offsetting right of setoff condition are met security borrowing and lending transaction are presented net on the consolidated balance sheet the company monitor the fair value of security borrowed or loaned on daily basis and obtains or post additional collateral in order to maintain contractual margin protection described in note the company us discounted cash flow technique to determine the fair value of security lending and borrowing transaction repurchase and resale agreementssecurities sold under agreement to repurchase repos and security purchased under agreement to resell reverse repos do not constitute sale or purchase of the underlying security for accounting purpose and are treated collateralized financing transaction described in note the company ha elected to apply fair value accounting to certain portion of such transaction with change in fair value reported in earnings any transaction for which fair value accounting ha not been elected are recorded at the amount of cash advanced or received plus accrued interest irrespective of whether the company ha elected fair value accounting interest paid or received on all repo and reverse transaction is recorded in interest expense or interest revenue at the contractually specified rate where the condition of asc balance sheet offsetting repurchase and reverse repurchase agreement are met repos and reverse repos are presented net on the consolidated balance sheet the company policy is to take possession of security purchased under reverse repurchase agreement the company monitor the fair value of security subject to repurchase or resale on daily basis and obtains or post additional collateral in order to maintain contractual margin protection described in note the company us discounted cash flow technique to determine the fair value of repo and reverse repo transaction loansloans are reported at their outstanding principal balance net of any unearned income and unamortized deferred fee and cost except for credit card receivable balance which include accrued interest and fee loan origination fee and certain direct origination cost are generally deferred and recognized adjustment to income over the life of the related loan described in note citi ha elected fair value accounting for certain loan such loan are carried at fair value with change in fair value reported in earnings interest income on such loan is recorded in interest revenue at the contractually specified rate loan that are held for investment are classified loan net of unearned income on the consolidated balance sheet and the related cash flow are included within the cash flow from the investing activity category in the consolidated statement of cash flow on the line change in loan however when the initial intent for holding loan ha changed from held for investment to held for sale hf the loan is reclassified to hf but the related cash flow continue to be reported in cash flow from investing activity in the consolidated statement of cash flow on the line proceeds from sale and securitizations of loan consumer loansconsumer loan represent loan and lease managed primarily by the personal banking and wealth management and legacy franchise business except mexico sbmm loan consumer non accrual and re aging policiesas general rule interest accrual cease for installment and real estate both open and closed end loan when payment are day contractually past due for credit card and other unsecured revolving loan however citi generally accrues interest until payment are day past due result of occ guidance home equity loan in regulated bank entity are classified non accrual if the related residential first mortgage is day or more past due also result of occ guidance mortgage loan in regulated bank entity are classified non accrual within day of notification that the borrower ha filed for bankruptcy with the exception of federal housing administration fha insured loan loan that have been modified to grant concession to borrower in financial difficulty may not be accruing interest at the time of the modification the policy for returning such modified loan to accrual status varies by product and or region in most case minimum number of payment ranging from one to six is required while in other case the loan is never returned to accrual status for regulated bank entity such modified loan are returned to accrual status if credit evaluation at the time of or subsequent to the modification indicates the borrower is able to meet the restructured term and the borrower is current and ha demonstrated reasonable period of sustained payment performance minimum six month of consecutive payment for consumer loan generally one of the condition to qualify for modification other than for loan modification made through the care act relief provision or banking agency guidance for pandemic related issue is that minimum number of payment typically ranging from one to three must be made upon modification the loan is re aged to current status however re aging practice for certain open ended consumer loan such credit card are governed by federal financial institution examination council ffiec guideline for open ended consumer loan subject to ffiec guideline one of the condition for the loan to be re aged to current status is that at least three consecutive minimum monthly payment or the equivalent amount must be received in addition under ffiec guideline the number of time that such loan can be re aged is subject to limitation generally once in month and twice in five year furthermore fha and department of veteran affair va loan may only be modified under those respective agency guideline and payment are not always required in order to re age modified loan to current consumer charge off policiesciti charge off policy follow the general guideline below unsecured installment loan are charged off at day contractually past due unsecured revolving loan and credit card loan are charged off at day contractually past due loan secured with non real estate collateral are written down to the estimated value of the collateral le cost to sell at day contractually past due real estate secured loan are written down to the estimated value of the property le cost to sell at day contractually past due real estate secured loan are charged off no later than day contractually past due if decision ha been made not to foreclose on the loan unsecured loan in bankruptcy are charged off within day of notification of filing by the bankruptcy court or in accordance with citi charge off policy whichever occurs earlier real estate secured loan in bankruptcy other than fha insured loan are written down to the estimated value of the property le cost to sell within day of notification that the borrower ha filed for bankruptcy or in accordance with citi charge off policy whichever is earlier loanscorporate loan represent loan and lease managed by institutional client group icg and the mexico sbmm component of legacy franchise corporate loan are identified impaired and placed on cash non accrual basis when it is determined based on actual experience and forward looking assessment of the collectability of the loan in full that the payment of interest or principal is doubtful or when interest or principal is day past due except when the loan is well collateralized and in the process of collection any interest accrued on impaired corporate loan and lease is reversed at day past due and charged against current earnings and interest is thereafter included in earnings only to the extent actually received in cash when there is doubt regarding the ultimate collectability of principal all cash receipt are thereafter applied to reduce the recorded investment in the loan impaired corporate loan and lease are written down to the extent that principal is deemed to be uncollectible impaired collateral dependent loan and lease where repayment is expected to be provided solely by the sale of the underlying collateral and there are no other available and reliable source of repayment are carried at the lower of amortized cost or collateral value cash basis loan are returned to accrual status when all contractual principal and interest amount are reasonably assured of repayment and there is sustained period of repayment performance in accordance with the contractual term loan held for salecorporate and consumer loan that have been identified for sale are classified loan hf and included in other asset the practice of citi prime mortgage business ha been to sell substantially all of it conforming loan such prime mortgage conforming loan are classified hf and the fair value option is elected at origination with change in fair value recorded in other revenue with the exception of those loan for which the fair value option ha been elected hf loan are accounted for at the lower of cost or market value with any write down or subsequent recovery charged to other revenue the related cash flow are classified in the consolidated statement of cash flow in the cash flow from operating activity category on the line change in loan hf gain and loss on loan hf are generally presented in other revenue gain on sale of fully or partially charged off loan are presented gross credit recovery in the provision for credit loss up to the amount of prior charge offs allowance for credit loss acl commencing january citi adopted asc financial instrument credit loss using the methodology described below the current expected credit loss cecl methodology is based on relevant information about past event including historical experience current condition and reasonable and supportable forecast that affect the collectability of the reported financial asset balance if the asset life extends beyond the forecast period then historical experience is considered over the remaining life of the asset in the acl the resulting acl is adjusted in each subsequent reporting period through provision for credit loss in the consolidated statement of income to reflect change in history current condition and forecast well change in asset position and portfolio asc defines the acl valuation account that is deducted from the amortized cost of financial asset to present the net amount that management expects to collect on the financial asset over it expected life all financial asset carried at amortized cost are in the scope of asc while asset measured at fair value are excluded see note for discussion of impairment on available for sale afs security increase and decrease to the allowance are recorded in provision for credit loss the cecl methodology utilizes lifetime expected credit loss ecl measurement objective for the recognition of credit loss for held for investment hfi loan held to maturity htm debt security receivables and other financial asset measured at amortized cost at the time the financial asset is originated or acquired within the life of loan or other financial asset the methodology generally result in the earlier recognition of the provision for credit loss and the related acl than under the prior probable incurred loss model estimation of ecls requires citi to make assumption regarding the likelihood and severity of credit loss event and their impact on expected cash flow which drive the probability of default pd loss given default lgd and exposure at default ead model and where citi discount the ecl using discounting technique for certain product citi considers multitude of global macroeconomic variable for the base upside and downside probability weighted macroeconomic scenario forecast it us to estimate the acl citi forecast of the unemployment rate and real gdp growth rate represent the key macroeconomic variable that most significantly affect it estimate of the acl under the base macroeconomic forecast of real gdp growth is expected to decline during and the unemployment rate is expected to increase modestly over the forecast horizon broadly returning to pre pandemic level the macroeconomic scenario weight are estimated using statistical model which among other factor take into consideration key macroeconomic driver of the acl severity of the scenario and other macroeconomic uncertainty and risk citi evaluates scenario weight on quarterly basis citi downside scenario incorporates more adverse macroeconomic assumption than the base scenario for example compared to the base scenario citi downside scenario reflects more severe recession including an elevated average unemployment rate of over the eight quarter period with peak difference of in the second quarter of the downside scenario also reflects year over year real gdp contraction in of with peak quarter over quarter difference of in the second quarter of following are the main factor and interpretation that citi considers when estimating the acl under the cecl methodology cecl reserve are estimated over the contractual term of the financial asset which is adjusted for expected prepayment expected extension are generally not considered unless the option to extend the loan can not be canceled unilaterally by citi modification are also not considered unless citi ha reasonable expectation that it will execute troubled debt restructuring tdr credit enhancement that are not freestanding such those that are included in the original term of the contract or those executed in conjunction with the lending transaction are considered loss mitigants for purpose of cecl reserve estimation for unconditionally cancelable account generally credit card reserve are based on the expected life of the balance of the evaluation date assuming no further charge and do not include any undrawn commitment that are unconditionally cancelable reserve are included for undrawn commitment for account that are not unconditionally cancelable such letter of credit and corporate loan commitment home equity line of credit helocs undrawn mortgage loan commitment and financial guarantee cecl model are designed to be economically sensitive they utilize the macroeconomic forecast provided by citi enterprise scenario group that are approved by senior management analysis is performed and documented to determine the necessary qualitative management adjustment qma to capture idiosyncratic event and model uncertainty the portion of the forecast that reflects the enterprise scenario group period indicates the maximum length of time it model can produce macroeconomic forecast after which mean reversion reflecting historical loss experience is used for the remaining life of the loan to estimate expected credit loss for the loss forecast business consume the macroeconomic forecast determined to be appropriate and justifiable citi ability to forecast credit loss over the period is based on the ability to forecast economic activity over reasonable and supportable time window the period reflects the overall ability to have reasonable and supportable forecast of credit loss based on economic forecast the loss model consume all or portion of the economic forecast and then revert to historical loss experience the forecast period for consumer and corporate loan is eight quarter the acl incorporates provision for accrued interest on product that are not subject to non accrual and timely write off policy credit card etc the reserve for tdrs are calculated using method that considers discounted cash flow and appropriate macroeconomic forecast data for the exposure type for tdr loan that are collateral dependent the acl is based on the fair value of the collateral citi us the most recent available information to inform it macroeconomic forecast allowing sufficient time for analysis of the result and corresponding approval key variable are reviewed for significant change through year end and change to portfolio position are reflected in the acl reserve are calculated at an appropriately granular level and on pooled basis where financial asset share risk characteristic at minimum reserve are calculated at portfolio level product and country where financial asset doe not share risk characteristic with any of the pool it is evaluated for credit loss individually quantitative and qualitative component of the aclthe loss likelihood and severity model use both internal and external information and are sensitive to forecast of different macroeconomic condition for the quantitative component citi us multiple macroeconomic scenario and associated probability to estimate the ecl estimate of these ecls are based upon citigroup internal system of credit risk rating ii historical default and loss data including comprehensive internal history and rating agency information regarding default rate and internal data on the severity of loss in the event of default and iii forecast of future macroeconomic condition ecl is determined primarily by utilizing model for the borrower pd lgd and ead adjustment may be made to this data including statistically calculated estimate to cover the historical fluctuation of the default rate over the credit cycle the historical variability of loss severity among defaulted loan and the degree to which there are large obligor concentration in the global portfolio and ii adjustment made for specifically known item such current environmental factor and credit trend any adjustment needed to the modeled expected loss in the quantitative calculation are addressed through qualitative adjustment the qualitative adjustment considers among other thing certain portfolio characteristic and concentration collateral coverage model limitation idiosyncratic event and other relevant criterion under banking supervisory guidance for the acl the qualitative adjustment also reflects the estimated impact of the pandemic on the economic forecast and the impact on credit loss estimate the total acl is composed of the quantitative and qualitative component citi qualitative component declined year over year primarily driven by the incorporation of multiple macroeconomic scenario in the quantitative component and release of covid related uncertainty reserve the portfolio continues to normalize toward pre pandemic level and these risk are captured in the quantitative component of the acl see accounting change below for information about how the calculation of the quantitative component of the acl changed in loansfor consumer loan most portfolio including north america card mortgage and personal installment loan pils are covered by the pd lgd and ead loss forecasting model some smaller international portfolio are covered by econometric model where the gross credit loss gcl rate is forecasted the modeling of all retail product is performed by examining risk driver for given portfolio these driver relate to exposure with similar credit risk characteristic and consider past event current condition and forecast under the pd lgd ead approach gcls and recovery are captured on an undiscounted basis citi incorporates expected recovery on loan into it reserve estimate including expected recovery on asset previously written off cecl defines the exposure expected life the remaining contractual maturity including any expected prepayment subsequent change to the contractual term that are the result of re underwriting are not included in the loan expected cecl life citi doe not establish reserve for the uncollectible accrued interest on non revolving consumer product such mortgage and installment loan which are subject to non accrual and timely write off policy at day past due such only the principal balance is subject to the cecl reserve methodology and interest doe not attract further reserve deferred origination cost and fee related to new credit card account origination are amortized within month period and an acl is provided for component in the scope of the asc separate valuation allowance are determined for impaired smaller balance homogeneous loan whose term have been modified in tdr long term modification program and short term le than month modification that provide concession such interest rate reduction to borrower in financial difficulty are reported tdrs in addition loan modification that involve trial period are reported tdrs at the start of the trial period the acl for tdrs is determined using discounted cash flow dcf approach when dcf approach is used the initial allowance for ecls is calculated the expected contractual cash flow discounted at the loan original effective interest rate dcf technique are applied for consumer loan only if they are classified tdr loan exposure for credit card citi us the payment rate approach which leverage payment rate curve to determine the payment that should be applied to liquidate the end of period balance cecl balance in the estimation of ead the payment rate approach us customer payment behavior payment rate to establish the portion of the cecl balance that will be paid each month these payment rate are defined the percentage of principal payment received in the respective month divided by the prior month billed principal balance the liquidation cecl payment amount for each forecast period is determined by multiplying the cecl balance by that period forecasted payment rate the cumulative sum of these payment le the cecl balance produce the balance liquidation curve citi doe not apply non accrual policy to credit card receivables rather they are subject to full charge off at day past due or bankruptcy such the entire customer balance up until write off including accrued interest and fee is subject to the cecl reserve methodology corporate loan htm security and other assetsciti record allowance for credit loss on all financial asset carried at amortized cost that are in the scope of cecl including corporate loan classified hfi htm debt security and other asset discounting technique are applied for corporate loan classified hfi and htm security and non accrual tdr loan exposure all cash flow are fully discounted to the reporting date the acl includes citi estimate of all credit loss expected to be incurred over the estimated full contractual life of the financial asset the contractual life of the financial asset doe not include expected extension renewal or modification except for instance where the company reasonably expects to extend the tenor of the financial asset pursuant to future tdr where citi ha an unconditional option to extend the contractual term citi doe not consider the potential extension in determining the contractual term however where the borrower ha the sole right to exercise the extension option without citi approval citi doe consider the potential extension in determining the contractual term the decrease in credit loss under cecl at the date of adoption on january compared with the prior incurred loss methodology wa largely due to more precise contractual maturity that resulted in shorter remaining tenor the incorporation of recovery and use of more specific historical loss data based on an increase in portfolio segmentation across industry and geography the company primarily base it acl on model that ass the likelihood and severity of credit event and their impact on cash flow under forecasted economic scenario allowance consider the probability of the borrower default the loss the company would incur upon default and the borrower exposure at default such model discount the present value of all future cash flow using the asset effective interest rate eir citi applies more simplified approach based on historical loss rate to certain exposure recorded in other asset and certain loan exposure in the private bank within consumer loan the company considers the risk of nonpayment to be zero for treasury and government sponsored agency guaranteed mortgage backed security mb and such citi doe not have an acl for these security for all other htm debt security ecls are estimated using pd model and discounting technique which incorporate assumption regarding the likelihood and severity of credit loss for structured security specific model use relevant assumption for the underlying collateral type discounting approach is applied to htm direct obligation of single issuer similar to that used for corporate hfi loan other financial asset with zero expected credit lossesfor certain financial asset zero expected credit loss will be recognized where the expectation of nonpayment of the amortized cost basis is zero based on there being no history of loss and the nature of the receivables financing transactionsmost of citi reverse repurchase agreement security borrowing arrangement and margin loan require that the borrower continually adjust the amount of the collateral securing citi interest primarily resulting from change in the fair value of such collateral in such arrangement acls are recorded based only on the amount by which the asset amortized cost basis exceeds the fair value of the collateral no acls are recorded where the fair value of the collateral is equal to or exceeds the asset amortized cost basis citi doe not expect to incur credit loss on such well collateralized exposure for certain margin loan presented in loan on the consolidated balance sheet acll is estimated using the same approach corporate loan accrued interestcecl permit entity to make an accounting policy election not to reserve for interest if the entity ha policy in place that will result in timely reversal or write off of interest however when non accrual or timely charge off policy is not applied an acl is recognized on accrued interest at day past due for htm debt security citi established non accrual policy that result in timely write off of accrued interest for corporate loan where timely charge off policy is used citi ha elected to recognize an acl on accrued interest receivable the lgd model for corporate loan include an adjustment for estimated accrued interest reasonably expected tdrsfor corporate loan the reasonable expectation of the tdr concept requires that the contractual life over which ecls are estimated be extended when tdr that result in tenor extension is reasonably expected reasonably expected tdrs are included in the life of the asset discounting technique or collateral dependent practical expedient is used for non accrual and tdr loan exposure that do not share risk characteristic with other loan and are individually assessed loan modified in accordance with the care act and bank regulatory guidance are not classified tdrs purchased credit deteriorated pcd asset asc requires entity that have acquired financial asset such loan and htm security with an intent to hold to evaluate whether those asset have experienced more than insignificant deterioration in credit quality since origination these asset are subject to specialized accounting at initial recognition under cecl subsequent measurement of pcd asset will remain consistent with other purchased or originated asset non pcd asset cecl introduces the notion of pcd asset which replaces purchased credit impaired pci accounting under prior gaap cecl requires the estimation of credit loss to be performed on pool basis unless pcd asset doe not share characteristic with any pool if certain pcd asset do not meet the condition for aggregation those pcd asset should be accounted for separately this determination must be made at the date the pcd asset is purchased in estimating ecls from day onward pool can potentially be reassembled based upon similar risk characteristic when pcd asset are pooled citi determines the amount of the initial acl at the pool level the amount of the initial acl for pcd asset represents the portion of the total discount at acquisition that relates to credit and is recognized gross up of the purchase price to arrive at the pcd asset or pool amortized cost any difference between the unpaid principal balance and the amortized cost is considered to be related to non credit factor and result in discount or premium which is amortized to interest income over the life of the individual asset or pool direct expense incurred related to the acquisition of pcd asset and other asset and liability in business combination are expensed incurred subsequent accounting for acquired pcd asset is the same the accounting for originated asset change in the allowance are recorded in provision for credit loss consumerciti doe not purchase whole portfolio of pcd asset in it retail business however there may be small portion of purchased portfolio that is identified pcd at the purchase date interest income recognition doe not vary between pcd and non pcd asset consumer financial asset is considered to be more than insignificantly credit deteriorated if it is more than day past due at the purchase date corporateciti generally classifies wholesale loan and debt security classified htm or afs pcd when both of the following criterion are met the purchase price discount is at least of par and ii the purchase date is more than day after the origination or issuance date citi classifies htm beneficial interest rated aa and lower obtained at origination from certain securitization transaction pcd when there is significant difference or greater between contractual cash flow adjusted for prepayment and expected cash flow at the date of recognition reserve estimate and policiesmanagement provides reserve for an estimate of lifetime ecls in the funded loan portfolio on the consolidated balance sheet in the form of an acl these reserve are established in accordance with citigroup credit reserve policy approved by the audit committee of the citigroup board of director citi chief risk officer and chief financial officer review the adequacy of the credit loss reserve each quarter with risk management and finance representative for each applicable business area applicable business area include those having classifiably managed portfolio where internal credit risk rating are assigned primarily icg and delinquency managed portfolio primarily pbwm or modified consumer loan where concession were granted due to the borrower financial difficulty the aforementioned representative for these business area present recommended reserve balance for their funded and unfunded lending portfolio along with supporting quantitative and qualitative data discussed below estimated credit loss for portfolio of performing exposuresrisk management and finance representative who cover business area with delinquency managed portfolio smaller balance homogeneous loan present their recommended reserve balance based on leading credit indicator including loan delinquency and change in portfolio size well economic trend including current and future housing price unemployment length of time in foreclosure cost to sell and gdp this methodology is applied separately for each product within each geographic region in which these portfolio exist this evaluation process is subject to numerous estimate and judgment risk management and finance representative who cover business area with classifiably managed portfolio present their recommended reserve balance based on the frequency of default risk rating loss recovery rate size and diversity of individual large credit and ability of borrower with foreign currency obligation to obtain the foreign currency necessary for orderly debt servicing change in these estimate could have direct impact on the credit cost in any period and could result in change in the allowance allowance for unfunded lending commitmentscredit loss reserve are recognized on all off balance sheet commitment that are not unconditionally cancelable corporate loan ead model include an incremental usage factor or credit conversion factor to estimate ecls on amount undrawn at the reporting date off balance sheet commitment include unfunded exposure revolving facility security underwriting commitment letter of credit helocs and financial guarantee excluding performance guarantee this reserve is classified on the consolidated balance sheet in other liability change to the allowance for unfunded lending commitment are recorded in provision for credit loss on unfunded lending commitment mortgage servicing right msrs mortgage servicing right msrs are recognized intangible asset when purchased or when the company sell or securitizes loan acquired through purchase or origination and retains the right to service the loan mortgage servicing right are accounted for at fair value with change in value recorded in other revenue in the company consolidated statement of income for additional information on the company msrs see note and goodwillgoodwill represents the excess of acquisition cost over the fair value of net tangible and intangible asset acquired in business combination goodwill is subject to annual impairment testing and interim assessment between annual test if an event occurs or circumstance change that would more likely than not reduce the fair value of reporting unit below it carrying amount under asc topic intangible goodwill and other and upon the adoption of asu no on january the company ha an option to ass qualitative factor to determine if it is necessary to perform the goodwill impairment test if after assessing the totality of event or circumstance the company determines that it is not more likely than not that the fair value of reporting unit is le than it carrying amount no further testing is necessary if however the company determines that it is more likely than not that the fair value of reporting unit is le than it carrying amount then the company must perform the quantitative test the company ha an unconditional option to bypass the qualitative assessment for any reporting unit in any reporting period and proceed directly to the quantitative test the quantitative test requires comparison of the fair value of the individual reporting unit to it carrying value including goodwill if the fair value of the reporting unit is in excess of the carrying value the related goodwill is considered not impaired and no further analysis is necessary if the carrying value of the reporting unit exceeds the fair value an impairment loss is recognized in an amount equal to that excess limited to the total amount of goodwill allocated to that reporting unit upon any business disposition goodwill is allocated to and derecognized with the disposed business based on the ratio of the fair value of the disposed business to the fair value of the reporting unit additional information on citi goodwill impairment testing can be found in note intangible assetsintangible asset including core deposit intangible present value of future profit purchased credit card relationship credit card contract related intangible other customer relationship and other intangible asset but excluding msrs are amortized over their estimated useful life credit card contract related intangible include fixed and unconditional cost incurred to renew or extend the contract with card partner in estimating the useful life of credit card contract related intangible the company considers the probability of contract renewal or extension to determine the period that the asset is expected to contribute future cash flow intangible asset that are deemed to have indefinite useful life primarily trade name are not amortized and are subject to annual impairment test an impairment exists if the carrying value of the indefinite lived intangible asset exceeds it fair value for other intangible asset subject to amortization an impairment is recognized if the carrying amount is not recoverable and exceeds the fair value of the intangible asset premise and equipmentpremises and equipment includes lease right of use asset property and equipment including purchased and developed software net of depreciation and amortization substantially all lease right of use asset are amortized on straight line basis over the lease term and substantially all property and equipment is depreciated or amortized on straight line basis over the useful life of the asset other asset and other liabilitiesother asset include among other item loan hf deferred tax asset equity method investment interest and fee receivable repossessed asset other receivables and asset from business classified hf that are reclassified from other balance sheet line item other liability include among other item accrued expense lease liability deferred tax liability reserve for legal claim and legal fee accrual unfunded lending commitment repositioning reserve other payable and liability from business classified hf that are reclassified from other balance sheet line item legal fee accrual are recognized incurred other real estate owned and repossessed assetsreal estate or other asset received through foreclosure or repossession are generally reported in other asset net of valuation allowance for selling cost and subsequent decline in fair value securitizationsthere are two key accounting determination that must be made relating to securitizations citi first make determination to whether the securitization entity must be consolidated second it determines whether the transfer of financial asset to the entity is considered sale under gaap if the securitization entity is vie the company consolidates the vie if it is the primary beneficiary discussed in variable interest entity above for all other securitization entity determined not to be vies in which citigroup participates consolidation is based on which party ha voting control of the entity giving consideration to removal and liquidation right in certain partnership structure only securitization entity controlled by citigroup are consolidated interest in the securitized and sold asset may be retained in the form of subordinated or senior interest only strip subordinated tranche spread account and servicing right in credit card securitizations the company retains seller interest in the credit card receivables transferred to the trust which is not in securitized form in the case of consolidated securitization entity including the credit card trust these retained interest are not reported on citi consolidated balance sheet the securitized loan remain on the balance sheet substantially all of the consumer loan sold or securitized through non consolidated trust by citigroup are prime residential mortgage loan retained interest in non consolidated mortgage securitization trust are classified trading account asset except for msrs which are included in intangible asset on citigroup consolidated balance sheet debtshort term borrowing and long term debt are accounted for at amortized cost except where the company ha elected to report the debt instrument including certain structured note at fair value or debt that is in fair value hedging relationship premium discount and issuance cost on long term debt accounted for at amortized cost are amortized over the contractual term using the effective interest method transfer of financial assetsfor transfer of financial asset to be considered sale the asset must be legally isolated from the company even in bankruptcy or other receivership ii the purchaser must have the right to pledge or sell the asset transferred or if the purchaser is an entity whose sole purpose is to engage in securitization and asset backed financing activity through the issuance of beneficial interest and that entity is constrained from pledging the asset it receives each beneficial interest holder must have the right to sell or pledge their beneficial interest and iii the company may not have an option or obligation to reacquire the asset if these sale requirement are met the asset are removed from the company consolidated balance sheet if the condition for sale are not met the transfer is considered to be secured borrowing the asset remain on the consolidated balance sheet and the sale proceeds are recognized the company liability legal opinion on sale generally is obtained for complex transaction or where the company ha continuing involvement with asset transferred or with the securitization entity for transfer to be eligible for sale accounting that opinion must state that the asset transfer would be considered sale and that the asset transferred would not be consolidated with the company other asset in the event of the company insolvency for transfer of portion of financial asset to be considered sale the portion transferred must meet the definition of participating interest participating interest must represent pro rata ownership in an entire financial asset all cash flow must be divided proportionately with the same priority of payment no participating interest in the transferred asset may be subordinated to the interest of another participating interest holder and no party may have the right to pledge or exchange the entire financial asset unless all participating interest holder agree otherwise the transfer is accounted for secured borrowing see note for further discussion risk management activity derivative used for hedging purposesthe company manages it exposure to market movement outside of it trading activity by modifying the asset and liability mix either directly or through the use of derivative financial product including interest rate swap future forward purchased option and commodity well foreign exchange contract these end user derivative are carried at fair value in trading account asset and trading account liability see note for further discussion of the company hedging and derivative activity instrument specific credit riskciti present separately in aoci the portion of the total change in the fair value of liability resulting from change in the instrument specific credit risk when the entity ha elected to measure the liability at fair value in accordance with the fair value option for financial instrument accordingly the change in fair value of liability for which the fair value option wa elected related to change in citigroup own credit spread is presented in aoci employee benefit expenseemployee benefit expense includes current service cost of pension and other postretirement benefit plan which are accrued on current basis contribution and unrestricted award under other employee plan the amortization of restricted stock award and cost of other employee benefit for it most significant pension and postretirement benefit plan significant plan citigroup measure and discloses obligation plan asset and periodic plan expense quarterly instead of annually the effect of remeasuring the significant plan obligation and asset by updating plan actuarial assumption on quarterly basis is reflected in accumulated other comprehensive income loss and periodic plan expense all other plan all other plan are remeasured annually benefit earned during the year are reported in compensation and benefit expense and all other component of the net annual benefit cost are reported in other operating expense in the consolidated statement of income see note stock based compensationthe company recognizes compensation expense related to stock award over the requisite service period generally based on the instrument grant date fair value reduced by actual forfeiture they occur compensation cost related to award granted to employee who meet certain age plus year of service requirement retirement eligible employee is accrued in the year prior to the grant date in the same manner the accrual for cash incentive compensation certain stock award with performance condition or certain clawback provision are subject to variable accounting pursuant to which the associated compensation expense fluctuates with change in citigroup common stock price see note income taxesthe company is subject to the income tax law of the and it state and municipality well the non jurisdiction in which it operates these tax law are complex and may be subject to different interpretation by the taxpayer and the relevant governmental taxing authority in establishing provision for income tax expense the company must make judgment and interpretation about these tax law the company must also make estimate about when in the future certain item will affect taxable income in the various tax jurisdiction both domestic and foreign dispute over interpretation of the tax law may be subject to review and adjudication by the court system of the various tax jurisdiction or may be settled with the taxing authority upon examination or audit the company treat interest and penalty on income tax component of income tax expense deferred tax are recorded for the future consequence of event that have been recognized in financial statement or tax return based upon enacted tax law and rate deferred tax asset are recognized subject to management judgment about whether realization is more likely than not asc income tax set out consistent framework to determine the appropriate level of tax reserve to maintain for uncertain tax position this interpretation us two step approach wherein tax benefit is recognized if position is more likely than not to be sustained the amount of the benefit is then measured to be the highest tax benefit that is more than likely to be realized asc also set out disclosure requirement to enhance transparency of an entity tax reserve see note for further description of the company tax provision and related income tax asset and liability commission underwriting and principal transactionscommissions and fee revenue are recognized in income when earned underwriting revenue are recognized in income typically at the closing of the transaction principal transaction revenue are recognized in income on trade date basis see note for description of the company revenue recognition policy for commission and fee and note for detail of principal transaction revenue earnings per shareearnings per share eps is calculated using the two class method under the two class method all earnings distributed and undistributed are allocated to common stock and participating security undistributed earnings are calculated after deducting preferred stock dividend any issuance cost incurred at the time of issuance of redeemed preferred stock and dividend paid and accrued to common stock and rsu dsa share award citi grant restricted and deferred share award under it share based compensation program which entitle recipient to receive nonforfeitable dividend during the vesting period on basis equivalent to dividend paid to holder of the company common stock these unvested award meet the definition of participating security based on their respective right to receive nonforfeitable dividend and they are treated separate class of security and are not included in computing basic eps diluted eps incorporates the potential impact of contingently issuable share stock option and award which require future service condition of delivery of the underlying common stock anti dilutive option and warrant are disregarded in the eps calculation diluted eps is calculated under both the two class and treasury stock method and the more dilutive amount is reported participating security are not included incremental share in computing diluted eps use of estimatesmanagement must make estimate and assumption that affect the consolidated financial statement and the related note such estimate are used in connection with certain fair value measurement see note for further discussion on estimate used in the determination of fair value moreover estimate are significant in determining the amount of other than temporary impairment impairment of goodwill and other intangible asset provision for probable loss that may arise from credit related exposure probable and estimable loss related to litigation and regulatory proceeding and income tax while management make it best judgment actual amount or result could differ from those estimate cash equivalent and restricted cash flowscash equivalent are defined those amount included in cash and due from bank and deposit with bank certain cash balance are restricted by regulatory or contractual requirement see note for additional information on restricted cash party transactionsthe company ha related party transaction with certain of it subsidiary and affiliate these transaction which are primarily short term in nature include cash account collateralized financing transaction margin account derivative transaction charge for operational support and the borrowing and lending of fund and are entered into in the ordinary course of business accounting changesreference rate reform on december the financial accounting standard board fasb issued asu no reference rate reform topic deferral of the sunset date of topic which extends the period of time preparers can utilize the reference rate reform relief guidance in the fasb issued asu no reference rate reform topic facilitation of the effect of reference rate reform on financial reporting which provides optional guidance to ease the potential burden in accounting for or recognizing the effect of reference rate reform on financial reporting in the financial conduct authority fca delayed the intended cessation date of certain tenor of usd libor to june to ensure the relief in topic cover the period of time during which significant number of modification may take place the asu defers the sunset date of topic from multiple macroeconomic scenario based acl approachduring the second quarter of citi refined it acl methodology to utilize multiple macroeconomic scenario to estimate it allowance for credit loss the acl wa previously estimated using combination of single base case forecast scenario part of it quantitative component and component of it qualitative management adjustment that reflects economic uncertainty from downside macroeconomic scenario result of this change citi now explicitly incorporates multiple macroeconomic scenario base upside and downside and associated probability in the quantitative component when estimating it acl while still retaining certain of it qualitative management adjustment this refinement represents change in accounting estimate under asc topic accounting change and error correction with prospective application beginning in the period of change this change in accounting estimate resulted in decrease of approximately billion in the allowance for credit loss in the second quarter of partially offsetting an increase of billion in the allowance for credit loss due to the increased macroeconomic uncertainty and other factor in the second quarter of accounting for deposit insurance expensesduring the fourth quarter of citi changed it presentation of the deposit insurance cost paid to the federal deposit insurance corporation fdic and similar foreign regulator these cost were previously presented within interest expense and result of this change are now presented within other operating expense citi concluded that this presentation wa preferable in citi circumstance it better reflected the nature of these deposit insurance cost in that these cost do not directly represent interest payment to creditor but are similar in nature to other payment to regulatory agency that are accounted for operating expense this change in income statement presentation represents change in accounting principle under asc topic accounting change and error correction with retrospective application to the earliest period presented this change in accounting principle resulted in reclassification of million million and million of deposit insurance expense from interest expense to other operating expense for the year ended december and respectively this change had no impact on citi net income or the total deposit insurance expense incurred by citi accounting for financial instrument credit lossesoverviewin june the fasb issued asu no financial instrument credit loss topic the asu introduced new credit loss methodology the cecl methodology which requires earlier recognition of credit loss while also providing additional disclosure about credit risk citi adopted the asu of january which discussed below resulted in an increase in citi allowance for credit loss and decrease to opening retained earnings net of deferred income tax at january the cecl methodology utilizes lifetime expected credit loss measurement objective for the recognition of credit loss for loan htm debt security receivables and other financial asset measured at amortized cost at the time the financial asset is originated or acquired the acl is adjusted each period for change in lifetime expected credit loss the cecl methodology represents significant change from prior gaap and replaced the prior multiple existing impairment method which generally required that loss be incurred before it wa recognized within the life cycle of loan or other financial asset the methodology generally result in the earlier recognition of the provision for credit loss and the related acl than prior gaap for available for sale debt security where fair value is le than cost that citi intends to hold or more likely than not will not be required to sell credit related impairment if any is recognized through an acl and adjusted each period for change in credit risk january cecl transition day impactthe cecl methodology impact on expected credit loss among other thing reflects citi view of the current state of the economy forecasted macroeconomic condition and quality of citi portfolio at the january date of based on forecast of macroeconomic condition and exposure at that time the aggregate impact to citi wa an approximate billion or an approximate pretax increase in the allowance for credit loss along with billion after tax decrease in retained earnings and deferred tax asset increase of billion this transition impact reflects billion build to the allowance for credit loss for citi consumer exposure primarily driven by the impact on credit card receivables of longer estimated tenor under the cecl lifetime expected credit loss methodology loss coverage of approximately month compared to shorter estimated tenor under the probable loss methodology under prior gaap loss coverage of approximately month net of recovery and ii release of billion of reserve primarily related to citi corporate net loan loss exposure largely due to more precise contractual maturity that result in shorter remaining tenor incorporation of recovery and use of more specific historical loss data based on an increase in portfolio segmentation across industry and geography accounting for variable post charge off third party collection costsduring the second quarter of citi changed it accounting for variable post charge off third party collection cost whereby these cost were accounted for an increase in expense incurred rather than reduction in expected credit recovery citi concluded that such change in the method of accounting is preferable in citi circumstance it better reflects the nature of these collection cost that is these cost do not represent reduced payment from borrower and are similar to citi other executory third party vendor contract that are accounted for operating expense incurred result of this change citi had consumer acl release of million in the second quarter of for it card portfolio and million in the third quarter of for it international portfolio in the fourth quarter of citi revised the second quarter of accounting conclusion from change in accounting estimate effected by change in accounting principle to change in accounting principle which required an adjustment to opening retained earnings rather than net income with retrospective application to the earliest period presented citi considered the guidance in asc topic accounting change and error correction asc topic interim reporting asc topic assessing materiality and asc topic accounting change not retroactively applied due to immateriality considering the effect of prior year misstatement when quantifying misstatement in current year financial statement citi belief that the effect of the revision were not material to any previously reported quarterly or annual period result citi full year and quarterly result were revised to reflect this change if it were effective of january impact to and were de minimis accordingly activity and cash flow from operating activity based on it accounting policy during those period such citi revised it and cash flow within it consolidated statement of cash flow follows million of investing activity within other net although immaterial citi ha adjusted both and cash flow within the consolidated statement of cash flow in accordance with this change in presentation after considering the impact of the revision described above the impact of the change in presentation resulted in immaterial increase in cash flow from operating activity and corresponding decrease in cash flow from investing activity of billion and million in and respectively accounting changestdrs and vintage disclosure in march the fasb issued asu no financial instrument credit loss topic troubled debt restructurings and vintage disclosure citi adopted the asu on january the asu eliminates the accounting and disclosure requirement for tdrs including the requirement to measure the acll for tdrs using discounted cash flow dcf approach citi adopted the guidance on the recognition and measurement of tdrs under the modified retrospective approach upon adoption citi discontinued the use of dcf approach for consumer loan formerly considered tdrs beginning january citi measured the acll for all consumer loan under approach that do not incorporate discounting primarily utilizing model that consider the borrower probability of default loss given default and exposure at default this change resulted in decrease to the acll and deferred tax asset of approximately million and million respectively and an increase to retained earnings and other asset of approximately million and million respectively on january the acll for corporate loan wa unaffected because the measurement approach used for corporate loan is not in the scope of this asu the asu also requires disclosure of modification of loan to borrower experiencing financial difficulty if the modification involves principal forgiveness an interest rate reduction an other than insignificant payment delay term extension or combination of those type of modification in addition the asu requires the disclosure of current period gross write offs by year of loan origination vintage the amendment related to disclosure are required to be applied prospectively beginning of the date of adoption citi will present the new disclosure for period beginning on and after january fair value hedging portfolio layer method in march the fasb issued asu no derivative and hedging topic fair value hedging portfolio layer method intended to better align hedge accounting with an organization risk management strategy specifically the guidance expands the current single layer method to allow multiple hedge layer of single closed portfolio of qualifying asset which include both prepayable and non prepayable asset upon the adoption of the guidance entity may elect to reclassify security held to maturity to the available for sale category provided that the reclassified security are designated in portfolio hedge coincident with the adoption of this asu on january citi transferred htm mortgage backed security with an amortized cost and fair value of approximately billion and billion respectively into afs permitted under the guidance and hedged them under the portfolio layer method fair value measurement of equity security subject to contractual sale restrictionsin june the fasb issued asu no fair value measurement topic fair value measurement of equity security subject to contractual sale restriction the asu wa issued to address diversity in practice whereby certain entity included the impact of contractual restriction when valuing equity security and it clarifies that contractual restriction on the sale of an equity security should not be considered part of the unit of account of the equity security and therefore should not be considered in measuring fair value the asu also includes requirement for entity to disclose the fair value of equity security subject to contractual sale restriction the nature and remaining duration of the restriction and the circumstance that could cause lapse in the restriction the asu is to be adopted on prospective basis and will be effective for citi on january although early adoption is permitted adoption of the accounting standard is not expected to have an impact on citi operating result or financial position the company excludes such restriction when valuing equity security long duration insurance contractsin august the fasb issued asu no financial service insurance targeted improvement to the accounting for long duration contract which change the existing recognition measurement presentation and disclosure for long duration contract issued by an insurance entity specifically the guidance improves the timeliness of recognizing change in the liability for future policy benefit and prescribes the rate used to discount future cash flow for long duration insurance contract ii simplifies and improves the accounting for certain market based option or guarantee associated with deposit or account balance contract iii simplifies the amortization of deferred acquisition cost and iv introduces additional quantitative and qualitative disclosure citi ha certain insurance subsidiary primarily in mexico that issue long duration insurance contract such traditional life insurance policy and life contingent annuity contract that are impacted by the requirement of asu the effective date of asu wa deferred for all insurance entity by asu finance service insurance effective date issued in october and by asu financial service insurance effective date and early application issued in november citi adopted the targeted improvement in asu on january there wa no material impact to citi financial position upon adoption and citi expects no material impact to it result of operation result of adopting the amendment held for sale see note and brokerage payable commission and fee administration and other fiduciary feescommissions and feesthe primary component of commission and fee revenue are investment banking fee brokerage commission credit card and bank card income and deposit related fee investment banking fee are substantially composed of underwriting and advisory revenue such fee are recognized at the point in time when citigroup performance under the term of contractual arrangement is completed which is typically at the closing of transaction reimbursed expense related to these transaction are recorded revenue and are included within investment banking fee in certain instance for advisory contract citi will receive amount in advance of the deal closing in these instance the amount received will be recognized liability and not recognized in revenue until the transaction close for the period presented the contract liability amount wa negligible out of pocket expense associated with underwriting activity are deferred and recognized at the time the related revenue is recognized while out of pocket expense associated with advisory arrangement are expensed incurred in general expense incurred related to investment banking transaction whether consummated or not are recorded in other operating expense the company ha determined that it act principal in the majority of these transaction and therefore present expense gross within other operating expense brokerage commission primarily include commission and fee from the following executing transaction for client on exchange and over the counter market sale of mutual fund and other annuity product and assisting client in clearing transaction providing brokerage service and other such activity brokerage commission are recognized in commission and fee at the point in time the associated service is fulfilled generally on the trade execution date sale of certain investment product include portion of variable consideration associated with the underlying product in these instance portion of the revenue associated with the sale of the product is not recognized until the variable consideration becomes fixed and determinable the company recognized million million and million of revenue related to such variable consideration for the year ended december and respectively these amount primarily relate to performance obligation satisfied in prior period credit card and bank card income is primarily composed of interchange fee which are earned by card issuer based on purchase sale and certain card fee including annual fee cost related to customer reward program and certain payment to partner primarily based on program sale profitability and customer acquisition are recorded reduction of credit card and bank card income citi credit card program have certain partner sharing agreement that vary by partner these partner sharing agreement are subject to contractually based performance threshold that if met would require citi to make ongoing payment to the partner the threshold is based on the profitability of program and is generally calculated based on predefined program revenue le predefined program expense in most of citi partner sharing agreement program expense include net credit loss which to the extent that the increase in net credit loss reduces citi liability for the partner share for given program year would generally result in lower payment to partner in total for that year and vice versa further in some instance other partner payment are based on program sale and new account acquisition interchange revenue are recognized earned on daily basis when citi performance obligation to transmit fund to the payment network ha been satisfied annual card fee net of origination cost are deferred and amortized on straight line basis over month period cost related to card reward program are recognized when the reward are earned by the cardholder payment to partner are recognized when incurred deposit related fee consist of service charge on deposit account and fee earned from performing cash management activity and other deposit account service such fee are recognized in the period in which the related service is provided transactional service fee primarily consist of fee charged for processing service such cash management global payment clearing international fund transfer and other trade service such fee are recognized when the associated service is satisfied which normally occurs at the point in time the service is requested by the customer and provided by citi insurance distribution revenue consists of commission earned from third party insurance company for marketing and selling insurance policy on behalf of such entity such commission are recognized in commission and fee at the point in time the associated service is fulfilled generally when the insurance policy is sold to the policyholder sale of certain insurance product include portion of variable consideration associated with the underlying product in these instance portion of the revenue associated with the sale of the policy is not recognized until the variable consideration becomes fixed and determinable the company recognized million million and million of revenue related to such variable consideration for the year ended december and respectively these amount primarily relate to performance obligation satisfied in prior period insurance premium consist of premium income from insurance policy that citi ha underwritten and sold to policyholder following table present
