and other fiduciary feesadministration and other fiduciary fee revenue is primarily composed of custody fee and fiduciary fee the custody product is composed of numerous service related to the administration safekeeping and reporting for both and non denominated security the service offered to client include trade settlement safekeeping income collection corporate action notification record keeping and reporting tax reporting and cash management these service are provided for wide range of security including but not limited to equity municipal and corporate bond mortgage and asset backed security money market instrument treasury and agency derivative instrument mutual fund alternative investment and precious metal custody fee are recognized or when the associated promised service is satisfied which normally occurs at the point in time the service is requested by the customer and provided by citi fiduciary fee consist of trust service and investment management service an escrow agent citi receives safekeeps service and manages client escrowed asset such cash security property including intellectual property contract or other collateral citi performs it escrow agent duty by safekeeping the asset during the specified time period agreed upon by all party and therefore earns it revenue evenly during the contract duration investment management service consist of managing asset on behalf of citi retail and institutional client revenue from these service primarily consists of asset based fee for advisory account which are based on the market value of the client asset and recognized monthly when the market value is fixed in some instance the company contract with third party advisor and with third party custodian the company ha determined that it act principal in the majority of these transaction and therefore present the amount paid to third party gross within other operating expense the following table present administration and other fiduciary fee revenue various form of immediate and deferred award part of it discretionary annual incentive award program involving large segment of citigroup employee worldwide discretionary annual incentive award are generally awarded in the first quarter of the year based on the previous year performance award valued at le than or the local currency equivalent are generally paid entirely in the form of an immediate cash bonus pursuant to citigroup policy and or regulatory requirement certain employee are subject to mandatory deferral of incentive pay and generally receive of their award in the form of deferred stock or deferred cash stock unit discretionary annual incentive award to certain employee in the eu are subject to deferral requirement regardless of the total award value with at least of the immediate incentive delivered in the form of stock payment award subject to restriction on sale or transfer generally for month for incentive award granted in citigroup changed the annual deferred compensation structure from granting deferred cash award for certain regulated employee to deferred stock award certain employee located in country that have regulation or tax advantage for offering deferred cash or deferred cash stock unit received those type of award part of their annual incentive compensation rather than deferred stock subject to certain exception principally for retirement eligible employee continuous employment within citigroup is required to vest in deferred annual incentive award post employment vesting by retirement eligible employee and participant who meet other condition is generally conditioned upon their compliance with certain restriction during the remaining vesting period generally the deferred award vest in equal annual installment over three or four year period vested stock award are delivered in share of common stock deferred cash award are payable in cash and except prohibited by applicable regulatory guidance earn fixed notional rate of interest that is paid only if and when the underlying principal award amount vest deferred cash stock unit award are payable in cash at the vesting value of the underlying stock generally in the eu vested share are subject to restriction on sale or transfer after vesting and vested deferred cash award and deferred cash stock unit are subject to hold back generally for or month based on the award type stock award deferred cash stock unit and deferred cash award are subject to one or more cancellation and clawback provision that apply in certain circumstance including gross misconduct every february from to for performance in the year prior to the award date based on two performance metric for psus awarded in and those metric were return on tangible common equity and earnings per share for psus award in and the metric were return on tangible common equity and tangible book value per share in each year the metric were equally weighted for all award year if the total shareholder return is negative over the three year performance period executive may earn no more than of the target psus regardless of the extent to which citigroup outperforms against performance goal and or peer firm the number of psus ultimately earned could vary from zero if performance goal are not met to much of target if performance goal are meaningfully exceeded the reported financial metric during the performance period are adjusted to reflect an equitable adjustment required under the applicable award agreement for unusual and non recurring item including divestiture well accounting rule and tax law change for all award year the value of each psu is equal to the value of one share of citi common stock dividend equivalent are accrued and paid on the number of earned psus after the end of the performance period are subject to variable accounting pursuant to which the associated value of the award will fluctuate with change in citigroup stock price and the attainment of the specified performance goal for each award the award is settled solely in cash after the end of each performance period the value of the award subject to the performance goal and taking into account any mandatory equitable adjustment per the term of the award agreement is estimated using simulation model that incorporates multiple valuation assumption including the probability of achieving the specified performance goal of each award the risk free rate used in the model is based on the applicable treasury yield curve other significant assumption for the award are follows valuation expected compensation performance management and culture cpc committee of citigroup board of director approved program for them to earn additional compensation based on the achievement of citi transformation goal from august through december and satisfaction of other condition performance under the program is divided into three consecutive period ending on december and the award are subject to variable accounting pursuant to which the associated value of the award will fluctuate with the attainment of the performance condition for each tranche and change to citigroup stock price for the third tranche payment for each period will be in cash in lump sum with the third payment indexed to change in the value of citi common stock from the service inception date through the payment date earnings generally will be based on collective performance with respect to citi transformation goal and will be evaluated and approved by the cpc committee on an annual basis payment in the event of any category of employment termination or change in job title or employment status are subject to citi discretion cancellation and clawback are provided for in the event of misconduct and certain other circumstance the program applies to senior leader other than the ceo critical to helping deliver successful transformation with the value varying based on individual compensation level stock option programall outstanding option were fully vested at december and exercised during with none outstanding at december and other variable incentive compensationcitigroup ha various incentive plan globally accounting the total expense recognized for stock award represents the grant date fair value of such award which is generally recognized charge to income ratably over the vesting period other than for award to retirement eligible employee and immediately vested award whenever award are granted or are expected to be granted to retirement eligible employee the charge to income is accelerated based on when the applicable condition for retirement eligibility were or will be met if the employee is retirement eligible on the grant date or the award is vested at the grant date citi recognizes the expense each year equal to the grant date fair value of the award that it estimate will be granted in the following year recipient of citigroup stock award generally do not have any stockholder right until share are delivered upon vesting or exercise recipient of deferred stock award and deferred cash stock unit award however may except prohibited by applicable regulatory guidance be entitled to receive or accrue dividend equivalent payment during the vesting period recipient of stock payment award and other stock award subject to sale restriction period are generally entitled to vote the share in their award and receive dividend on such share during the sale restriction period once stock award vest the share delivered to the participant are freely transferable unless they are subject to restriction on sale or transfer for specified period all equity award granted since april have been made pursuant to stockholder approved stock incentive plan that are administered by the cpc to effective october ratethe discount rate for the pension and postretirement plan were selected by reference to citigroup specific analysis using each plan specific cash flow and hypothetical bond portfolio of high quality corporate bond that match each plan projected cash flow the discount rate for the non pension and postretirement plan are selected by reference to each plan specific cash flow and market based yield curve developed from the available local high quality corporate bond however where developed corporate bond market do not exist the discount rate are selected by reference to local government bond with an estimated premium added to reflect the additional risk for corporate bond in certain country where available the resulting plan yield by jurisdiction are compared with published high quality corporate bond index for reasonableness expected return on assetsthe company determines it assumption for the expected return on asset for it pension and postretirement plan using building block approach which focus on range of anticipated rate of return for each asset class weighted average range of nominal rate is then determined based on target allocation to each asset class market performance over number of earlier year is evaluated covering wide range of economic condition to determine whether there are sound reason for projecting any past trend the company considers the expected return on asset to be long term assessment of return expectation and doe not anticipate changing this assumption unless there are significant change in investment strategy or economic condition this contrast with the selection of the discount rate and certain other assumption which are reconsidered annually or quarterly for the significant plan in accordance with gaap the expected return on asset reflects the expected annual appreciation of the plan asset and reduces the company annual pension expense the expected return on asset is deducted from the sum of service cost interest cost and other component of pension expense to arrive at the net pension benefit expense the following table show the expected return on asset used in determining the company pension expense compared to the actual return on asset during and for the pension and postretirement plan plan during the year return on assetsu pension and postretirement veba trust return on asset pension and postretirement trust actual return on asset is presented net of fee the expected return on asset for the veba trust wa adjusted from to effective january to reflect significant change in economic decreasein million of plan non the qualified pension plan wa frozen in and result most of the prospective service cost have been eliminated and the gain loss amortization period wa changed to the life expectancy for inactive participant result pension expense for the qualified pension plan is driven more by interest cost than service cost and an increase in the discount rate would increase pension expense while decrease in discount rate would decrease pension expense for non pension plan that are not frozen in country such mexico the and south korea there is more service cost the pension expense for the non plan is driven by both service cost and interest cost an increase in the discount rate generally decrease pension expense due to the greater impact on service cost compared to interest cost the following table summarize the effect on pension expense expected return on asset one percentage point increasein million of plan non plan one percentage point decreasein million of gainspurchases sale and issuancestransfers in and or out of level level fair value at dec estate annuity other total investment strategythe company global pension and postretirement fund investment strategy is to invest in prudent manner for the exclusive purpose of providing benefit to participant the investment strategy are targeted to produce total return that when combined with the company contribution to the fund will maintain the fund ability to meet all required benefit obligation risk is controlled through diversification of asset type and investment in domestic and international equity fixed income security and cash and short term investment the target asset allocation in most location outside the is primarily in equity and debt security these allocation may vary by geographic region and country depending on the nature of applicable obligation and various other regional consideration the wide variation in the actual range of plan asset allocation for the funded non plan is result of differing local statutory requirement and economic condition for example in certain country local law requires that all pension plan asset must be invested in fixed income investment government fund or local country security significant concentration of risk in plan assetsthe asset of the company pension plan are diversified to limit the impact of any individual investment the qualified pension plan is diversified across multiple asset class with publicly traded fixed income publicly traded equity hedge fund and real estate representing the most significant asset allocation investment in these four asset class are further diversified across fund manager strategy vintage sector and geography depending on the specific characteristic of each asset class the pension asset for the company non significant plan are primarily invested in publicly traded fixed income and publicly traded equity security oversight and risk management practicesthe framework for the company pension oversight process includes monitoring of retirement plan by plan fiduciary and or management at the global regional or country level appropriate independent risk management contributes to the risk oversight and monitoring for the company qualified pension plan and non significant pension plan although the specific component of the oversight process are tailored to the requirement of each region country and plan the following element are common to the company monitoring and risk management process periodic asset liability management study and strategic asset allocation review periodic monitoring of funding level and funding ratio periodic monitoring of compliance with asset allocation guideline periodic monitoring of asset class and or investment manager performance against benchmark and periodic risk capital analysis and stress testing estimated future benefit payment the company expects to pay the following estimated benefit payment in future year received for security total net the above table do not include security for security lending transaction of billion and billion at december and respectively where the company act lender and receives security that can be sold or pledged collateral in these transaction the company recognizes the security received at fair value within other asset and the obligation to return those security liability within brokerage payable see note for further information the resale and repurchase agreement represent collateralized financing transaction citi executes these transaction primarily through it broker dealer subsidiary to facilitate customer matched book activity and to efficiently fund portion of citi trading inventory transaction executed by citi bank subsidiary primarily facilitate customer financing activity to maintain reliable funding under wide range of market condition including under period of stress citi manages these activity by taking into consideration the quality of the underlying collateral and stipulating financing tenor citi manages the risk in it collateralized financing transaction by conducting daily stress test to account for change in capacity tenor haircut collateral profile and client action in addition citi maintains counterparty diversification by establishing concentration trigger and assessing counterparty reliability and stability under stress it is the company policy to take possession of the underlying collateral monitor it market value relative to the amount due under the agreement and when necessary require prompt transfer of additional collateral in order to maintain contractual margin protection for resale and repurchase agreement when necessary the company post additional collateral in order to maintain contractual margin protection collateral typically consists of government and government agency security corporate and municipal bond equity and mortgage and other asset backed security the resale and repurchase agreement are generally documented under industry standard agreement that allow the prompt close out of all transaction including the liquidation of security held and the offsetting of obligation to return cash or security by the non defaulting party following payment default or other type of default under the relevant master agreement event of default generally include failure to deliver cash or security required under the transaction ii failure to provide or return cash or security used for margining purpose iii breach of representation iv cross default to another transaction entered into among the party or in some case their affiliate and repudiation of obligation under the agreement the counterparty that receives the security in these transaction is generally unrestricted in it use of the security with the exception of transaction executed on tri party basis where the collateral is maintained by custodian and operational limitation may restrict it use of the security substantial portion of the resale and repurchase agreement is recorded at fair value the company elected the fair value option described in note and the remaining portion is carried at the amount of cash initially advanced or received plus accrued interest specified in the respective agreement the security borrowing and lending agreement also represent collateralized financing transaction similar to the resale and repurchase agreement collateral typically consists of government and government agency security and corporate debt and equity security similar to the resale and repurchase agreement security borrowing and lending agreement are generally documented under industry standard agreement that allow the prompt close out of all transaction including the liquidation of security held and the offsetting of obligation to return cash or security by the non defaulting party following payment default or other default by the other party under the relevant master agreement event of default and right to use security under the security borrowing and lending agreement are similar to the resale and repurchase agreement referenced above substantial portion of security borrowing and lending agreement is recorded at the amount of cash advanced or received the remaining portion is recorded at fair value the company elected the fair value option for certain security borrowed and loaned portfolio described in note with respect to security loaned the company receives cash collateral in an amount generally in excess of the market value of the security loaned the company monitor the market value of security borrowed and security loaned on daily basis and post or obtains additional collateral in order to maintain contractual margin protection enforceability of offsetting right incorporated in the master netting agreement for resale and repurchase agreement and security borrowing and lending agreement is evidenced to the extent that supportive legal opinion ha been obtained from counsel of recognized standing that provides the requisite level of certainty regarding the enforceability of these agreement and ii the exercise of right by the non defaulting party to terminate and close out transaction on net basis under these agreement will not be stayed or avoided under applicable law upon an event of default including bankruptcy insolvency or similar proceeding legal opinion may not have been sought or obtained for certain jurisdiction where local law is silent or sufficiently ambiguous to determine the enforceability of offsetting right or where adverse case law or conflicting regulation may cast doubt on the enforceability of such right in some jurisdiction and for some counterparty type the insolvency law for particular counterparty type may be nonexistent or unclear overlapping regime may exist for example this may be the case for certain sovereign municipality central bank and pension plan the following table present the gross and net resale and repurchase agreement and security borrowing and lending agreement and the related offsetting amount permitted under asc the table also include amount related to financial instrument that are not permitted to be offset under asc but would be eligible for offsetting to the extent that an event of default ha occurred and legal opinion supporting enforceability of the offsetting right ha been obtained remaining exposure continue to be secured by financial collateral but the company may not have sought or been able to obtain legal opinion evidencing enforceability of the offsetting right of backed total brokerage receivables and brokerage payablesthe company ha receivables and payable for financial instrument sold to and purchased from broker dealer and customer which arise in the ordinary course of business citi is exposed to risk of loss from the inability of broker dealer or customer to pay for purchase or to deliver the financial instrument sold in which case citi would have to sell or purchase the financial instrument at prevailing market price credit risk is reduced to the extent that an exchange or clearing organization act counterparty to the transaction and replaces the broker dealer or customer in question citi seek to protect from the risk associated with customer activity by requiring customer to maintain margin collateral in compliance with regulatory and internal guideline margin level are monitored daily and customer deposit additional collateral required where customer can not meet collateral requirement citi may liquidate sufficient underlying financial instrument to bring the customer into compliance with the required margin level exposure to credit risk is impacted by market volatility which may impair the ability of client to satisfy their obligation to citi credit limit are established and closely monitored for customer and for broker and dealer engaged in forward future and other transaction deemed to be credit sensitive payable to broker dealer and clearing total brokerage payable includes brokerage receivables and payable recorded by citi broker dealer entity that are accounted for in accordance with the aicpa accrualdetailsciti did not have any htm debt security that were delinquent or on non accrual status at december and there were no purchased credit deteriorated htm debt security held by the company of december and investment for impairmentafs debt securitiesoverview afs debt securitiesthe company conduct periodic review of all afs debt security with unrealized loss to evaluate whether the impairment resulted from expected credit loss or from other factor and to evaluate the company intent to sell such security an afs debt security is impaired when the current fair value of an individual afs debt security is le than it amortized cost basis the company recognizes the entire difference between amortized cost basis and fair value in earnings for impaired afs debt security that citi ha an intent to sell or for which citi belief it will more likely than not be required to sell prior to recovery of the amortized cost basis however for those afs debt security that the company doe not intend to sell and is not likely to be required to sell only the credit related impairment is recognized in earnings by recording an allowance for credit loss any remaining fair value decline for such security is recorded in aoci the company doe not consider the length of time that the fair value of security is below it amortized cost when determining if credit loss exists for afs debt security credit loss exist where citi doe not expect to receive contractual principal and interest cash flow sufficient to recover the entire amortized cost basis of security the allowance for credit loss is limited to the amount by which the afs debt security amortized cost basis exceeds it fair value the allowance is increased or decreased if credit condition subsequently worsen or improve reversal of credit loss are recognized in earnings the company review for impairment of afs debt security generally entail identification and evaluation of impaired investment consideration of evidential matter including an evaluation of factor or trigger that could cause individual position to qualify credit impaired and those that would not support credit impairment and documentation of the result of these analysis required under business policy the section below describe the company process for identifying expected credit impairment for debt security type that have the most significant unrealized loss of december agency mortgage backed securitiesciti record no allowance for credit loss on government agency guaranteed mortgage backed security because the company expects to incur no credit loss in the event of default due to history of incurring no credit loss and due to the nature of the counterparties state and municipal securitiesthe process for estimating credit loss in citigroup afs state and municipal bond is primarily based on credit analysis that incorporates third party credit rating citi monitor the bond issuer and any insurer providing default protection in the form of financial guarantee insurance the average external credit rating disregarding any insurance is aa in the event of an external rating downgrade or other indicator of credit impairment based on instrument specific estimate of cash flow or probability of issuer default the subject bond is specifically reviewed for adverse change in the amount or timing of expected contractual principal and interest payment for afs state and municipal bond with unrealized loss that citi plan to sell or would more likely than not be required to sell prior to recovery of value the full impairment is recognized in earnings for afs state and municipal bond where citi ha no intent to sell and it is not more likely than not that the company will be required to sell citi record an allowance for expected credit loss for the amount it expects not to collect capped at the difference between the bond amortized cost basis and fair value equity method investmentsmanagement ass equity method investment that have fair value that are le than their respective carrying value for other than temporary impairment otti fair value is measured price multiplied by quantity if the investee ha publicly listed security if the investee is not publicly listed other method are used see note for impaired equity method investment that citi plan to sell prior to recovery of value or would more likely than not be required to sell with no expectation that the fair value will recover prior to the expected sale date the full impairment is recognized otti in other revenue regardless of severity and duration the measurement of the otti doe not include partial projected recovery subsequent to the balance sheet date for impaired equity method investment that management doe not plan to sell and is not more likely than not to be required to sell prior to recovery of value the evaluation of whether an impairment is other than temporary is based on whether and when an equity method investment will recover in value and ii whether the investor ha the intent and ability to hold that investment for period of time sufficient to recover the value the determination of whether the impairment is considered other than temporary considers the following indicator the cause of the impairment and the financial condition and near term prospect of the issuer including any specific event that may influence the operation of the issuer the intent and ability to hold the investment for period of time sufficient to allow for any anticipated recovery in market value and the length of time and extent to which fair value ha been le than the carrying value and measurement of impairmentthe following table present total impairment on afs investment recognized in earnings year endedin million of loss related to debt security that the company doe not intend to sell nor will likely be required to sell total impairment loss recognized during the period le portion of impairment loss recognized in aoci before tax net impairment loss recognized in earnings for debt security that the company doe not intend to sell nor will likely be required to sell impairment loss recognized in earnings for debt security that the company intends to sell would more likely than not be required to sell or will be subject to an issuer call deemed probable of total impairment loss recognized in earnings the governmentcorporatetotal afsallowance for credit loss at beginning of year gross write offs gross recovery net credit loss ncls ncls credit loss on security without previous credit loss net reserve build release on security with previous credit loss total provision for credit loss initial allowance on newly purchased credit deteriorated security during the year allowance for credit loss at end of year marketable equity security not carried at fair valuenon marketable equity security are required to be measured at fair value with change in fair value recognized in earnings unless the measurement alternative is elected or ii the investment represents federal reserve bank and federal home loan bank stock or certain exchange seat that continue to be carried at cost the election to measure non marketable equity security using the measurement alternative is made on an instrument by instrument basis under the measurement alternative an equity security is carried at cost plus or minus change resulting from observable price in orderly transaction for the identical or similar investment of the same issuer the carrying value of the equity security is adjusted to fair value on the date of an observed transaction fair value may differ from the observed transaction price due to number of factor including marketability adjustment and difference in right and obligation when the observed transaction is not for the identical investment held by citi equity security under the measurement alternative are also assessed for impairment on quarterly basis management qualitatively ass whether each equity security under the measurement alternative is impaired impairment indicator that are considered include but are not limited to the following significant deterioration in the earnings performance credit rating asset quality or business prospect of the investee significant adverse change in the regulatory economic or technological environment of the investee significant adverse change in the general market condition of either the geographical area or the industry in which the investee operates bona fide offer to purchase an offer by the investee to sell or completed auction process for the same or similar investment for an amount le than the carrying amount of that investment and factor that raise significant concern about the investee ability to continue going concern such negative cash flow from operation working capital deficiency or noncompliance with statutory capital requirement or debt covenant when the qualitative assessment indicates that impairment exists the investment is written down to fair value with the full difference between the fair value of the investment and it carrying amount recognized in earnings below is the carrying value of non marketable equity security measured using the measurement alternative at december and in million of dollarsdecember alternative carrying value below are amount recognized in earnings and life to date amount for non marketable equity security measured using the measurement alternative year ended december in million of alternative impairment loss downward change for observable upward change for observable see note for additional information on these nonrecurring fair value measurement life to date amount on security still heldin million of dollarsdecember alternative impairment loss downward change for observable upward change for observable similar impairment analysis is performed for non marketable equity security carried at cost for the year ended december and there wa no impairment loss recognized in earnings for non marketable equity security carried at cost loanscitigroup loan are reported in two category corporate and consumer these category are classified primarily according to the operating segment and component that manage the loan in addition to the nature of the obligor with corporate loan generally made for corporate institutional and public sector client around the world and consumer loan to retail and small business customer corporate loanscorporate loan represent loan and lease managed by icg and the mexico sbmm component of legacy franchise the following table present information by corporate loan type in million of dollarsdecember north america office commercial and industrial financial mortgage and real estate installment and lease total in office difference between the domicile of the booking unit and the domicile of the managing unit is not material loan secured primarily by real estate corporate loan are net of unearned income of million and million at december and respectively unearned income on corporate loan primarily represents interest received in advance but not yet earned on loan originated on discounted basis not included in the balance above is approximately billion of accrued interest receivable at december which is included in other asset on the consolidated balance sheet accrued interest receivable considered to be uncollectible is reversed through interest income amount reversed were not material for the year ended december and respectively the company sold and or reclassified to held for sale billion and billion of corporate loan during the year ended december and respectively the company did not have significant purchase of corporate loan classified held for investment for the year ended december or lease financing citi is lessor in the power railcar shipping and aircraft sector where the company ha executed operating direct financing and leveraged lease citi billion of lease financing receivables of december is composed of approximately equal balance of direct financing lease receivables and net investment in leveraged lease citi us the interest rate implicit in the lease to determine the present value of it lease financing receivables interest income on direct financing and leveraged lease during the year ended december wa not material the company operating lease where citi is lessor are not significant to the consolidated financial statement delinquency statusciti generally doe not manage corporate loan on delinquency basis corporate loan are placed on cash non accrual basis when it is determined based on actual experience and forward looking assessment of the collectability of the loan in full that the payment of interest or principal is doubtful or when interest or principal is day past due except when the loan is well collateralized and in the process of collection any interest accrued on impaired corporate loan and lease is reversed at day and charged against current earnings and interest is thereafter included in earnings only to the extent actually received in cash when there is doubt regarding the ultimate collectibility of principal all cash receipt are thereafter applied to reduce the recorded investment in the loan while corporate loan are generally managed based on their internally assigned risk rating see further discussion below dueand accruingtotalnon accrual totalcurrent totalloans commercial and industrial financial mortgage and real lease financing loan at fair total corporate loan delinquency and non accrual detail at december million of dayspast dueand accruing dayspast due andaccruing total past dueand accruingtotalnon accrual totalcurrent totalloans commercial and industrial financial mortgage and real lease financing loan at fair total corporate loan that are day past due are generally classified non accrual corporate loan are considered past due when principal or interest is contractually due but unpaid non accrual loan generally include those loan that are day or more past due or those loan for which citi belief based on actual experience and forward looking assessment of the collectability of the loan in full that the payment of interest and or principal is doubtful loan le than day past due are presented current the total loan column includes loan at fair value which are not included in the various delinquency column and therefore the table total row will not cross foot citigroup ha risk management process to monitor evaluate and manage the principal risk associated with it corporate loan portfolio part of it risk management process citi assigns numeric risk rating to it corporate loan facility based on quantitative and qualitative assessment of the obligor and facility these risk rating are reviewed at least annually or more often if material event related to the obligor or facility warrant factor considered in assigning the risk rating include financial condition of the obligor qualitative assessment of management and strategy amount and source of repayment amount and type of collateral and guarantee arrangement amount and type of any contingency associated with the obligor and the obligor industry and geography the obligor risk rating are defined by range of default probability the facility risk rating are defined by range of loss norm which are the product of the probability of default and the loss given default the investment grade rating category are similar to the category bbb and above defined by and moody loan classified according to the bank regulatory definition special mention substandard doubtful and loss will have risk rating within the non investment grade category loan credit quality indicator recorded investment in loan term loan unamortized premium or discount le any direct write down there were no significant revolving line of credit arrangement that converted to term loan during the year held for investment loan are accounted for on an amortized cost basis includes certain short term loan with le than one year in tenor other includes installment and other lease financing and loan to government and official institution loan at fair value include loan to commercial and industrial financial institution mortgage and real estate and other collateral dependent loan and lease where repayment is expected to be provided solely by the sale of the underlying collateral with no other available and reliable source of repayment are written down to the lower of carrying value or collateral value le cost to sell cash basis loan are returned to an accrual status when all contractual principal and interest amount are reasonably assured of repayment and there is sustained period of repayment performance generally six month in accordance with the contractual term of the loan accrual corporate loan the following table present non accrual loan information by corporate loan type and interest income tdrsinvolving changesin the amountand or timing ofinterest payment tdrsinvolving changesin the amountand or timing ofboth principal andinterest paymentscommercial and industrial mortgage and real total the table doe not include loan modification that meet the tdr relief criterion in the care act or the interagency guidance tdrs involving change in the amount or timing of principal payment may involve principal forgiveness or deferral of periodic and or final principal payment because forgiveness of principal is rare for corporate loan modification typically have little to no impact on the loan projected cash flow and thus little to no impact on the allowance established for the loan charge offs for amount deemed uncollectible may be recorded at the time of the restructuring or may have already been recorded in prior period such that no charge off is required at the time of the modification tdrs involving change in the amount or timing of interest payment may involve below market interest rate the following table present total corporate loan modified in tdr well those tdrs that defaulted and for which the payment default occurred within one year of permanent modification within one year of modificationtdr balance atdecember loan that re defaulted in within one year of modificationcommercial and industrial mortgage and real total the above table reflects activity for loan outstanding that were considered tdrs of the end of the reporting period loansconsumer loan represent loan and lease managed primarily by pbwm and legacy franchise except mexico sbmm citigroup ha established risk management process to monitor evaluate and manage the principal risk associated with it consumer loan portfolio credit quality indicator that are actively monitored include delinquency status consumer credit score under fair isaac corporation fico and loan to value ltv ratio each discussed in more detail below delinquency statusdelinquency status is monitored and considered key indicator of credit quality of consumer loan principally the residential first mortgage loan use the mortgage banker association mba method of reporting delinquency which considers loan delinquent if monthly payment ha not been received by the end of the day immediately preceding the loan next due date all other loan use method of reporting delinquency that considers loan delinquent if monthly payment ha not been received by the close of business on the loan next due date general policy residential first mortgage home equity loan and installment loan are classified non accrual when loan payment are day contractually past due credit card and unsecured revolving loan generally accrue interest until payment are day past due home equity loan in regulated bank entity are classified non accrual if the related residential first mortgage is day or more past due mortgage loan other than federal housing administration fha insured loan are classified non accrual within day of notification that the borrower ha filed for bankruptcy the policy for re aging modified consumer loan to current status varies by product generally one of the condition to qualify for these modification is that minimum number of payment typically ranging from one to three be made upon modification the loan is re aged to current status however re aging practice for certain open ended consumer loan such credit card are governed by federal financial institution examination council ffiec guideline for open ended consumer loan subject to ffiec guideline one of the condition for loan to be re aged to current status is that at least three consecutive minimum monthly payment or the equivalent amount must be received in addition under ffiec guideline the number of time that such loan can be re aged is subject to limitation generally once in month and twice in five year furthermore fha and department of veteran affair va loan are modified under those respective agency guideline and payment are not always required in order to re age modified loan to current the table below present detail about these loan including the following loan category residential first mortgage and home equity loan in north america office primarily represent secured mortgage lending to customer of retail banking and global wealth primarily private bank and citigold credit card in north america office primarily represent unsecured credit card lending to customer of branded card and retail service personal small business and other loan in north america are primarily composed of classifiably managed loan to customer of global wealth mostly within the private bank who are typically high credit quality borrower that historically experienced minimal delinquency and credit loss loan to these borrower are generally well collateralized in the form of liquid security and other form of collateral residential mortgage loan in office outside north america primarily represent secured mortgage lending to customer of global wealth primarily private bank and citigold well customer of legacy franchise credit card in office outside north america primarily represent unsecured credit card lending to customer of legacy franchise primarily in asia and mexico personal small business and other loan in office outside north america are primarily composed of secured and unsecured loan to customer of pbwm and legacy franchise significant portion of pbwm loan is classifiably managed and represents loan to high credit quality private bank customer who historically experienced minimal delinquency and credit loss loan to these borrower are generally well collateralized in the form of liquid security and other form of collateral following table provide citi consumer loan by type consumer loan reporting unit of legacy franchise in the first quarter of due to the re segmentation and change of reporting unit well the sequence of the signing of sale agreement discussed in note effective january part of it strategic refresh citi made change to it management structure which resulted in change in it operating segment and reporting unit to reflect how the ceo who is the chief operating decision maker manages the company including allocating resource and measuring performance goodwill balance were reallocated across the new reporting unit based on their relative fair value using the valuation performed of the effective date of the reorganization further the goodwill balance associated with certain asia consumer business within the legacy franchise operating segment were reclassified to hf of march upon the signing of the respective sale agreement see note for discussion of citi divestiture activity the reorganization of citi reporting structure and the announced sale of business within reporting unit were identified triggering event for purpose of goodwill impairment testing consistent with the requirement of asc interim goodwill impairment test were performed that resulted in an impairment of million to the asia consumer reporting unit within the legacy franchise operating segment due to the implementation of citi revised operating segment and reporting unit well the timing of mutual execution of sale agreement for asia consumer banking business this impairment wa recorded in the first quarter of an operating expense there were no additional impairment charge incurred result of any of the other interim goodwill impairment test performed during for the interim impairment test performed in the first quarter of the valuation of reporting unit used either the market approach income approach or combination of both under the market approach citi estimated fair value by comparing the business to similar business or guideline company whose security are actively traded in public market under the income approach citi used discounted cash flow dcf model in which cash flow anticipated over several period plus terminal value at the end of that time horizon are discounted to their present value using an appropriate rate that is commensurate with the risk inherent within the reporting unit the key assumption used to determine the fair value of citi reporting unit consisted primarily of significant unobservable input level fair value input including discount rate estimated cash flow growth rate earnings multiple and or transaction multiple of similar business or guideline public company and bid from buyer the dcf method employ capital asset pricing model in estimating the discount rate based on several factor including market interest rate and includes adjustment for market risk and company specific risk estimated cash flow are based on internally developed estimate and the growth rate are based on industry knowledge and historical performance citi had historically performed it annual goodwill impairment test of july each year during the quarter ended september the company voluntarily changed it annual impairment assessment date from july to october based on interim impairment test performed within the period between the previous annual test on july and the annual test to be performed on october no more than month have elapsed between goodwill impairment test of any of citi reporting unit the change in measurement date represents change in method of applying an accounting principle this change is preferable because it better aligns the company goodwill impairment testing procedure with it annual planning process and with it fiscal year end citi continues to monitor each reporting unit for triggering event for purpose of goodwill impairment testing change in accounting principle did not result in any delay acceleration or avoidance of an impairment charge citi performed it annual goodwill impairment test of october which resulted in no impairment of any of citi reporting unit while the inherent risk of uncertainty is embedded in the key assumption used in the valuation the economic and business environment continue to evolve management implement it strategic refresh if management future estimate of key economic and market assumption were to differ from it current assumption citi could potentially experience material goodwill impairment charge in the future for additional information regarding citi goodwill impairment testing process see the following note to board of director securitizations and variable interest entitiesuses of special purpose entitiesa special purpose entity spe is an entity designed to fulfill specific limited need of the company that organized it the principal us of spes by citi are to assist client in securitizing their financial asset and create investment product for client and to obtain liquidity and optimize capital efficiency by securitizing certain of citi financial asset spes may be organized in various legal form including trust partnership or corporation in securitization through the spe issuance of debt and equity instrument certificate commercial paper or other note of indebtedness the company transferring asset to the spe convert all or portion of those asset into cash before they would have been realized in the normal course of business these issuance are recorded on the balance sheet of the spe which may or may not be consolidated onto the balance sheet of the company that organized the spe investor usually have recourse only to the asset in the spe but may also benefit from other credit enhancement such collateral account line of credit or liquidity facility such liquidity put option or asset purchase agreement because of these enhancement the spe issuance typically obtain more favorable credit rating than the transferor could obtain for it own debt issuance this result in le expensive financing cost than unsecured debt the spe may also enter into derivative contract in order to convert the yield or currency of the underlying asset to match the need of the spe investor or to limit or change the credit risk of the spe citigroup may be the provider of certain credit enhancement well the counterparty to any related derivative contract most of citigroup spes are variable interest entity vies variable interest entitiesvies are described in note investor that finance the vie through debt or equity interest or other counterparties providing other form of support such guarantee certain fee arrangement or certain type of derivative contract are variable interest holder in the entity the variable interest holder if any that ha controlling financial interest in vie is deemed to be the primary beneficiary and must consolidate the vie the company must evaluate each vie to understand the purpose and design of the entity the role the company had in the entity design and it involvement in the vie ongoing activity the company then must evaluate which activity most significantly impact the economic performance of the vie and who ha the power to direct such activity for those vies where the company determines that it ha the power to direct the activity that most significantly impact the vie economic performance the company must then evaluate it economic interest if any and determine whether it could absorb loss or receive benefit that could potentially be significant to the vie when evaluating whether the company ha an obligation to absorb loss that could potentially be significant it considers the maximum exposure to such loss without consideration of probability such obligation could be in various form including but not limited to debt and equity investment guarantee liquidity agreement and certain derivative contract in various other transaction the company may act derivative counterparty interest rate swap cross currency swap or purchaser of credit protection under credit default swap or total return swap where the company pay the total return on certain asset to the spe ii act underwriter or placement agent iii provide administrative trustee or other service or iv make market in debt security or other instrument issued by vies the company generally considers such involvement by itself not to be variable interest and thus not an indicator of power or potentially significant benefit or loss involvement with consolidated and unconsolidated vies with which the company hold significant variable interest or ha continuing involvement through servicing majority of the asset in vie is presented below of december exposure to loss in significant unconsolidated vies funded exposure unfunded exposuresin million of dollarstotalinvolvementwith speassetsconsolidatedvie spe assetssignificantunconsolidatedvie asset debtinvestmentsequityinvestmentsfundingcommitmentsguaranteesandderivativestotalcredit card securitizations mortgage securitizations agency non agency citi administered asset backed commercial paper conduit collateralized loan obligation clos asset based financing municipal security tender option bond trust tobs municipal client investment other total of december exposure to loss in significant unconsolidated vies funded exposure unfunded exposuresin million of dollarstotalinvolvementwith speassetsconsolidatedvie spe assetssignificantunconsolidatedvie asset debtinvestmentsequityinvestmentsfundingcommitmentsguaranteesandderivativestotalcredit card securitizations mortgage securitizations agency non agency citi administered asset backed commercial paper collateralized loan obligation clos asset based financing municipal security tender option bond trust tobs municipal client investment other total the definition of maximum exposure to loss is included in the text that follows this table included on citigroup december and consolidated balance sheet significant unconsolidated vie is an entity in which the company ha any variable interest or continuing involvement considered to be significant regardless of the likelihood of loss citigroup mortgage securitizations also include agency and non agency private label re securitization activity these spes are not consolidated see re securitizations below for further discussion included within this line are loan to third party sponsored private equity fund which represent billion and billion in unconsolidated vie asset and million and million in maximum exposure to loss of december and respectively previous table do not include certain investment fund for which the company provides investment management service and personal estate trust for which the company provides administrative trustee and or investment management service certain third party sponsored private equity fund to which the company provides secured credit facility the company ha no decision making power and doe not consolidate these fund some of which may meet the definition of vie the company maximum exposure to loss is generally limited to loan or lending related commitment of december and the company maximum exposure to loss related to these transaction wa billion and billion respectively see note and for more information on these position certain vies structured by third party in which the company hold security in inventory these investment are made on arm length term certain position in mortgage and asset backed security held by the company which are classified trading account asset or investment in which the company ha no other involvement with the related securitization entity deemed to be significant see note and for more information on these position certain representation and warranty exposure in citigroup residential mortgage securitizations in which the original mortgage loan balance are no longer outstanding and vies such preferred security trust used in connection with the company funding activity the company doe not have variable interest in these trust the asset balance for consolidated vies represent the carrying amount of the asset consolidated by the company the carrying amount may represent the amortized cost or the current fair value of the asset depending on the classification of the asset loan or security and the associated accounting model ascribed to that classification the asset balance for unconsolidated vies in which the company ha significant involvement represent the most current information available to the company in most case the asset balance represent an amortized cost basis without regard to impairment unless fair value information is readily available to the company the maximum funded exposure represents the balance sheet carrying amount of the company investment in the vie it reflects the initial amount of cash invested in the vie adjusted for any accrued interest and cash principal payment received the carrying amount may also be adjusted for increase or decline in fair value or any impairment in value recognized in earnings the maximum exposure of unfunded position represents the remaining undrawn committed amount including liquidity and credit facility provided by the company or the notional amount of derivative instrument considered to be variable interest in certain transaction the company ha entered into derivative instrument or other arrangement that are not considered variable interest in the vie interest rate swap cross currency swap or where the company is the purchaser of credit protection under credit default swap or total return swap where the company pay the total return on certain asset to the spe receivables under such arrangement are not included in the maximum exposure amount following table present certain asset and liability of consolidated variable interest entity vies which are included on citi consolidated balance sheet the asset in the table below include those asset that can only be used to settle obligation of consolidated vies presented on the following page and are in excess of those obligation in addition the asset in the table below include third party asset of consolidated vies only and exclude intercompany balance that eliminate in consolidation the liability in the table below include third party liability of consolidated vies only and exclude intercompany balance that eliminate in consolidation the liability also exclude amount where creditor or beneficial interest holder have recourse to the general credit of citigroup december in million of of consolidated vies to be used to settle obligation of consolidated vies cash and due from bank trading account loan net of unearned income loan net of unearned income allowance for credit loss on loan acll total loan net other total asset of consolidated vies to be used to settle obligation of consolidated vies december in million of of consolidated vies for which creditor or beneficial interest holder do not have recourse to the general credit of citigroup short term borrowing long term other total liability of consolidated vies for which creditor or beneficial interest holder do not have recourse to the general credit of citigroup funding commitment for significant unconsolidated vies liquidity facility and loan commitmentsthe equitycommitmentsliquidityfacilitiesloan equitycommitmentsnon agency sponsored mortgage securitizations asset based financing municipal security tender option bond trust tobs municipal investment investment fund other total funding commitment viesthe company engages in on balance sheet securitizations which are securitizations that do not qualify for sale treatment thus the asset remain on citi consolidated balance sheet and any proceeds received are recognized secured liability in general the third party investor in the obligation of consolidated vies have legal recourse only to the asset of the respective vies and do not have such recourse to the company except where citi ha provided guarantee to the investor or is the counterparty to certain derivative transaction involving the vie thus citigroup maximum legal exposure to loss related to consolidated vies is significantly le than the carrying value of the consolidated vie asset due to outstanding third party financing intercompany asset and liability are excluded from citi consolidated balance sheet all vie asset are restricted from being sold or pledged collateral the cash flow from these asset are the only source used to pay down the associated liability which are non recourse to citi general asset see the consolidated balance sheet for more information about these consolidated vie asset and liability billion of dollarsdecember trading account total loan net of total asset card securitizationsthe company securitizes credit card receivables through trust established to purchase the receivables citigroup transfer receivables into the trust on non recourse basis credit card securitizations are revolving securitizations customer pay their credit card balance the cash proceeds are used to purchase new receivables and replenish the receivables in the trust substantially all of the company credit card securitization activity is through two trust citibank credit card master trust master trust and citibank omni trust omni trust with the substantial majority through the master trust these trust are consolidated entity because servicer citigroup ha the power to direct the activity that most significantly impact the economic performance of the trust citigroup hold seller interest and certain security issued by the trust which could result in exposure to potentially significant loss or benefit from the trust accordingly the transferred credit card receivables remain on citi consolidated balance sheet with no gain or loss recognized the debt issued by the trust to third party is included on citi consolidated balance sheet citi utilizes securitizations one of the source of funding for it business in north america the following table reflects amount related to the company securitized credit card receivables in billion of dollarsdecember interest in principal amount of trust credit card receivablessold to investor via trust issued security retained by citigroup trust issued retained by citigroup via non certificated total the following table summarizes selected cash flow information related to citigroup credit card securitizations in billion of from new securitizations pay down of maturing note managed loansafter securitization of credit card receivables the company continues to maintain credit card customer account relationship and provides servicing for receivables transferred to the trust result the company considers the securitized credit card receivables to be part of the business it manages citigroup consolidates the credit card trust all managed securitized card receivables are on balance sheet funding liquidity facility and subordinated interestsas noted above citigroup securitizes credit card receivables through two securitization trust master trust and omni trust the liability of the trust are included on the consolidated balance sheet excluding those retained by citigroup master trust liability at par value the master trust issue fixed and floating rate term note some of the term note may be issued to multi seller commercial paper conduit the weighted average maturity of the third party term note issued by the master trust wa year of december and year of december in billion of dollarsdec note issued to third party term note retained by citigroup total master trust liability omni trust liability at par value the omni trust issue fixed and floating rate term note some of which are purchased by multi seller commercial paper conduit the weighted average maturity of the third party term note issued by the omni trust wa year of december and year of december in billion of dollarsdec note issued to third party term note retained by citigroup total omni trust liability securitizationscitigroup provides wide range of mortgage loan product to diverse customer base once originated the company often securitizes these loan through the use of vies these vies are funded through the issuance of trust certificate backed solely by the transferred asset these certificate have the same life the transferred asset in addition to providing source of liquidity and le expensive funding securitizing these asset also reduces citi credit exposure to the borrower these mortgage loan securitizations are primarily non recourse thereby effectively transferring the risk of future credit loss to the purchaser of the security issued by the trust citi consumer mortgage business generally retains the servicing right and in certain instance retains investment security interest only strip and residual interest in future cash flow from the trust and also provides servicing for limited number of icg securitizations citi icg business may hold investment security pursuant to credit risk retention rule or in connection with secondary market making activity the company securitizes mortgage loan generally through either government sponsored agency such ginnie mae fannie mae or freddie mac agency sponsored mortgage or private label non agency sponsored mortgage securitization citi is not the primary beneficiary of it agency sponsored mortgage securitization entity because citigroup doe not have the power to direct the activity of the vies that most significantly impact the entity economic performance therefore citi doe not consolidate these agency sponsored mortgage securitization entity substantially all of the consumer loan sold or securitized through non consolidated trust by citigroup are prime residential mortgage loan retained interest in non consolidated agency sponsored mortgage securitization trust are classified trading account asset except for msrs which are included in other asset on citigroup consolidated balance sheet citigroup doe not consolidate certain non agency sponsored mortgage securitization entity because citi is either not the servicer with the power to direct the significant activity of the entity or citi is the servicer but the servicing relationship is deemed to be fiduciary relationship therefore citi is not deemed to be the primary beneficiary of the entity in certain instance the company ha the power to direct the activity that most significantly impact the entity economic performance and ii the obligation to either absorb loss or the right to receive benefit that could be potentially significant to it non agency sponsored mortgage securitization entity and therefore is the primary beneficiary and thus consolidates the vie the following table summarize selected cash flow information and retained interest related to servicing right msrs in connection with the securitization of mortgage loan citi consumer mortgage business generally retains the servicing right which entitle the company to future stream of cash flow based on the outstanding principal balance of the loan and the contractual servicing fee failure to service the loan in accordance with contractual requirement may lead to termination of the servicing right and the loss of future servicing fee these transaction create intangible asset referred to msrs which are recorded at fair value on citi consolidated balance sheet the fair value of citi capitalized msrs wa million and million at december and respectively the msrs correspond to principal loan balance of billion and billion of december and respectively the following table summarizes the change in capitalized msrs in million of beginning of year change in fair value of msrs due to change in input and other change sale of msrs balance of december represents change due to customer payment and passage of time the fair value of the msrs is primarily affected by change in prepayment of mortgage that result from shift in mortgage interest rate specifically higher interest rate tend to lead to declining prepayment which cause the fair value of the msrs to increase in managing this risk citigroup economically hedge significant portion of the value of it msrs through the use of interest rate derivative contract forward purchase and sale commitment of mortgage backed security and purchased security all classified trading account asset the company receives fee during the course of servicing previously securitized mortgage the amount of these fee were follows in million of fee late msr fee in the consolidated statement of income these fee are primarily classified commission and fee and change in msr fair value are classified other revenue re securitizationsthe company engages in re securitization transaction in which debt security are transferred to vie in exchange for new beneficial interest citi did not transfer non agency private label security to re securitization entity during the year ended december and these security are backed by either
