trading account asset the original fair value of agency re securitization transaction in which citi hold retained interest of december and were approximately billion and billion respectively of december and the company did not consolidate any private label or agency re securitization entity citi administered asset backed commercial paper conduitsthe company is active in the asset backed commercial paper conduit business administrator of several multi seller commercial paper conduit and also service provider to single seller and other commercial paper conduit sponsored by third party citi multi seller commercial paper conduit are designed to provide the company client access to low cost funding in the commercial paper market the conduit purchase asset from or provide financing facility to client and are funded by issuing commercial paper to third party investor the conduit generally do not purchase asset originated by citi the funding of the conduit is facilitated by the liquidity support and credit enhancement provided by the company administrator to citi conduit the company is generally responsible for selecting and structuring asset purchased or financed by the conduit making decision regarding the funding of the conduit including determining the tenor and other feature of the commercial paper issued monitoring the quality and performance of the conduit asset and facilitating the operation and cash flow of the conduit in return the company earns structuring fee from customer for individual transaction and earns an administration fee from the conduit which is equal to the income from the client program and liquidity fee of the conduit after payment of conduit expense this administration fee is fairly stable since most risk and reward of the underlying asset are passed back to the client once the asset pricing is negotiated most ongoing income cost and fee are relatively stable percentage of the conduit size the conduit administered by citi do not generally invest in liquid security that are formally rated by third party the are privately negotiated and structured transaction that are generally designed to be held by the conduit rather than actively traded and sold the yield earned by the conduit on each asset is generally tied to the rate on the commercial paper issued by the conduit thus passing interest rate risk to the client each asset purchased by the conduit is structured with transaction specific credit enhancement feature provided by the third party client seller including over collateralization cash and excess spread collateral account direct recourse or third party guarantee these credit enhancement are sized with the objective of approximating credit rating of or above based on citi internal risk rating at december and the commercial paper conduit administered by citi had approximately billion and billion of purchased asset outstanding respectively and had incremental funding commitment with client of approximately billion and billion respectively substantially all of the funding of the conduit is in the form of short term commercial paper at december and the weighted average remaining life of the commercial paper issued by the conduit were approximately and day respectively the primary credit enhancement provided to the conduit investor is in the form of transaction specific credit enhancement described above each asset purchased by the conduit is structured with transaction specific credit enhancement feature provided by the third party client seller including over collateralization cash and excess spread collateral account direct recourse or third party guarantee these credit enhancement are sized with the objective of approximating credit rating of or above based on citi internal risk rating in addition to the transaction specific credit enhancement the conduit other than the government guaranteed loan conduit have obtained letter of credit from the company which equal at least to of the conduit asset with minimum of million the letter of credit provided by the company to the conduit total approximately billion of december and billion of december the net result across multiseller conduit administered by the company is that in the event that defaulted asset exceed the transaction specific credit enhancement described above any loss in each conduit are allocated first to the company and then to the commercial paper investor citigroup also provides the conduit with two form of liquidity agreement that are used to provide funding to the conduit in the event of market disruption among other event each asset of the conduit is supported by transaction specific liquidity facility in the form of an asset purchase agreement apa under the apa the company ha generally agreed to purchase non defaulted eligible receivables from the conduit at par the apa is not designed to provide credit support to the conduit it generally doe not permit the purchase of defaulted or impaired asset any funding under the apa will likely subject the underlying conduit client to increased interest cost in addition the company provides the conduit with program wide liquidity in the form of short term lending commitment under these commitment the company ha agreed to lend to the conduit in the event of short term disruption in the commercial paper market subject to specified condition the company receives fee for providing both type of liquidity agreement and considers these fee to be on fair market term finally citi is one of several named dealer in the commercial paper issued by the conduit and earns market based fee for providing such service along with third party dealer the company make market in the commercial paper and may from time to time fund commercial paper pending sale to third party on specific date with le liquidity in the market the company may hold in inventory commercial paper issued by conduit administered by the company well conduit administered by third party separately in the normal course of business citi purchase commercial paper including commercial paper issued by citigroup conduit at december and the company owned billion and billion respectively of the commercial paper issued by it administered conduit the company investment were not driven by market illiquidity and the company is not obligated under any agreement to purchase the commercial paper issued by the conduit the asset backed commercial paper conduit are consolidated by citi the company ha determined that through it role administrator and liquidity provider it ha the power to direct the activity that most significantly impact the entity economic performance these power include it ability to structure and approve the asset purchased by the conduit it ongoing surveillance and credit mitigation activity it ability to sell or repurchase asset out of the conduit and it liability management in addition result of all the company involvement described above it wa concluded that citi ha an economic interest that could potentially be significant however the asset and liability of the conduit are separate and apart from those of citigroup no asset of any conduit are available to satisfy the creditor of citigroup or any of it other subsidiary collateralized loan obligation clos collateralized loan obligation clo is vie that purchase portfolio of asset consisting primarily of non investment grade corporate loan clos issue multiple tranche of debt and equity to investor to fund the asset purchase and pay upfront expense associated with forming the clo third party asset manager is contracted by the clo to purchase the underlying asset from the open market and monitor the credit risk associated with those asset over the term of clo the asset manager directs purchase and sale of asset in manner consistent with the clo asset management agreement and indenture in general the clo asset manager will have the power to direct the activity of the entity that most significantly impact the economic performance of the clo investor in clo through their ownership of debt and or equity in it can also direct certain activity of the clo including removing it asset manager under limited circumstance optionally redeeming the note voting on amendment to the clo operating document and other activity clo ha finite life typically year citi serf structuring and placement agent with respect to the clos typically the debt and equity of the clos are sold to third party investor on occasion certain citi entity may purchase some portion of clo liability investment purpose in addition citi may purchase typically in the secondary market certain security issued by the clos to support it market making activity the company generally doe not have the power to direct the activity that most significantly impact the economic performance of the clos this power is generally held by third party asset manager of the clo such those clos are not consolidated the following table summarize selected cash flow information and retained interest related to citigroup clos in billion of securitized proceeds the vie borrower would have to default with no recovery from the asset held by the vie december million of dollarstotal unconsolidated vie assetsmaximum exposure to unconsolidated viestypecommercial and other real estate corporate other including investment fund airline and shipping total december million of dollarstotal unconsolidated vie assetsmaximum exposure to unconsolidated viestypecommercial and other real estate corporate other including investment fund airline and shipping total municipal security tender option bond tob trustsmunicipal tob trust may hold fixed or floating rate taxable or tax exempt security issued by state and local government and municipality tob trust are typically structured single issuer entity whose asset are purchased from either the company or from other investor in the municipal security market tob trust finance the purchase of their municipal asset by issuing two class of certificate long dated floating rate certificate floater that are putable pursuant to liquidity facility and residual interest certificate residual the floater are purchased by third party investor typically tax exempt money market fund the residual are purchased by the original owner of the municipal security that are being financed from citigroup perspective there are two type of tob trust customer and non customer customer tob trust are those trust utilized by customer of the company to finance their security generally municipal security the residual issued by these trust are purchased by the customer being financed non customer tob trust are generally used by the company to finance it own municipal security investment the residual issued by non customer tob trust are purchased by the company with respect to both customer and non customer tob trust citi may provide remarketing agent service if floater are optionally tendered and the company in it role remarketing agent is unable to find new investor to purchase the optionally tendered floater within specified period of time citigroup may but is not obligated to purchase the tendered floater into it own inventory the level of the company inventory of such floater fluctuates for certain customer tob trust citi may also serve voluntary advance provider in this capacity the company may but is not obligated to make loan advance to customer tob trust to purchase optionally tendered floater that have not otherwise been successfully remarketed to new investor such loan are secured by pledged floater of december citi had no outstanding voluntary advance to customer tob trust for certain non customer trust the company also provides credit enhancement at december and none of the municipal bond owned by non customer tob trust were subject to credit guarantee provided by the company also provides liquidity service to many customer and non customer trust if trust is unwound early due to an event other than credit event on the underlying municipal bond the underlying municipal bond are sold out of the trust and bond sale proceeds are used to redeem the outstanding trust certificate if this result in shortfall between the bond sale proceeds and the redemption price of the tendered floater the company pursuant to the liquidity agreement would be obligated to make payment to the trust to satisfy that shortfall for certain customer tob trust citigroup ha also executed reimbursement agreement with the holder of the residual pursuant to which the residual holder is obligated to reimburse the company for any payment the company make under the liquidity arrangement these reimbursement agreement may be subject to daily margining based on change in the market value of the underlying municipal bond in case where third party provides liquidity to non customer tob trust similar reimbursement arrangement may be executed whereby the company or consolidated subsidiary of the company residual holder would absorb any loss incurred by the liquidity provider for certain other non customer tob trust citi serf tender option provider the tender option provider arrangement allows floater holder to put their interest directly to the company at any time subject to the requisite notice period requirement at price of par at december and liquidity agreement provided with respect to customer tob trust totaled billion and billion respectively of which billion and billion respectively were offset by reimbursement agreement for the remaining exposure related to tob transaction where the residual owned by the customer wa at least of the bond value at the inception of the transaction no reimbursement agreement wa executed citi considers both customer and non customer tob trust to be vies customer tob trust are not consolidated by the company the power to direct the activity that most significantly impact the trust economic performance rest with the customer residual holder which may unilaterally cause the sale of the trust bond non customer tob trust generally are consolidated because the company hold the residual interest and thus ha the unilateral power to cause the sale of the trust bond the company also provides other liquidity agreement or letter of credit to customer sponsored municipal investment fund which are not variable interest entity and municipality related issuer that totaled billion of december and billion of december these liquidity agreement and letter of credit are offset by reimbursement agreement with various term out provision municipal investmentsmunicipal investment transaction include debt and equity interest in partnership that finance the construction and rehabilitation of low income housing facilitate lending in new or underserved market or finance the construction or operation of renewable municipal energy facility citi generally invests in these partnership limited partner and earns return primarily through the receipt of tax credit and grant earned from the investment made by the partnership the company may also provide construction loan or permanent loan for the development or operation of real estate property held by partnership these entity are generally considered vies the power to direct the activity of these entity is typically held by the general partner accordingly these entity are not consolidated by citigroup client intermediationclient intermediation transaction represent range of transaction designed to provide investor with specified return based on the return of an underlying security referenced asset or index these transaction include credit linked note and equity linked note in these transaction the vie typically obtains exposure to the underlying security referenced asset or index through derivative instrument such total return swap or credit default swap in turn the vie issue note to investor that pay return based on the specified underlying security referenced asset or index the vie invests the proceeds in financial asset or guaranteed insurance contract that serf collateral for the derivative contract over the term of the transaction the company involvement in these transaction includes being the counterparty to the vie derivative instrument and investing in portion of the note issued by the vie in certain transaction the investor maximum risk of loss is limited and the company absorbs risk of loss above specified level citi doe not have the power to direct the activity of the vies that most significantly impact their economic performance and thus it doe not consolidate them citi maximum risk of loss in these transaction is defined the amount invested in note issued by the vie and the notional amount of any risk of loss absorbed by citi through separate instrument issued by the vie the derivative instrument held by the company may generate receivable from the vie where the company purchase credit protection from the vie in connection with the vie issuance of credit linked note which is collateralized by the asset owned by the vie these derivative instrument are not considered variable interest and any associated receivables are not included in the calculation of maximum exposure to the vie investment fundsthe company is the investment manager for certain investment fund and retirement fund that invest in various asset class including private equity hedge fund real estate fixed income and infrastructure citigroup earns management fee which is percentage of capital under management and may earn performance fee in addition for some of these fund the company ha an ownership interest in the investment fund citi ha also established number of investment fund opportunity for qualified employee to invest in private equity investment the company act investment manager for these fund and may provide employee with financing on both recourse and non recourse base for portion of the employee investment commitment derivativesin the ordinary course of business citigroup enters into various type of derivative transaction which include future and forward contract which are commitment to buy or sell at future date financial instrument commodity or currency at contracted price that may be settled in cash or through delivery of an item readily convertible to cash swap contract which are commitment to settle in cash at future date or date that may range from few day to number of year based on differential between specified index or financial instrument applied to notional principal amount option contract which give the purchaser for premium the right but not the obligation to buy or sell within specified time financial instrument commodity or currency at contracted price that may also be settled in cash based on differential between specified index or price swap forward and some option contract are over the counter otc derivative that are bilaterally negotiated with counterparties and settled with those counterparties except for swap contract that are novated and cleared through central counterparties ccps future contract and other option contract are standardized contract that are traded on an exchange with ccp the counterparty from the inception of the transaction citigroup enters into derivative contract relating to interest rate foreign currency commodity and other market credit risk for the following reason trading purpose citigroup trade derivative an active market maker citigroup offer it customer derivative in connection with their risk management action to transfer modify or reduce their interest rate foreign exchange and other market credit risk or for their own trading purpose citigroup also manages it derivative risk position through offsetting trade activity control focused on price verification and daily reporting of position to senior manager hedging citigroup us derivative in connection with it own risk management activity to hedge certain risk or reposition the risk profile of the company hedging may be accomplished by applying hedge accounting in accordance with asc derivative and hedging for example citigroup issue fixed rate long term debt and then enters into receive fixed pay variable rate interest rate swap with the same tenor and notional amount to synthetically convert the interest payment to net variable rate basis this strategy is the most common form of an interest rate hedge it minimizes net interest cost in certain yield curve environment derivative are also used to manage market risk inherent in specific group of on balance sheet asset and liability including afs security commodity and borrowing well other interest sensitive asset and liability in addition foreign exchange contract are used to hedge non dollar denominated debt foreign currency denominated afs security and net investment exposure derivative may expose citigroup to market credit or liquidity risk in excess of the amount recorded on the consolidated balance sheet market risk on derivative product is the exposure created by potential fluctuation in interest rate market price foreign exchange rate and other factor and is function of the type of product the volume of transaction the tenor and term of the agreement and the underlying volatility credit risk is the exposure to loss in the event of nonperformance by the other party to satisfy derivative liability where the value of any collateral held by citi is not adequate to cover such loss the recognition in earnings of unrealized gain on derivative transaction is subject to management assessment of the probability of counterparty default liquidity risk is the potential exposure that arises when the size of derivative position may affect the ability to monetize the position in reasonable period of time and at reasonable cost in period of high volatility and financial stress derivative transaction are customarily documented under industry standard master netting agreement which provide that following an event of default the non defaulting party may promptly terminate all transaction between the party and determine the net amount due to be paid to or by the defaulting party event of default include failure to make payment on derivative transaction that remains uncured following applicable notice and grace period ii breach of agreement that remains uncured after applicable notice and grace period iii breach of representation iv cross default either to third party debt or to other derivative transaction entered into between the party or in some case their affiliate the occurrence of merger or consolidation that result in the creditworthiness of party becoming materially weaker and vi the cessation or repudiation of any applicable guarantee or other credit support document obligation under master netting agreement are often secured by collateral posted under an industry standard credit support annex to the master netting agreement an event of default may also occur under credit support annex if party fails to make collateral delivery that remains uncured following applicable notice and grace period the netting and collateral right incorporated in the master netting agreement are considered to be legally enforceable if supportive legal opinion ha been obtained from counsel of recognized standing that provides the requisite level of certainty regarding enforceability and ii that the exercise of right by the non defaulting party to terminate and close out transaction on net basis under these agreement will not be stayed or avoided under applicable law upon an event of default including bankruptcy insolvency or similar proceeding legal opinion may not be sought for certain jurisdiction where local law is silent or unclear to the enforceability of such right or where adverse case law or conflicting regulation may cast doubt on the enforceability of such right in some jurisdiction and for some counterparty type the insolvency law may not provide the requisite level of certainty for example this may be the case for certain sovereign municipality central bank and pension plan to credit risk on derivative is affected by market volatility which may impair the ability of counterparties to satisfy their obligation to the company credit limit are established and closely monitored for customer engaged in derivative transaction citi considers the level of legal certainty regarding enforceability of it offsetting right under master netting agreement and credit support annex to be an important factor in it risk management process specifically citi generally transacts much lower volume of derivative under master netting agreement where citi doe not have the requisite level of legal certainty regarding enforceability because such derivative consume greater amount of single counterparty credit limit than those executed under enforceable master netting agreement cash collateral and security collateral in the form of government debt security are often posted by party to master netting agreement to secure the net open exposure of the other party the receiving party is free to commingle rehypothecate such collateral in the ordinary course of it business nonstandard collateral such corporate bond municipal bond agency security and or mb may also be pledged collateral for derivative transaction security collateral posted to open and maintain master netting agreement with counterparty in the form of cash and or security may from time to time be segregated in an account at third party custodian pursuant to tri party account control agreement information pertaining to citigroup derivative activity based on notional amount is presented in the table below derivative notional amount are reference amount from which contractual payment are derived and do not represent complete measure of citi exposure to derivative transaction citi derivative exposure arises primarily from market fluctuation market risk counterparty failure credit risk and or period of high volatility or financial stress liquidity risk well any market valuation adjustment that may be required on the transaction moreover notional amount do not reflect the netting of offsetting trade for example if citi enters into receive fixed interest rate swap with million notional and offset this risk with an identical but opposite pay fixed position with different counterparty million in derivative notionals is reported although these offsetting position may result in de minimis overall market risk in addition aggregate derivative notional amount can fluctuate from period to period in the normal course of business based on citi market share level of client activity and other factor all derivative are recorded in trading account asset trading account liability on the consolidated balance sheet notionals hedging instrument underasc derivative instrumentsin million of dollarsdecember rate contract swap future and forward written option purchased protection purchased total credit derivative total derivative notionals credit derivative are arrangement designed to allow one party protection purchaser to transfer the credit risk of reference asset to another party protection seller these arrangement allow protection seller to assume the credit risk associated with the reference asset without directly purchasing that asset the company enters into credit derivative position for purpose such risk management yield enhancement reduction of credit concentration and diversification of overall risk following table present the gross and net fair value of the company derivative transaction and the related offsetting amount of december and gross positive fair value are offset against gross negative fair value by counterparty pursuant to enforceable master netting agreement under asc payable and receivables in respect of cash collateral received from or paid to given counterparty pursuant to credit support annex are included in the offsetting amount if legal opinion supporting the enforceability of netting and collateral right ha been obtained gaap doe not permit similar offsetting for security collateral in addition the derivative fair value for legal and accounting purpose opposed to presenting gross derivative asset and liability that are subject to collateral whereby the counterparties would also record related central clearing house cleared derivative include derivative executed bilaterally with counterparty in the otc market but then novated to central clearing house whereby the central clearing house becomes the counterparty to both of the original counterparties exchange traded derivative include derivative executed directly on an organized exchange that provides pre trade price transparency related to non derivative instrument within the same trading portfolio this represents how these portfolio are risk managed see note for further information the amount recognized in other revenue in the consolidated statement of income related to derivative not designated in qualifying hedging relationship are shown below the table below doe not include any offsetting gain loss on the economically hedged item to the extent that such amount are also recorded in other revenue gain loss included inother revenueyear ended december in million of rate contract foreign exchange total accounting for derivative hedgingcitigroup account for it hedging activity in accordance with asc derivative and hedging general rule hedge accounting is permitted where the company is exposed to particular risk such interest rate or foreign exchange risk that cause change in the fair value of an asset or liability or variability in the expected future cash flow of an existing asset liability or forecasted transaction that may affect earnings derivative contract hedging the risk associated with change in fair value are referred to fair value hedge while contract hedging the variability of expected future cash flow are cash flow hedge hedge that utilize derivative or debt instrument to manage the foreign exchange risk associated with equity investment in non dollar functional currency foreign subsidiary net investment in foreign operation are net investment hedge to qualify an accounting hedge under the hedge accounting rule versus an economic hedge where hedge accounting is not applied hedging relationship must be highly effective in offsetting the risk designated being hedged the hedging relationship must be formally documented at inception detailing the particular risk management objective and strategy for the hedge this includes the item and risk being hedged the hedging instrument being used and how effectiveness will be assessed the effectiveness of these hedging relationship is evaluated at hedge inception and on an ongoing basis both on retrospective and prospective basis typically using quantitative measure of correlation with hedge ineffectiveness measured and recorded in current earnings hedge effectiveness assessment methodology are performed in similar manner for similar hedge and are used consistently throughout the hedging relationship the assessment of effectiveness may exclude change in the value of the hedged item that are unrelated to the risk being hedged and the change in fair value of the derivative associated with time value citi excludes change in the cross currency basis associated with cross currency swap from the assessment of hedge effectiveness and record it in other comprehensive income discontinued hedge accountinga hedging instrument must be highly effective in accomplishing the hedge objective of offsetting either change in the fair value or cash flow of the hedged item for the risk being hedged management may voluntarily de designate an accounting hedge at any time but if hedging relationship is not highly effective it no longer qualifies for hedge accounting and must be de designated subsequent change in the fair value of the derivative are recognized in other revenue or principal transaction similar to trading derivative with no offset recorded related to the hedged item for fair value hedge any change in the carrying value of the hedged item remain part of the basis of the asset or liability and are ultimately realized an element of the yield on the item for cash flow hedge change in fair value of the end user derivative remain in accumulated other comprehensive income loss aoci and are included in the earnings of future period when the forecasted hedged cash flow impact earnings however if it becomes probable that some or all of the hedged forecasted transaction will not occur any amount that remain in aoci related to these transaction must be immediately reflected in other revenue the foregoing criterion are applied on decentralized basis consistent with the level at which market risk is managed but are subject to various limit and control the underlying asset liability or forecasted transaction may be an individual item or portfolio of similar item fair value hedgeshedging of benchmark interest rate riskcitigroup fair value hedge which include hedge of closed pool of asset are primarily hedge of fixed rate long term debt or asset such available for sale debt security or loan for qualifying fair value hedge of interest rate risk the change in the fair value of the derivative and the change in the fair value of the hedged item attributable to the hedged risk are presented within interest revenue or interest expense based on whether the hedged item is an asset or liability of foreign exchange riskcitigroup hedge the change in fair value attributable to foreign exchange rate movement in available for sale debt security and long term debt that are denominated in currency other than the functional currency of the entity holding the security or issuing the debt the hedging instrument is generally forward foreign exchange contract or cross currency swap contract change in the fair value of the forward point the spot forward difference of forward contract are excluded from the assessment of hedge effectiveness and are generally reflected directly in earnings over the life of the hedge citi also excludes change in the fair value of cross currency basis associated with cross currency swap from the assessment of hedge effectiveness and record them in other comprehensive income hedging of commodity price risk citigroup hedge the change in fair value attributable to spot price movement in physical commodity inventory the hedging instrument is future contract to sell the underlying commodity in this hedge the change in the carrying value of the hedged inventory is reflected in earnings which offset the change in the fair value of the future contract that is also reflected in earnings although the entire change in the fair value of the hedging instrument is recorded in earnings under certain hedge program citigroup excludes change in the fair value of the forward point spot forward difference of the future contract from the assessment of hedge effectiveness and they are generally reflected directly in earnings over the life of the hedge under other hedge program citi excludes change in the fair value of forward point from the assessment of hedge effectiveness and record them in other comprehensive income the following table summarizes the gain loss on the company fair value hedge gain loss on fair value hedge year ended december million of dollarsother revenuenet interest incomeother revenuenet amount for interest rate risk hedge are included in interest revenue interest expense the accrued interest income on fair value hedge is recorded in net interest income and is excluded from this table approach amount related to cross currency basis which are recognized in aoci are not reflected in the table above the amount of cross currency basis included in aoci wa million and million for the year ended december and respectively amount related to the forward point the spot forward difference that are excluded from the assessment of hedge effectiveness reflected directly in earnings under amortization approach respectively basis adjustmentupon electing to apply asc fair value hedge accounting the carrying value of the hedged item is adjusted to reflect the cumulative change in the hedged risk this cumulative basis adjustment becomes part of the carrying amount of the hedged item until the hedged item is derecognized from the balance sheet the table below present the carrying amount of citi hedged asset and liability under qualifying fair value hedge at december and along with the cumulative basis adjustment included in the carrying value of those hedged asset and change in contractually specified interest rate associated with floating rate asset liability and other forecasted transaction variable cash flow from those liability are synthetically converted to fixed rate cash flow by entering into receive variable pay fixed interest rate swap and receive variable pay fixed forward starting interest rate swap variable cash flow associated with certain asset are synthetically converted to fixed rate cash flow by entering into receive fixed pay variable interest rate swap these cash flow hedging relationship use either regression analysis or dollar offset ratio analysis to ass whether the hedging relationship are highly effective at inception and on an ongoing basis for cash flow hedge the entire change in the fair value of the hedging derivative is recognized in aoci and then reclassified to earnings in the same period that the forecasted hedged cash flow impact earnings the pretax change in aoci from cash flow hedge is presented below in million of of gain loss recognized in aoci on derivativesinterest rate contract foreign exchange total gain loss recognized in aoci other revenuenet interest incomeother revenuenet interest incomeother revenuenet interest incomeamount of gain loss reclassified from aoci to earnings interest rate contract foreign exchange contract total gain loss reclassified from aoci into earnings net pretax change in cash flow hedge included within aoci all amount reclassified into earnings for interest rate contract are included in interest income interest expense net interest income for all other hedge the amount reclassified to earnings are included primarily in other revenue and net interest income in the consolidated statement of income the net gain loss associated with cash flow hedge expected to be reclassified from aoci within month of december is approximately billion the maximum length of time over which forecasted cash flow are hedged is year the after tax impact of cash flow hedge on aoci is shown in note investment hedgesconsistent with asc foreign currency matter foreign currency transaction asc allows the hedging of the foreign currency risk of net investment in foreign operation citigroup us foreign currency forward cross currency swap option and foreign currency denominated debt instrument to manage the foreign exchange risk associated with citigroup equity investment in several non dollar functional currency foreign subsidiary citi record the change in the fair value of these hedging instrument and the translation adjustment for the investment in these foreign subsidiary in foreign currency translation adjustment within aoci for derivative designated net investment hedge citigroup follows the forward rate method outlined in asc according to that method all change in fair value including change related to the forward rate component of the foreign currency forward contract and the time value of foreign currency option are recorded in foreign currency translation adjustment within aoci for foreign currency denominated debt instrument that are designated hedge of net investment the translation gain or loss that is recorded in foreign currency translation adjustment is based on the spot exchange rate between the functional currency of the respective subsidiary and the dollar which is the functional currency of citigroup the pretax gain loss recorded in foreign currency translation adjustment within aoci related to net investment hedge wa million million and million for the year ended december and respectively the year ended december includes million pretax loss related to net investment hedge respectively which were reclassified from aoci into earnings recorded in other revenue economic hedgescitigroup often us economic hedge when hedge accounting would be too complex or operationally burdensome end user derivative that are economic hedge are carried at fair value with change in value included in either principal transaction or other revenue for asset liability management hedging fixed rate long term debt is recorded at amortized cost under gaap for other hedge that either do not meet the asc hedging criterion or for which management decides not to apply asc hedge accounting the derivative is recorded at fair value on the balance sheet with the associated change in fair value recorded in earnings while the debt continues to be carried at amortized cost therefore current earnings are affected by the interest rate shift and other factor that cause change in the swap value but for which no offsetting change in value is recorded on the debt citigroup may alternatively elect to account for the debt at fair value under the fair value option once the irrevocable election is made upon issuance of the debt the full change in fair value of the debt is reported in earnings the change in fair value of the related interest rate swap are also reflected in earnings which provides natural offset to the debt fair value change to the extent that the two amount differ because the full change in the fair value of the debt includes risk not offset by the interest rate swap the difference is automatically captured in current earnings additional economic hedge include hedge of the credit risk component of commercial loan and loan commitment citigroup periodically evaluates it hedging strategy in other area and may designate either an accounting hedge or an economic hedge after considering the relative cost and benefit economic hedge are also employed when the hedged item itself is marked to market through current earnings such hedge of commitment to originate one to four family mortgage loan to be hf and msrs credit derivativesciti is market maker and trade range of credit derivative through these contract citi either purchase or writes protection on either single name or portfolio of reference credit citi also us credit derivative to help mitigate credit risk in it corporate and consumer loan portfolio and other cash position and to facilitate client transaction citi monitor it counterparty credit risk in credit derivative contract of december and approximately and respectively of the gross receivables are from counterparties with which citi maintains master netting agreement collateral agreement or settle daily majority of citi top counterparties by receivable balance owed to citi are central clearing house bank financial institution or other dealer contract with these counterparties do not include rating based termination event however counterparty rating downgrade may have an incremental effect by lowering the threshold at which citi may call for additional collateral the range of credit derivative entered into includes credit default swap total return swap credit option and credit linked note credit default swap is contract in which for fee protection seller agrees to reimburse protection buyer for any loss that occur due to predefined credit event on reference entity these credit event are defined by the term of the derivative contract and the reference entity and are generally limited to the market standard of failure to pay on indebtedness and bankruptcy of the reference entity and in more limited range of transaction debt restructuring credit derivative transaction that reference emerging market entity also typically include additional credit event to cover the acceleration of indebtedness and the risk of repudiation or payment moratorium in certain transaction protection may be provided on portfolio of reference entity or asset backed security if there is no credit event defined by the specific derivative contract then the protection seller make no payment to the protection buyer and receives only the contractually specified fee however if credit event occurs defined in the specific derivative contract sold the protection seller will be required to make payment to the protection buyer under certain contract the seller of protection may not be required to make payment until specified amount of loss ha occurred with respect to the portfolio and or may only be required to pay for loss up to specified amount total return swap typically transfer the total economic performance of reference asset which includes all associated flow well capital appreciation or depreciation the protection buyer receives floating rate of interest and any depreciation on the reference asset from the protection seller and in return the protection seller receives the cash flow associated with the reference asset plus any appreciation thus according to the total return swap agreement the protection seller will be obligated to make payment any time the floating interest rate payment plus any depreciation of the reference asset exceeds the cash flow associated with the underlying asset total return swap may terminate upon default of the reference asset or credit event with respect to the reference entity subject to the provision of the related total return swap agreement between the protection seller and the protection buyer credit option is credit derivative that allows investor to trade or hedge change in the credit quality of reference entity for example in credit spread option the option writer assumes the obligation to purchase or sell credit protection on the reference entity at specified strike spread level the option purchaser buy the right to sell credit default protection on the reference entity to or purchase it from the option writer at the strike spread level the payment on credit spread option depend either on particular credit spread or the price of the underlying credit sensitive asset or other reference entity the option usually terminate if credit event occurs with respect to the underlying reference entity credit linked note is form of credit derivative structured debt security with an embedded credit default swap the purchaser of the note effectively provides credit protection to the issuer by agreeing to receive return that could be negatively affected by credit event on the underlying reference entity if the reference entity default the note may be cash settled or physically settled by delivery of debt security of the reference entity thus the maximum amount of the note purchaser exposure is the amount paid for the credit linked note following table summarize the key characteristic of citi credit derivative portfolio by counterparty and derivative form fair valuesnotionalsin million of dollar at december payable protectionpurchasedprotectionsoldby industry of counterpartybanks broker non insurance and other financial total by industry of counterparty by instrumentcredit default swap and option total return swap and total by instrument by rating of reference entityinvestment grade non investment total by rating of reference entity by maturitywithin year from to after total by maturity the fair value amount receivable is composed of million under protection purchased and million under protection sold the fair value amount payable is composed of million under protection purchased and million under protection sold fair valuesnotionalsin million of dollar at december payable protectionpurchasedprotectionsoldby industry of counterpartybanks broker non insurance and other financial total by industry of counterparty by instrumentcredit default swap and option total return swap and total by instrument by rating of reference entityinvestment grade non investment total by rating of reference entity by maturitywithin year from to after total by maturity the fair value amount receivable is composed of million under protection purchased and million under protection sold the fair value amount payable is composed of million under protection purchased and million under protection sold value included in the above table are prior to application of any netting agreement and cash collateral for notional amount citi generally ha mismatch between the total notional amount of protection purchased and sold and it may hold the reference asset directly rather than entering into offsetting credit derivative contract and when desired the open risk exposure from credit derivative contract are largely matched after certain cash position in reference asset are considered and after notional amount are adjusted either to duration based equivalent basis or to reflect the level of subordination in tranched structure the rating of the credit derivative portfolio presented in the table and used to evaluate payment performance risk are based on the assigned internal or external rating of the reference asset or entity where external rating are used investment grade rating are considered to be baa bbb and above while anything below is considered non investment grade citi internal rating are in line with the related external rating system citigroup evaluates the payment performance risk of the credit derivative for which it stand protection seller based on the credit rating assigned to the underlying reference credit credit derivative written on an underlying non investment grade reference entity represent greater payment risk to the company the non investment grade category in the table above also includes credit derivative where the underlying reference entity ha been downgraded subsequent to the inception of the derivative the maximum potential amount of future payment under credit derivative contract presented in the table above is based on the notional value of the derivative the company belief that the notional amount for credit protection sold is not representative of the actual loss exposure based on historical experience this amount ha not been reduced by the value of the reference asset and the related cash flow in accordance with most credit derivative contract should credit event occur the company usually is liable for the difference between the protection sold and the value of the reference asset furthermore the notional amount for credit protection sold ha not been reduced for any cash collateral paid to given counterparty such payment would be calculated after netting all derivative exposure including any credit derivative with that counterparty in accordance with related master netting agreement due to such netting process determining the amount of collateral that corresponds to credit derivative exposure alone is not possible the company actively monitor open credit risk exposure and manages this exposure by using variety of strategy including purchased credit derivative cash collateral or direct holding of the referenced asset this risk mitigation activity is not captured in the table above credit risk related contingent feature in derivativescertain derivative instrument contain provision that require the company to either post additional collateral or immediately settle any outstanding liability balance upon the occurrence of specified event related to the credit risk of the company these event which are defined by the existing derivative contract are primarily downgrade in the credit rating of the company and it affiliate the fair value excluding cva of all derivative instrument with credit risk related contingent feature that were in net liability position at december and wa billion and billion respectively the company posted billion and billion collateral for this exposure in the normal course of business of december and respectively downgrade could trigger additional collateral or cash settlement requirement for the company and certain affiliate in the event that citigroup and citibank were downgraded single notch by all three major rating agency of december the company could be required to post an additional billion either collateral or settlement of the derivative transaction in addition the company could be required to segregate with third party custodian collateral previously received from existing derivative counterparties in the amount of million upon the single notch downgrade resulting in aggregate cash obligation and collateral requirement of approximately billion derivative accompanied by financial asset transfersthe company executes total return swap that provide it with synthetic exposure to substantially all of the economic return of the security or other financial asset referenced in the contract in certain case the derivative transaction is accompanied by the company transfer of the referenced financial asset to the derivative counterparty most typically in response to the derivative counterparty desire to hedge in whole or in part it synthetic exposure under the derivative contract by holding the referenced asset in funded form in certain jurisdiction these transaction qualify sale resulting in derecognition of the security transferred see note for further discussion of the related sale condition for transfer of financial asset for significant portion of the transaction the company ha also executed another total return swap where the company pass on substantially all of the economic return of the referenced security to different third party seeking the exposure in those case the company is not exposed on net basis to change in the economic return of the referenced security these transaction generally involve the transfer of the company liquid government bond convertible bond or publicly traded corporate equity security from the trading portfolio and are executed with third party financial institution the accompanying derivative are typically total return swap the derivative are cash settled and subject to ongoing margin requirement when the condition for sale accounting are met the company report the transfer of the referenced financial asset sale and separately report the accompanying derivative transaction these transaction generally do not result in gain or loss on the sale of the security because the transferred wa held at fair value in the company trading portfolio for transfer of financial asset accounted for sale by the company and for which the company ha retained substantially all of the economic exposure to the transferred asset through total return swap executed with the same counterparty in contemplation of the initial sale and still outstanding the asset amount derecognized and the gross cash proceeds received of the date of derecognition were billion and billion of december and respectively at december the fair value of these previously derecognized asset wa billion the fair value of the total return swap of december wa million recorded gross derivative asset and million recorded gross derivative liability at december the fair value of these previously derecognized asset wa billion and the fair value of the total return swap wa million recorded gross derivative asset and million recorded gross derivative liability the balance for the total return swap are on gross basis before the application of counterparty and cash collateral netting and are included primarily equity derivative in the tabular disclosure in this note concentration of credit risk concentration of credit risk exist when change in economic industry or geographic factor similarly affect group of counterparties whose aggregate credit exposure is material in relation to citigroup total credit exposure although citigroup portfolio of financial instrument is broadly diversified along industry product and geographic line material transaction are completed with other financial institution particularly in the security trading derivative and foreign exchange business in connection with the company effort to maintain diversified portfolio the company limit it exposure to any one geographic region country or individual creditor and monitor this exposure on continuous basis at december citigroup most significant concentration of credit risk wa with the government and it agency the company exposure which primarily result from trading asset and investment issued by the government and it agency amounted to billion and billion at december and respectively the german japanese and united kingdom government and their agency which are rated investment grade by both moody and were the next largest exposure the company exposure to germany amounted to billion and billion at december and respectively the company exposure to japan amounted to billion and billion at december and respectively the company exposure to the united kingdom amounted to billion and billion at december and respectively the foreign government exposure are composed of investment security loan and trading asset the company exposure to state and municipality amounted to billion and billion at december and respectively and wa composed of trading asset investment security derivative and lending activity fair value measurementasc fair value measurement defines fair value establishes consistent framework for measuring fair value and requires disclosure about fair value measurement fair value is defined the price that would be received to sell an asset or paid to transfer liability in an orderly transaction between market participant at the measurement date and therefore represents an exit price among other thing the standard requires the company to maximize the use of observable input and minimize the use of unobservable input when measuring fair value under asc the probability of counterparty default is factored into the valuation of derivative and other position and the impact of citigroup own credit risk is also factored into the valuation of derivative and other liability that are measured at fair value fair value hierarchyasc specifies hierarchy of input based on whether the input are observable or unobservable observable input are developed using market data and reflect market participant assumption while unobservable input reflect the company market assumption these two type of input have created the following fair value hierarchy level quoted price for identical instrument in active market level quoted price for similar instrument in active market quoted price for identical or similar instrument in market that are not active and model derived valuation in which all significant input and significant value driver are observable in the market level valuation derived from valuation technique in which one or more significant input or significant value driver are unobservable required under the fair value hierarchy the company considers relevant and observable market input in it valuation where possible the fair value hierarchy classification approach typically utilizes rule based and data driven selection criterion to determine whether an instrument is classified level level or level the determination of whether an instrument is quoted in an active market and therefore considered level instrument is based upon the frequency of observed transaction and the quality of independent market data available on the measurement date level classification is assigned where there is observability of price market input to model or where any unobservable input are not significant to the valuation the determination of whether an input is considered observable is based on the availability of independent market data and it corroboration for example through observed transaction in the market otherwise an instrument is classified level determination of fair valuefor asset and liability carried at fair value the company measure fair value using the procedure set out below irrespective of whether the asset and liability are measured at fair value result of an election non recurring lower of cost or market locom adjustment or because they are required to be measured at fair value when available the company us quoted market price from active market to determine fair value and classifies such item level in some specific case where market price is available the company will apply practical expedient such matrix pricing to calculate fair value in which case the item may be classified level the company may also apply price based methodology that utilizes where available quoted price or other market information obtained from recent trading activity in position with the same or similar characteristic to the position being valued if relevant and observable price are available those valuation may be classified level however when there are one or more significant unobservable price input those valuation will be classified level furthermore when quoted price is considered stale significant adjustment to the price of similar security may be necessary to reflect difference in the term of the actual security or loan being valued or alternatively when price from independent source may be insufficient to corroborate valuation the price input are considered unobservable and the fair value measurement are classified level if quoted market price are not available fair value is based upon internally developed valuation technique that use where possible current market based parameter such interest rate currency rate and option volatility item valued using such internally generated valuation technique are classified according to the lowest level input or value driver that is significant to the valuation thus an item may be classified level even though there may be some significant input that are readily observable fair value estimate from internal valuation technique are verified where possible to price obtained from independent vendor or broker vendor and broker valuation may be based on variety of input ranging from observed price to proprietary valuation model and the company ass the quality and relevance of this information in determining the estimate of fair value the following section describes the valuation methodology used by the company to measure various financial instrument at fair value where appropriate the description includes detail of the valuation model the key input to those model and any significant assumption market valuation adjustmentsgenerally the unit of account for financial instrument is the individual financial instrument the company applies market valuation adjustment that are consistent with the unit of account which doe not include adjustment due to the size of the company position except follows asc permit an exception through an accounting policy election to measure the fair value of portfolio of financial asset and financial liability on the basis of the net open risk position when certain criterion are met citi ha elected to measure portfolio of financial instrument that meet those criterion such derivative on the basis of the net open risk position the company applies market valuation adjustment including adjustment to account for the size of the net open risk position consistent with market participant assumption valuation adjustment are applied to item classified level or level in the fair value hierarchy to ensure that the fair value reflects the price at which the net open risk position could be exited these valuation adjustment are based on the bid offer spread for an instrument in the market when citi ha elected to measure certain portfolio of financial investment such derivative on the basis of the net open risk position the valuation adjustment may take into account the size of the position credit valuation adjustment cva and funding valuation adjustment fva are applied to the relevant population of over the counter otc derivative instrument where adjustment to reflect counterparty credit risk own credit risk and term funding risk are required to estimate fair value this principally includes derivative with base valuation discounted using overnight indexed swap ois requiring adjustment for these effect such uncollateralized interest rate swap the cva represents portfolio level adjustment to reflect the risk premium associated with the counterparty asset or citi liability non performance risk the fva represents market funding risk premium inherent in the uncollateralized portion of derivative portfolio and in certain collateralized derivative portfolio that do not include standard credit support annex csas such where the csa doe not permit the reuse of collateral received citi fva methodology leverage the existing cva methodology to estimate funding exposure profile the calculation of this exposure profile considers collateral agreement in which the term do not permit the company to reuse the collateral received including where counterparties post collateral to third party custodian citi cva and fva methodology consist of two step first the exposure profile for each counterparty is determined using the term of all individual derivative position and monte carlo simulation or other quantitative analysis to generate series of expected cash flow at future point in time the calculation of this exposure profile considers the effect of credit risk mitigants and source of funding including pledged cash or other collateral and any legal right of offset that exists with counterparty through arrangement such netting agreement individual derivative contract that are subject to an enforceable master netting agreement with counterparty are aggregated netting set for this purpose since it is those aggregate net cash flow that are subject to nonperformance risk this process identifies specific point in time future cash flow that are subject to nonperformance and term funding risk rather than using the current recognized net asset or liability basis to measure the cva and fva second for cva market based view of default probability derived from observed credit spread in the credit default swap cd market are applied to the expected future cash flow determined in step one citi own credit cva is determined using citi specific cd spread for the relevant tenor generally counterparty cva is determined using cd spread index for each credit rating and tenor for certain identified netting set where individual analysis is practicable exposure to counterparties with liquid cd counterparty specific cd spread are used for fva term structure of spread is applied to the expected funding exposure the market liquidity spread used to represent the term funding premium associated with certain otc derivative the cva and fva are designed to incorporate market view of the credit and funding risk respectively inherent in the derivative portfolio however most unsecured derivative instrument are negotiated bilateral contract and are not commonly transferred to third party derivative instrument are normally settled contractually or if terminated early are terminated at value negotiated bilaterally between the counterparties thus the cva and fva may not be realized upon settlement or termination in the normal course of business in addition all or portion of these adjustment may be reversed or otherwise adjusted in future period in the event of change in the credit or funding risk associated with the derivative instrument the table below summarizes the cva and fva applied to the fair value of derivative instrument at december and credit and funding valuation adjustmentscontra liability contra asset in million of dollarsdecember cva asset fva citigroup own credit liability total cva and fva derivative instrument table below summarizes pretax gain loss related to change in cva on derivative instrument net of hedge fva on derivative and debt valuation adjustment dva on citi own fair value option fvo liability for the year indicated credit funding debt valuationadjustments gain loss in million of cva asset fva own credit liability total cva and fva derivative instrument dva related to own fvo liability total cva dva and fva see note security purchased under agreement to resell and security sold under agreement to repurchaseno quoted price exist for these instrument since fair value is determined using discounted cash flow technique cash flow are estimated based on the term of the contract taking into account any embedded derivative or other feature these cash flow are discounted using interest rate appropriate to the maturity of the instrument well the nature of the underlying collateral generally when such instrument are recorded at fair value they are classified within level of the fair value hierarchy the input used in the valuation are readily observable however certain long dated position are classified within level of the fair value hierarchy trading account asset and liability trading security and trading loanswhen available the company us quoted market price in active market to determine the fair value of trading security such item are classified level of the fair value hierarchy example include government security and exchange traded equity security for bond and secondary market loan traded over the counter the company generally determines fair value utilizing various valuation technique including discounted cash flow price based and internal model fair value estimate from these internal valuation technique are verified where possible to price obtained from independent source including third party vendor price based methodology utilizes where available quoted price or other market information obtained from recent trading activity of asset with similar characteristic to the bond or loan being valued the yield used in discounted cash flow model are derived from the same price information trading security and loan priced using such method are generally classified level however when the primary input to the valuation are unobservable or price from independent source are insufficient to corroborate valuation loan or security is generally classified level fair value estimate from these internal valuation technique are verified where possible to price obtained from independent source including third party vendor when the company principal exit market for portfolio of loan is through securitization the company us the securitization price key input into the fair value of the loan portfolio the securitization price is determined from the assumed proceeds of hypothetical securitization within the current market environment where such price verification is possible loan portfolio are typically classified level in the fair value hierarchy for most of the subprime mortgage backed security mb exposure fair value is determined utilizing observable transaction where available or other valuation technique such discounted cash flow analysis utilizing valuation assumption derived from similar more observable security market proxy the valuation of certain asset backed security ab cdo position is inferred through the net asset value of the underlying asset of the ab cdo trading account asset and liability derivativesexchange traded derivative measured at fair value using quoted exchange price in active market where available are classified level of the fair value hierarchy derivative without quoted price in an active market and derivative executed over the counter are valued using internal valuation technique these derivative instrument are classified either level or level depending on the observability of the significant input to the model the valuation technique depend on the type of derivative and the nature of the underlying instrument the principal technique used to value these instrument are discounted cash flow and internal model such derivative pricing model black scholes and monte carlo simulation the key input depend upon the type of derivative and the nature of the underlying instrument and include interest rate yield curve foreign exchange rate volatility and correlation investmentsthe investment category includes available for sale debt and marketable equity security whose fair value are generally determined by utilizing similar procedure described for trading security above or in some case using vendor pricing the primary source also included in investment are nonpublic investment in private equity and real estate entity determining the fair value of nonpublic security involves significant degree of management judgment no quoted price exist and such security are not generally traded in addition there may be transfer restriction on private equity security the company process for determining the fair value of such security utilizes commonly accepted valuation technique including guideline public company analysis and comparable transaction in determining the fair value of nonpublic security the company also considers event such proposed sale of the investee company initial public offering equity issuance or other observable transaction private security are generally classified level of the fair value hierarchy in addition the company hold investment in certain alternative investment fund that calculate nav per share including hedge fund private equity fund and real estate fund investment in fund are generally classified non marketable equity security carried at fair value the fair value of these investment are estimated using the nav per share of the company ownership interest in the fund where it is not probable that the investment will be realized at price other than the nav consistent with the provision of asu these investment are categorized within the fair value hierarchy and are not included in the table below see note for additional information short term borrowing and long term debtwhere fair value accounting ha been elected the fair value of non structured liability is determined by utilizing internal model using the appropriate discount rate for the applicable maturity such instrument are classified level of the fair value hierarchy when all significant input are readily observable the company determines the fair value of hybrid financial instrument including structured liability using the appropriate derivative valuation methodology described above in trading account asset and liability derivative given the nature of the embedded risk profile such instrument are classified level or level depending on the observability of significant input to the model measured at fair value on recurring basisthe
