input are shown zero due to rounding when the low and high input are the same there is either constant input applied to all position or the methodology involving the input applies to only one large position weighted average are calculated based on the fair value of the instrument for equity security the price input are expressed on an absolute basis not percentage of the notional amount both trading and non trading account derivative asset and liability are presented on gross absolute value basis includes hybrid product of fair value measurement relating to unobservable inputsvaluation uncertainty arises when there is insufficient or dispersed market data to allow precise determination of the exit value of fair valued position or portfolio in today market this is especially prevalent in level fair value instrument where uncertainty exists in valuation input that may be both unobservable and significant to the instrument or portfolio overall fair value measurement the uncertainty associated with key unobservable input on the level fair value measurement may not be independent of one another in addition the amount and direction of the uncertainty on fair value measurement for given change in an unobservable input depends on the nature of the instrument well whether the company hold the instrument an asset or liability for certain instrument the pricing hedging and risk management are sensitive to the correlation between various input rather than on the analysis and aggregation of the individual input the following section describes some of the most significant unobservable input used by the company in level fair value measurement correlationcorrelation is measure of the extent to which two or more variable change in relation to each other variety of correlation related assumption are required for wide range of instrument including equity and credit basket foreign exchange option credit index tranche and many other instrument for almost all of these instrument correlation are not directly observable in the market and must be calculated using alternative source including historical information estimating correlation can be especially difficult where it may vary over time and calculating correlation information from market data requires significant assumption regarding the informational efficiency of the market swaption market uncertainty therefore exists when an estimate of the appropriate level of correlation an input into some fair value measurement is required change in correlation level can have substantial impact favorable or unfavorable on the value of an instrument depending on it nature change in the default correlation of the fair value of the underlying bond comprising cdo structure would affect the fair value of the senior tranche for example an increase in the default correlation of the underlying bond would reduce the fair value of the senior tranche because highly correlated instrument produce greater loss in the event of default and portion of these loss would become attributable to the senior tranche that same change in default correlation would have different impact on junior tranche of the same structure volatilityvolatility represents the speed and severity of market price change and is key factor in pricing option volatility generally depends on the tenor of the underlying instrument and the strike price or level defined in the contract volatility for certain combination of tenor and strike are not observable and need to be estimated using alternative method such comparable instrument historical analysis or other source of market information this lead to uncertainty around the final fair value measurement of instrument with unobservable volatility the general relationship between change in the value of an instrument or portfolio to change in volatility also depends on change in interest rate and the level of the underlying index generally long option position asset benefit from increase in volatility whereas short option position liability will suffer loss some instrument are more sensitive to change in volatility than others for example an at the money option would experience greater percentage change in it fair value than deep in the money option in addition the fair value of an option with more than one underlying security an option on basket of equity depends on the volatility of the individual underlying security well their correlation yieldin some circumstance the yield of an instrument is not observable in the market and must be estimated from historical data or from yield of similar security this estimated yield may need to be adjusted to capture the characteristic of the security being valued whenever the amount of the adjustment is significant to the value of the security the fair value measurement is classified level adjusted yield is generally used to discount the projected future principal and interest cash flow on instrument such asset backed security adjusted yield is impacted by change in the interest rate environment and relevant credit spread prepaymentvoluntary unscheduled payment prepayment change the future cash flow for the investor and thereby change the fair value of the security the effect of prepayment is more pronounced for residential mortgage backed security prepayment is generally negatively correlated with delinquency and interest rate combination of low prepayment and high delinquency amplifies each input negative impact on mortgage security valuation prepayment speed change the weighted average life of the security change which impact the valuation either positively or negatively depending upon the nature of the security and the direction of the change in the weighted average life recoveryrecovery is the proportion of the total outstanding balance of bond or loan that is expected to be collected in liquidation scenario for many credit security commercial mortgage backed security the expected recovery amount of defaulted property is typically unknown until liquidation of the property is imminent the assumed recovery of security may differ from it actual recovery that will be observable in the future generally an increase in the recovery rate assumption increase the fair value of the security an increase in loss severity the inverse of the recovery rate reduces the amount of principal available for distribution and result decrease the fair value of the security spreadcredit spread is component of the security representing it credit quality credit spread reflects the market perception of change in prepayment delinquency and recovery rate therefore capturing the impact of other variable on the fair value change in credit spread affect the fair value of security differently depending on the characteristic and maturity profile of the security for example credit spread is more significant driver of the fair value measurement of high yield bond compared to an investment grade bond generally the credit spread for an investment grade bond is also more observable and le volatile than it high yield counterpart item measured at fair value on nonrecurring basiscertain asset and liability are measured at fair value on nonrecurring basis and therefore are not included in the table above these include asset measured at cost that have been written down to fair value during the period result of an impairment these also include non marketable equity security that have been measured using the measurement alternative and are either written down to fair value during the period result of an impairment or ii adjusted upward or downward to fair value result of transaction observed during the period for an identical or similar investment in the same issuer in addition these asset include loan held for sale and other real estate owned that are measured at the lower of cost or market value the following table present the carrying amount of all asset that were still held for which nonrecurring fair value measurement wa recorded in million of dollarsfair valuelevel loan hf other real estate loan non marketable equity security measured using the measurement total asset at fair value on nonrecurring basis in million of dollarsfair valuelevel loan hf other real estate loan non marketable equity security measured using the measurement total asset at fair value on nonrecurring basis net of fair value amount on the unfunded portion of loan hf recognized other liability on the consolidated balance sheet represents impaired loan held for investment whose carrying amount is based on the fair value of the underlying collateral le cost to sell primarily real estate the fair value of loan hf is determined where possible using quoted secondary market price if no such quoted price exists the fair value of loan is determined using quoted price for similar asset or asset adjusted for the specific attribute of that loan fair value for the other real estate owned is based on appraisal for loan whose carrying amount is based on the fair value of the underlying collateral the fair value depend on the type of collateral fair value of the collateral is typically estimated based on quoted market price if available appraisal or other internal valuation technique where the fair value of the related collateral is based on an appraised value the loan is generally classified level in addition for corporate loan appraisal of the collateral are often based on sale of similar asset however because the price of similar asset require significant adjustment to reflect the unique feature of the underlying collateral these fair value measurement are generally classified level the fair value of non marketable equity security under the measurement alternative is based on observed transaction price for the identical or similar investment of the same issuer or an internal valuation technique in the case of an impairment where there are insufficient market observation to conclude the input are observable where significant adjustment are made to the observed transaction price or when an internal valuation technique is used the security is classified level fair value may differ from the observed transaction price due to number of factor including marketability adjustment and difference in right and obligation when the observed transaction is not for the identical investment held by citi technique and input for level nonrecurring fair value measurement the following table present the valuation technique covering the majority of level nonrecurring fair value measurement and the most significant unobservable input used in those measurement of december value in million methodologyinputlow highweightedaverage loan providing notice to the borrower fair value electionsthe company may elect to report most financial instrument and certain other item at fair value on an instrument by instrument basis with change in fair value reported in earnings other than dva see below the election is made upon the initial recognition of an eligible financial asset financial liability or firm commitment or when certain specified reconsideration event occur the fair value election may not otherwise be revoked once an election is made the change in fair value are recorded in current earnings movement in dva are reported component of aoci additional discussion regarding the applicable area in which fair value election were made is presented in note the company ha elected fair value accounting for it mortgage servicing right msrs see note for additional detail on citi msrs the following table present the change in fair value of those item for which the fair value option ha been elected change in fair value borrowingsthe company elected the fair value option for certain portfolio of fixed income security purchased under agreement to resell and fixed income security sold under agreement to repurchase security borrowed security loaned and certain uncollateralized short term borrowing held primarily by broker dealer entity in the united state the united kingdom and japan in each case the election wa made because the related interest rate risk is managed on portfolio basis primarily with offsetting derivative instrument that are accounted for at fair value through earnings change in fair value for transaction in these portfolio are recorded in principal transaction the related interest revenue and interest expense are measured based on the contractual rate specified in the transaction and are reported interest revenue and interest expense in the consolidated statement of income certain loan and other credit productscitigroup ha also elected the fair value option for certain other originated and purchased loan including certain unfunded loan product such guarantee and letter of credit executed by citigroup lending and trading business none of these credit product are highly leveraged financing commitment significant group of transaction include loan and unfunded loan product that are expected to be either sold or securitized in the near term or transaction where the economic risk are hedged with derivative instrument such purchased credit default swap or total return swap where the company pay the total return on the underlying loan to third party citigroup ha elected the fair value option to mitigate accounting mismatch in case where hedge accounting is complex and to achieve operational simplification fair value wa not elected for most lending transaction project or to guarantee completion of such project in accordance with contract term they are also issued to support customer obligation to supply specified product commodity or maintenance or warranty service to third party derivative instrument considered to be guaranteesderivatives are financial instrument whose cash flow are based on notional amount and an underlying instrument reference credit or index where there is little or no initial investment and whose term require or permit net settlement see note for discussion of citi derivative activity derivative instrument considered to be guarantee include only those instrument that require citi to make payment to the counterparty based on change in an underlying instrument that is related to an asset liability or an equity security held by the guaranteed party more specifically derivative instrument considered to be guarantee include certain over the counter written put option where the counterparty is not bank hedge fund or broker dealer such counterparties are considered to be dealer in these market and may therefore not hold the underlying instrument credit derivative sold by citi are excluded from the table above they are disclosed separately in note in instance where citi maximum potential future payment is unlimited the notional amount of the contract is disclosed loan sold with recourseloans sold with recourse represent citi obligation to reimburse the buyer for loan loss under certain circumstance recourse refers to the clause in sale agreement under which seller lender will fully reimburse the buyer investor for any loss resulting from the purchased loan this may be accomplished by the seller taking back any loan that become delinquent in addition to the amount shown in the table above citi ha recorded repurchase reserve for it potential repurchase or make whole liability regarding residential mortgage representation and warranty claim related to it whole loan sale to government sponsored agency and to lesser extent private investor the repurchase reserve wa approximately million and million at december and respectively and these amount are included in other liability on the consolidated balance sheet security lending indemnificationsowners of security frequently lend those security for fee to other party who may sell them short or deliver them to another party to satisfy some other obligation bank may administer such security lending program for their client security lending indemnification are issued by the bank to guarantee that security lending customer will be made whole in the event that the security borrower doe not return the security subject to the lending agreement and collateral held is insufficient to cover the market value of the security credit card merchant processingcredit card merchant processing guarantee represent the company indirect obligation in connection with providing transaction processing service to various merchant with respect to it private label card and ii potential liability for bank card transaction processing service the nature of the liability in either case arises result of billing dispute between merchant and cardholder that is ultimately resolved in the cardholder favor the merchant is liable to refund the amount to the cardholder in general if the credit card processing company is unable to collect this amount from the merchant the credit card processing company bear the loss for the amount of the credit or refund paid to the cardholder with regard to above citi ha the primary contingent liability with respect to it portfolio of private label merchant the risk of loss is mitigated the cash flow between citi and the merchant are settled on net basis and citi ha the right to offset any payment with cash flow otherwise due to the merchant to further mitigate this risk citi may delay settlement require merchant to make an escrow deposit include event trigger to provide citi with more financial and operational control in the event of the financial deterioration of the merchant or require various credit enhancement including letter of credit and bank guarantee in the unlikely event that private label merchant is unable to deliver product service or refund to it private label cardholder citi is contingently liable to credit or refund cardholder with regard to ii above citi ha potential liability for bank card transaction where citi provides the transaction processing service well those where third party provides the service and citi act secondary guarantor should that processor fail to perform citi maximum potential contingent liability related to both bank card and private label merchant processing service is estimated to be the total volume of credit card transaction that meet the requirement to be valid charge back transaction at any given time at december and this maximum potential exposure wa estimated to be billion and billion respectively however citi belief that the maximum exposure is not representative of the actual potential loss exposure based on it historical experience this contingent liability is unlikely to arise most product and service are delivered when purchased and amount are refunded when item are returned to merchant citi ass the probability and amount of it liability related to merchant processing based on the financial strength of the primary guarantor the extent and nature of unresolved charge back and it historical loss experience at december and the loss incurred and the carrying amount of citi contingent obligation related to merchant processing activity were immaterial credit card arrangement with partnersciti in one of it credit card partner arrangement provides guarantee to the partner regarding the volume of certain customer origination during the term of the agreement to the extent that such origination target are not met the guarantee serve to compensate the partner for certain payment that otherwise would have been generated in connection with such origination other guarantee and indemnification credit card protection programsciti through it credit card business provides various cardholder protection program on several of it card product including program that provide insurance coverage for rental car coverage for certain loss associated with purchased product price protection for certain purchase and protection for lost luggage these guarantee are not included in the table since the total outstanding amount of the guarantee and citi maximum exposure to loss can not be quantified the protection is limited to certain type of purchase and loss and it is not possible to quantify the purchase that would qualify for these benefit at any given time citi ass the probability and amount of it potential liability related to these program based on the extent and nature of it historical loss experience at december and the actual and estimated loss incurred and the carrying value of citi obligation related to these program were immaterial other representation and warranty indemnificationsin the normal course of business citi provides standard representation and warranty to counterparties in contract in connection with numerous transaction and also provides indemnification including indemnification that protect the counterparties to the contract in the event that additional tax are owed due either to change in the tax law or an adverse interpretation of the tax law counterparties to these transaction provide citi with comparable indemnification while such representation warranty and indemnification are essential component of many contractual relationship they do not represent the underlying business purpose for the transaction the indemnification clause are often standard contractual term related to citi own performance under the term of contract and are entered into in the normal course of business based on an assessment that the risk of loss is remote often these clause are intended to ensure that term of contract are met at inception no compensation is received for these standard representation and warranty and it is not possible to determine their fair value because they rarely if ever result in payment in many case there are no stated or notional amount included in the indemnification clause and the contingency potentially triggering the obligation to indemnify have not occurred and are not expected to occur result these indemnification are not included in the table above value transfer network including exchange and clearing house vtns citi is member of or shareholder in hundred of value transfer network vtns payment clearing and settlement system well exchange around the world condition of membership many of these vtns require that member stand ready to pay pro rata share of the loss incurred by the organization due to another member default on it obligation citi potential obligation may be limited to it membership interest in the vtns contribution to the vtn fund or in certain narrow case to the full pro rata share the maximum exposure is difficult to estimate this would require an assessment of claim that have not yet occurred however citi belief the risk of loss is remote given historical experience with the vtns accordingly citi participation in vtns is not reported in the guarantee table above and there are no amount reflected on the consolidated balance sheet of december or for potential obligation that could arise from citi involvement with vtn association long term care insurance indemnificationin traveler life annuity traveler then subsidiary of citi entered into reinsurance agreement to transfer the risk and reward of it long term care ltc business to ge life now genworth financial inc or genworth then subsidiary of the general electric company ge part of this transaction the reinsurance obligation were provided by two regulated insurance subsidiary of ge life which funded two collateral trust with security presently discussed below the trust are referred to the genworth trust part of ge spin off of genworth in ge retained the risk and reward associated with the traveler reinsurance agreement by providing reinsurance contract to genworth through ge union fidelity life insurance company uflic subsidiary that cover the traveler ltc policy in addition ge provided capital maintenance agreement in favor of uflic that is designed to assure that uflic will have the fund to pay it reinsurance obligation result of these reinsurance agreement and the spin off of genworth genworth ha reinsurance protection from uflic supported by ge and ha reinsurance obligation in connection with the traveler ltc policy noted below the genworth reinsurance obligation now benefit brighthouse financial inc brighthouse while neither brighthouse nor citi are direct beneficiary of the capital maintenance agreement between ge and uflic brighthouse and citi benefit indirectly from the existence of the capital maintenance agreement which help assure that uflic will continue to have fund necessary to pay it reinsurance obligation to genworth in connection with citi sale of traveler to metlife inc metlife citi provided an indemnification to metlife for loss including policyholder claim relating to the ltc business for the entire term of the traveler ltc which noted above are reinsured by subsidiary of genworth in metlife spun off it retail insurance business to brighthouse result the traveler ltc policy now reside with brighthouse the original reinsurance agreement between traveler now brighthouse and genworth remains in place and brighthouse is the sole beneficiary of the genworth trust the genworth trust are designed to provide collateral to brighthouse in an amount equal to the statutory liability of brighthouse in respect of the traveler ltc policy the asset in the genworth trust are evaluated and adjusted periodically to ensure that the fair value of the asset continues to provide collateral in an amount equal to these estimated statutory liability the liability change over time if both genworth fails to perform under the original traveler ge life reinsurance agreement for any reason including it insolvency or the failure of uflic to perform under it reinsurance contract or ge to perform under the capital maintenance agreement and ii the asset of the two genworth trust are insufficient or unavailable then citi through it ltc reinsurance indemnification must reimburse brighthouse for any loss incurred in connection with the ltc policy since both event would have to occur before citi would become responsible for any payment to brighthouse pursuant to it indemnification obligation and the likelihood of such event occurring is currently not probable there is no liability reflected on the consolidated balance sheet of december and related to this indemnification however if both event become reasonably possible meaning more than remote but le than probable citi will be required to estimate and disclose reasonably possible loss or range of loss to the extent that such an estimate could be made in addition if both event become probable citi will be required to accrue for such liability in accordance with applicable accounting principle future and over the counter derivative clearingciti provides clearing service on central clearing party ccp for client that need to clear exchange traded and over the counter otc derivative contract with ccps based on all relevant fact and circumstance citi ha concluded that it act an agent for accounting purpose in it role clearing member for these client transaction such citi doe not reflect the underlying exchange traded or otc derivative contract in it consolidated financial statement see note for discussion of citi derivative activity that are reflected in it consolidated financial statement clearing member citi collect and remit cash and security collateral margin between it client and the respective ccp in certain circumstance citi collect higher amount of cash or security from it client than it need to remit to the ccps this excess cash is then held at depository institution such bank or carry broker there are two type of margin initial and variation where citi obtains benefit from or control cash initial margin retains an interest spread cash initial margin collected from client and remitted to the ccp or depository institution is reflected within brokerage payable payable to customer and brokerage receivables receivables from broker dealer and clearing organization or cash and due from bank respectively however for exchange traded and otc cleared derivative contract where citi doe not obtain benefit from or control the client cash balance the client cash initial margin collected from client and remitted to the ccp or depository institution is not reflected on citi consolidated balance sheet these condition are met when citi ha contractually agreed with the client that citi will pas through to the client all interest paid by the ccp or depository institution on the cash initial margin ii citi will not utilize it right clearing member to transform cash margin into other asset iii citi doe not guarantee and is not liable to the client for the performance of the ccp or the depository institution and iv the client cash balance are legally isolated from citi bankruptcy estate the total amount of cash initial margin collected and remitted in this manner wa approximately billion and billion of december and respectively variation margin due from client to the respective ccp or from the ccp to client reflects change in the value of the client derivative contract for each trading day clearing member citi is exposed to the risk of non performance by client failure of client to post variation margin to the ccp for negative change in the value of the client derivative contract in the event of non performance by client citi would move to close out the client position the ccp would typically utilize initial margin posted by the client and held by the ccp with any remaining shortfall required to be paid by citi clearing member citi generally hold incremental cash or security margin posted by the client which would typically be expected to be sufficient to mitigate citi credit risk in the event that the client fails to perform required by asc security collateral posted by client is not recognized on citi consolidated balance sheet value guarantee and indemnificationsat december and the require payment of fee such fee net of certain direct cost are deferred and upon exercise of the commitment amortized over the life of the loan or if exercise is deemed remote amortized over the commitment period commercial and similar letter of credita commercial letter of credit is an instrument by which citigroup substitute it credit for that of customer to enable the customer to finance ha performed in accordance with the term of the letter of credit when letter of credit is drawn the customer is then required to reimburse citigroup one to four family residential mortgagesa one to citi future lease payment are follows in million of total future lease payment le imputed interest based on weighted average discount rate of lease liability contingency accounting and disclosure frameworkasc governs the disclosure and recognition of loss contingency including potential loss from litigation regulatory tax and other matter asc defines loss contingency an existing condition situation or set of circumstance involving uncertainty to possible loss to an entity that will ultimately be resolved when one or more future event occur or fail to occur it imposes different requirement for the recognition and disclosure of loss contingency based on the likelihood of occurrence of the contingent future event or event it distinguishes among degree of likelihood using the following three term probable meaning that the future event or event are likely to occur remote meaning that the chance of the future event or event occurring is slight and reasonably possible meaning that the chance of the future event or event occurring is more than remote but le than likely these three term are used below defined in asc accrual asc requires accrual for loss contingency when it is probable that one or more future event will occur confirming the fact of loss and the amount of the loss can be reasonably estimated in accordance with asc citigroup establishes accrual for contingency including any litigation regulatory or tax matter disclosed herein when citigroup belief it is probable that loss ha been incurred and the amount of the loss can be reasonably estimated when the reasonable estimate of the loss is within range of amount the minimum amount of the range is accrued unless some higher amount within the range is better estimate than any other amount within the range once established accrual are adjusted from time to time appropriate in light of additional information the amount of loss ultimately incurred in relation to those matter may be substantially higher or lower than the amount accrued for those matter disclosure asc requires disclosure of loss contingency if there is at least reasonable possibility that loss or an additional loss may have been incurred and there is no accrual for the loss because the condition described above are not met or an exposure to loss exists in excess of the amount accrued in accordance with asc if citigroup ha not accrued for matter because citigroup belief that loss is reasonably possible but not probable or that loss is probable but not reasonably estimable and the reasonably possible loss is material it discloses the loss contingency in addition citigroup discloses matter for which it ha accrued if it belief reasonably possible exposure to material loss exists in excess of the amount accrued in accordance with asc citigroup disclosure includes an estimate of the reasonably possible loss or range of loss for those matter to which an estimate can be made asc doe not require disclosure of an estimate of the reasonably possible loss or range of loss where an estimate can not be made neither accrual nor disclosure is required for loss that are deemed remote litigation regulatory and other contingency overview in addition to the matter described below in the ordinary course of business citigroup it affiliate and subsidiary and current and former officer director and employee for purpose of this section sometimes collectively referred to citigroup and related party routinely are named defendant in or party to various legal action and proceeding certain of these action and proceeding assert claim or seek relief in connection with alleged violation of consumer protection fair lending security banking antifraud antitrust anti money laundering employment and other statutory and common law certain of these actual or threatened legal action and proceeding include claim for substantial or indeterminate compensatory or punitive damage or for injunctive relief and in some instance seek recovery on class wide basis in the ordinary course of business citigroup and related party also are subject to governmental and regulatory examination information gathering request investigation and proceeding both formal and informal certain of which may result in adverse judgment settlement fine penalty restitution disgorgement injunction or other relief in addition certain affiliate and subsidiary of citigroup are bank registered broker dealer future commission merchant investment advisor or other regulated entity and in those capacity are subject to regulation by various state and foreign security banking commodity future consumer protection and other regulator in connection with formal and informal inquiry by these regulator citigroup and such affiliate and subsidiary receive numerous request subpoena and order seeking document testimony and other information in connection with various aspect of their regulated activity from time to time citigroup and related party also receive grand jury subpoena and other request for information or assistance formal or informal from federal or state law enforcement agency including among others various united state attorney office the money laundering and asset recovery section and other division of the department of justice the financial crime enforcement network of the united state department of the treasury and the federal bureau of investigation relating to citigroup and it customer because of the global scope of citigroup operation and it presence in country around the world citigroup and related party are subject to litigation and governmental and regulatory examination information gathering request investigation and proceeding both formal and informal in multiple jurisdiction with legal regulatory and tax regime that may differ substantially and present substantially different risk from those citigroup and related party are subject to in the united state in some instance citigroup and related party may be involved in proceeding involving the same subject matter in multiple jurisdiction which may result in overlapping cumulative or inconsistent outcome citigroup seek to resolve all litigation regulatory tax and other matter in the manner management belief is in the best interest of citigroup and it shareholder and contest liability allegation of wrongdoing and where applicable the amount of damage or scope of any penalty or other relief sought appropriate in each pending matter inherent uncertainty of the matter disclosed certain of the matter disclosed below involve claim for substantial or indeterminate damage the claim asserted in these matter are broad often spanning multiyear period and sometimes wide range of business activity and the plaintiff or claimant alleged damage frequently are not quantified or factually supported in the complaint or statement of claim other matter relate to regulatory investigation or proceeding to which there may be no objective basis for quantifying the range of potential fine penalty or other remedy result citigroup is often unable to estimate the loss in such matter even if it belief that loss is probable or reasonably possible until development in the case proceeding or investigation have yielded additional information sufficient to support quantitative assessment of the range of reasonably possible loss such development may include among other thing discovery from adverse party or third party ruling by the court on key issue analysis by retained expert and engagement in settlement negotiation depending on range of factor such the complexity of the fact the novelty of the legal theory the pace of discovery the court scheduling order the timing of court decision and the adverse party regulator or other authority willingness to negotiate in good faith toward resolution it may be month or year after the filing of case or commencement of proceeding or an investigation before an estimate of the range of reasonably possible loss can be made matter to which an estimate can be made for some of the matter disclosed below citigroup is currently able to estimate reasonably possible loss or range of loss in excess of amount accrued if any for some of the matter included within this estimation an accrual ha been made because loss is believed to be both probable and reasonably estimable but reasonably possible exposure to loss exists in excess of the amount accrued in these case the estimate reflects the reasonably possible range of loss in excess of the accrued amount for other matter included within this estimation no accrual ha been made because loss although estimable is believed to be reasonably possible but not probable in these case the estimate reflects the reasonably possible loss or range of loss of december citigroup estimate that the reasonably possible unaccrued loss for these matter range up to approximately billion in the aggregate these estimate are based on currently available information available information change the matter for which citigroup is able to estimate will change and the estimate themselves will change in addition while many estimate presented in financial statement and other financial disclosure involve significant judgment and may be subject to significant uncertainty estimate of the range of reasonably possible loss arising from litigation regulatory and tax proceeding are subject to particular uncertainty for example at the time of making an estimate citigroup may have only preliminary incomplete or inaccurate information about the fact underlying the claim ii it assumption about the future ruling of the court other tribunal or authority on significant issue or the behavior and incentive of adverse party regulator or other authority may prove to be wrong and iii the outcome it is attempting to predict are often not amenable to the use of statistical or other quantitative analytical tool in addition from time to time an outcome may occur that citigroup had not accounted for in it estimate because it had deemed such an outcome to be remote for all of these reason the amount of loss in excess of amount accrued in relation to matter for which an estimate ha been made could be substantially higher or lower than the range of loss included in the estimate matter to which an estimate can not be made for other matter disclosed below citigroup is not currently able to estimate the reasonably possible loss or range of loss many of these matter remain in very preliminary stage even in some case where substantial period of time ha passed since the commencement of the matter with few or no substantive legal decision by the court tribunal or other authority defining the scope of the claim the class if any or the potentially available damage or other exposure and fact discovery is still in progress or ha not yet begun in many of these matter citigroup ha not yet answered the complaint or statement of claim or asserted it defense nor ha it engaged in any negotiation with the adverse party whether regulator taxing authority or private party for all these reason citigroup can not at this time estimate the reasonably possible loss or range of loss if any for these matter opinion of management to eventual outcome subject to the foregoing it is the opinion of citigroup management based on current knowledge and after taking into account it current accrual that the eventual outcome of all matter described in this note would not likely have material adverse effect on the consolidated financial condition of citigroup nonetheless given the substantial or indeterminate amount sought in certain of these matter and the inherent unpredictability of such matter an adverse outcome in certain of these matter could from time to time have material adverse effect on citigroup consolidated result of operation or cash flow in particular quarterly or annual period foreign exchange mattersregulatory action government and regulatory agency in the and other jurisdiction are conducting investigation or making inquiry regarding citigroup foreign exchange business citigroup is cooperating with these and related investigation and inquiry antitrust and other litigation in number of institutional investor who opted out of the previously disclosed august final settlement filed an action against citigroup citibank citigroup global market inc cgmi and other defendant captioned allianz global investor et al bank of america corp et al in the united state district court for the southern district of new york plaintiff allege that defendant manipulated and colluded to manipulate the foreign exchange market plaintiff assert claim under the sherman act and unjust enrichment claim and seek consequential and punitive damage and other form of relief in july plaintiff filed third amended complaint additional information concerning this action is publicly available in court filing under the docket number cv schofield in group of institutional investor issued claim against citigroup citibank and other defendant captioned allianz global investor gmbh and others barclays bank plc and others in the high court justice in london claimant allege that defendant manipulated and colluded to manipulate the foreign exchange market in violation of eu and competition law in december the high court ordered that the case be transferred to the competition appeal tribunal additional information concerning this action is publicly available in court filing under the case number cl in the high court and under the case number in the competition appeal tribunal in putative class of consumer and business in the who directly purchased supracompetitive foreign currency at benchmark exchange rate filed an action against citigroup and other defendant captioned nypl jpmorgan chase co et al in the united state district court for the northern district of california later transferred to the united state district court for the southern district of new york subsequently plaintiff filed an amended class action complaint against citigroup citibank and citicorp defendant plaintiff allege that they suffered loss result of defendant alleged manipulation of and collusion with respect to the foreign exchange market plaintiff assert claim under federal and california antitrust and consumer protection law and seek compensatory damage treble damage and declaratory and injunctive relief on march the court denied plaintiff motion for class certification on august the united state court of appeal for the second circuit denied plaintiff application seeking appellate review of the decision denying class certification additional information concerning this action is publicly available in court filing under the docket number cv cal chhabria cv schofield and cir in two application captioned michael higgins fx class representative limited barclays bank plc and cv cal donato interchange fee litigationbeginning in several putative class action were filed against citigroup citibank and citicorp together with visa mastercard and other bank and their affiliate in various federal district court and consolidated with other related individual case in multi district litigation proceeding in the united state district court for the eastern district of new york this proceeding is captioned in re payment card interchange fee and merchant discount antitrust litigation the plaintiff merchant that accept visa and mastercard branded payment card well various membership association that claim to represent certain group of merchant allege among other thing that defendant have engaged in conspiracy to set the price of interchange and merchant discount fee on credit and debit card transaction to restrain trade unreasonably through various visa and mastercard rule governing merchant conduct all in violation of section of the sherman act and certain california statute plaintiff further alleged violation of section of the sherman act supplemental complaint also were filed against defendant in the putative class action alleging that visa and mastercard respective initial public offering were anticompetitive and violated section of the clayton act and that mastercard initial public offering constituted fraudulent conveyance in the district court entered final judgment approving the term of class settlement various objector appealed from the final class settlement approval order to the united state court of appeal for the second circuit in the court of appeal reversed the district court approval of the class settlement and remanded for further proceeding the district court thereafter appointed separate interim counsel for putative class seeking damage and putative class seeking injunctive relief amended or new complaint on behalf of the putative class and various individual merchant were subsequently filed including further amended complaint on behalf of putative damage class and new complaint on behalf of putative injunctive class both of which named citigroup and related party in addition numerous merchant have filed amended or new complaint against visa mastercard and in some instance one or more issuing bank including citigroup and affiliate in the district court granted the damage class plaintiff motion for final approval of new settlement with the defendant the settlement involves the damage class only and doe not settle the claim of the injunctive relief class or any action brought on non class basis by individual merchant the settlement provides for cash payment to the damage class of billion later reduced by million based on the transaction volume of class member that opted out from the settlement several merchant and merchant group have appealed the final approval order on september the court granted the injunctive relief class plaintiff motion to certify non opt out class on october and the court issued ruling on several pretrial motion additional information concerning these consolidated action is publicly available in court filing under the docket number mdl brodie othersupervision and regulationciti is subject to regulation under federal and state law well applicable law in the other jurisdiction in which it doe business generalcitigroup is registered bank holding company and financial holding company and is regulated and supervised by the federal reserve board frb citigroup nationally chartered subsidiary bank including citibank are regulated and supervised by the office of the comptroller of the currency occ the federal deposit insurance corporation fdic also ha examination authority for banking subsidiary whose deposit it insures overseas branch of citibank are regulated and supervised by the frb and occ and overseas subsidiary bank by the frb these overseas branch and subsidiary bank are also regulated and supervised by regulatory authority in the host country in addition the consumer financial protection bureau regulates consumer financial product and service citi is also subject to law and regulation concerning the collection use sharing and disposition of certain customer employee and other personal and confidential information including those imposed by the gramm leach bliley act the fair credit reporting act and the eu general data protection regulation for more information on and foreign regulation affecting or potentially affecting citi see managing global risk capital resource and liquidity risk and risk factor above other bank and bank holding company regulationciti including it banking subsidiary is subject to regulatory limitation including requirement to liquidity risk based capital and leverage see capital resource above and note restriction on the type and amount of loan that may be made and the interest that may be charged and limitation on investment that can be made and service that can be offered the frb may also expect citi to commit resource to it subsidiary bank in certain circumstance citi is also subject to anti money laundering and financial transparency law including standard for verifying client identification at account opening and obligation to monitor client transaction and report suspicious activity security and commodity regulationciti conduct security underwriting brokerage and dealing activity in the through citigroup global market inc cgmi it primary broker dealer and other broker dealer subsidiary which are subject to regulation of the security and exchange commission sec the financial industry regulatory authority and certain exchange citi conduct similar security activity outside the subject to local requirement through various subsidiary and affiliate principally citigroup global market limited in london cgml which is regulated principally by the financial conduct authority and prudential regulation authority pra and citigroup global market japan inc in tokyo which is regulated principally by the financial service agency of japan citi also ha subsidiary that are member of future exchange and derivative clearinghouses in the cgmi is member of the principal future exchange and clearinghouses and citi ha subsidiary that are registered future commission merchant and commodity pool operator with the commodity future trading commission cftc citibank cgmi citigroup energy inc citigroup global market europe ag cgme and cgml are also registered swap dealer with the cftc for additional information see below cgmi is also subject to sec and cftc rule that specify uniform minimum net capital requirement compliance with these rule could limit those operation of cgmi that require the intensive use of capital and also limit the ability of broker dealer to transfer large amount of capital to parent company and other affiliate see capital resource above and note for further discussion of capital consideration of citi non banking subsidiary recent rule regarding swap dealer security based swapdealerson july the cftc adopted final rule establishing capital and financial reporting requirement for swap dealer that took effect in october in addition the sec ha adopted rule governing the registration and regulation of security based swap dealer the regulation include requirement related to capital margin and segregation ii record keeping reporting and notification and iii risk management practice for uncleared security based swap and the cross border application of certain security based swap requirement these requirement also took effect in november citibank cgml and cgme registered with the sec security based swap dealer transaction with affiliatestransactions between citi subsidiary depository institution and their non bank affiliate are regulated by the frb and are generally required to be on arm length term see managing global risk liquidity risk above competitionthe financial service industry is highly competitive citi competitor include variety of financial service and advisory company well certain non financial service firm citi competes for client and capital including deposit and funding in the short and long term debt market with some of these competitor globally and with others on regional or product basis citi competitive position depends on many factor including among others the value of citi brand name reputation the type of client and geography served the quality range performance innovation and pricing of product and service the effectiveness of and access to distribution channel maintenance of partner relationship emerging technology and technology advance customer service and convenience the effectiveness of transaction execution interest rate lending limit and risk appetite regulatory constraint and compliance and change in the business environment or societal norm citi ability to compete effectively also depends upon it ability to attract new colleague and retain and motivate existing colleague while managing compensation and other cost for additional information on competitive factor and uncertainty impacting citi business see risk factor represents unvested share based compensation award containing nonforfeitable right to dividend or dividend equivalent collectively dividend which are included in the earnings per share calculation using the two class method citi grant rsus to certain employee under it share based compensation program which entitle the recipient to receive non forfeitable dividend during the vesting period on basis equivalent to the dividend paid to holder of common stock these unvested award meet the definition of participating security under the two class method for calculating eps all earnings distributed and undistributed are allocated to each class of common stock and participating security based on their respective right to receive dividend pbwm personal banking and wealth managementpcd aligned finance in return on asset represents net income annualized divided by average asset for the period roce return on common equity represents net income le preferred dividend both annualized divided by average common equity for the period roe return on equity represents net income le preferred dividend both annualized divided by average citigroup equity for the period rotce return on tangible common equity represents net income le preferred dividend both annualized divided by average tangible common equity for the period rsu restricted stock unitsrwa risk weighted asset basel iii establishes two comprehensive approach for calculating rwa the standardized approach and the advanced approach which include capital requirement for credit risk market risk and operational risk for advanced approach key difference in the calculation of credit risk rwa between the standardized and advanced approach are that for advanced credit risk rwa is based on risk sensitive approach that largely rely on the use of internal credit model and parameter whereas for standardized credit risk rwa is generally based on supervisory risk weighting which vary primarily by counterparty type and asset class market risk rwa is calculated on generally consistent basis between basel iii standardized approach and basel iii advanced approach standard and poor global ratingsscb stress capital bufferscf subscription credit facility scfs are revolving credit facility provided to private equity fund that are secured against the fund investor capital commitment sec the security and exchange commissionsecurities financing agreement include resale repurchase security borrowed and security loaned agreement slr supplementary leverage ratio represents tier capital divided by total leverage exposure sofr secured overnight financing ratespes special purpose entitiesstandardized approach established through basel iii the standardized approach aligns regulatory capital requirement more closely with the key element of banking risk by introducing wider differentiation of risk weight and wider recognition of credit risk mitigation technique while avoiding excessive complexity accordingly the standardized approach produce capital ratio more in line with the actual economic risk that bank are facing structured note financial instrument whose cash flow are linked to the movement in one or more index interest rate foreign exchange rate commodity price prepayment rate or other market variable the note typically contain embedded but not separable or detachable derivative contractual cash flow for principal interest or both can vary in amount and timing throughout the life of the note based on non traditional index or non traditional us of traditional interest rate or index tangible book value per share tbvps represents tangible common equity divided by eop common share outstanding tangible common equity tce represents common stockholder equity le goodwill and identifiable intangible asset other than msrs taxable equivalent basis represents the total revenue net of interest expense for the business adjusted for revenue from investment that receive tax credit and the impact of tax exempt security this metric present result on level comparable to taxable investment and security tdr troubled debt restructuring tdr is deemed to occur when the company modifies the original term of loan agreement by granting concession to borrower that is experiencing financial difficulty loan with short term and other insignificant modification that are not considered concession are not tdrs tlac total loss absorbing capacitytotal acl allowance for credit loss which comprises the allowance for credit loss on loan acll allowance for credit loss on unfunded lending commitment acluc allowance for credit loss on htm security and allowance for credit loss on other asset total payout ratio represents total common dividend declared plus common share repurchase percentage of net income available to common shareholder transformation citi ha embarked on multiyear transformation with the target outcome to change citi business and operating model such that they simultaneously strengthen risk and control and improve citi value to customer client and shareholder unaudited financial statement and information that have not been subjected to auditing
